loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 52-year-old widow with three children: Sofia, 21 years old, Frengky, 20 years old and Asnat, 18 years old and working in Bali. Susana lives with Frengky’s family in Pukdale Village – Kupang District.

Prior to running a kiosk business. Susana worked in a rice field. Due to the fact that the harvest had to be shared with the landowner, Susana could only generate a small income and so decided to initiate a kiosk business at her house. With IDR 2,000,000 that she had, she bought some products to sell at her kiosk. As a widow, Susana has to work hard in her business to meet her family needs; moreover, she also needs to support her grandchild.

Currently Susana plans to sell ice cube and mixed ice at her kiosk but needs a refrigerator to produce them. She received information that TLM has assisted many small entrepreneurs in improving their businesses, so she is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 to purchase the refrigerator. Susana is hoping that TLM will approve her loan application.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to produce ice cube for sale

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A. is from the village of Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 32 years old. Cecilia is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Cecilia is starting a business venture. She will be operating a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She is just starting this business.

In 2009, Cecilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase variety of products such as can goods, shampoo, toothpaste etc. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Cecilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase variety of products such as can goods, shampoo,toothpaste for her retail store

loans.name: Norma's Group

texts.en:
Norma C. is from the village of Marapong, Sibutad. She is the leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Norma is 61 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are now adults. She works every day as a cultivator of her own farm. She plants assorted crops as her main source of income. She has been in this activity for more than 30 years with a monthly net income of 3,600 PHP.

In 2006, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Norma has successfully repaid a loan of PPH 12,000. She is now requesting a new loan of PHP 10,000 as her seventh loan, which will be used as start up capital to purchase rice to sell at retail.  

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Mujeres Forjadoras Group

texts.es: La Sra. Irma es divorciada  y tiene 3 hijos y tiene 54 años de edad , Irma es integrante de la alcancía comunal “ Mujeres Forjadoras” grupo conformado por 10 socios que se dedican a actividades de comercio, Irma  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de sabana, cubrecama y forro de mueble desde hace 24 años , este trabajo surge a raíz de ella no quería depender de su pareja ya que el no la dejaba trabajar y la trataba mal, es así que Irma se divorcio y tenia que mantener a tres hijos y puso su propio taller donde hoy en día confecciona,  Irma nos cuenta que nada fue fácil tuvo que tocar puertas y ofrecer sus confecciones pero gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación  a conseguido mejores ingresos económicos, una mejor calidad de vida, sus hijos tienen una buena educación y su hijo el mayor ya puso su propio negocio. El préstamo que  se le otorgo fue para comprar Ganado (vacas y toros) para luego venderlos  ya que es un nuevo negocio que piensa poner. Sabemos que Irma  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo la ayudaran.
texts.en: Ms. Irma is a 54-year-old divorced mother of three. She is a member of the Mujeres Forjadoras community bank, a group that is comprised of 10 members who own small businesses. Irma has been making and selling bed sheets, bedspreads, and slipcovers for a living for 24 years. She launched this business because she did not want to depend on her partner since he did not let her work and treated her badly. Consequently, Irma got a divorce and had to support her three children, so she set up the sewing shop in which she currently works. Irma states that it was not easy. She had to knock on some doors and sell her merchandise, but thanks to her dedication and efforts, she has managed to obtain better profits, a better quality of life, and a good education for her children. Her eldest son even has his own business now. This loan is for purchasing livestock (cows and bulls) so that she can sell them; this is a new business that she is planning on getting into. We know that Irma will reach her goals with her hard work and efforts, and that these Edaprospo loans will help her.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Virgie

Virgie B. is from the village of Punta, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 38 years old. Virgie is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Virgie owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling school products such pencils, pen and notebooks in the local community. Virgie has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Virgie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Virgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. 

Virgie is requesting a new loan of 32,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase products for her store. This will be the second loan taken out by Virgie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana K. is divorced with two children.  She is a farmer from Kamenka. Tatyana grows vegetables such as tomatoes and radishes. 

She owns two big greenhouses and one separate, spacious greenhouse for seedlings. Tatyana started this business 10 years ago. Currently, she has about 50,000 UAH invested in this business. Annually she spends about 15,000 UAH on seeds and polyethylene film. 

Tatyana is requesting a 10,000 UAH loan to purchase three rolls of polyethylene film to repair her greenhouse and to buy fertilizers for the upcoming sowing season. 

Tatyana enjoys learning new things. Currently she is studying in a local college of business and finance to get a degree and to learn some banking and financing principles. Tatyana’s elder son enrolled in a college and became a first year student. Therefore, she is hoping to generate additional income and save some money to help her son through college.

loans.use: to purchase three rolls of polyethylene film and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel T., from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental, is 35 years old, widowed and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Raquel owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products including fish such as sardines and mackerel in the local community. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Raquel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more mackerel, sardines, etc., she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman V. is a married man who earns a living by selling food at the food market in Drogobych town. Roman has been in this business for seven years.

 He explains that he enjoys selling food. His low prices, large assortment of goods, and excellent client service attract clients. Roman has many loyal customers that buy food from him all the time.
 
Roman is now seeking a loan in the amount of 7,500 UAH to purchase additional inventories at low prices now to sell them later during coming celebrations such as Easter, International Labor Day and Victory Day. He hopes to increase his sales and to make additional income as a result of the requested loan so that he can improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventories at low prices

loans.name: Vũ's Group

texts.en:
L. Vũ Thị (20203050128) is a 39-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 3 - Nhóm 17 (Nhóm 17).

L. is married and has 2 adult children. She owns and operates a livestock business, raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month.

In 2010, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 7.392.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be her 2nd loan from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her livestock business.

2.  Nguyễn Thị C. (0) is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.

3.  Nguyễn Thị B. (0) is a 47-year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her livestock business.

4.  Trương Thị H. (0) is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.

5.  Trương Thị H. (0) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

6.  Trương Thị H. (0) is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her livestock business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Vũ Thị (20203050128) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 3 - Nhóm 17 (Nhóm 17).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị C. (0) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  Nguyễn Thị B. (0) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Trương Thị H. (0) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


5.  Trương Thị H. (0) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


6.  Trương Thị H. (0) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm C. phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Sol Radiante De Huaycan Group

texts.es: La Sra. Mercy  es conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar, Mercy  es integrante de la alcancía comunal “Sol Radiante de Huaycan” grupo conformado por 9 socios que se dedican a actividades de comercio, Mercy  trabaja en su propia librería donde vende lápiz, cuadernos, papel, utiles de escritorio,  desde hace un año, este trabajo surge a raíz de ella quería darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y a su vez conseguir mejores ingresos ya que  su pareja gana sueldo mínimo.  Mercy  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación  se ha comprado artefactos   y su hijo estudia en un colegio privado. El préstamo que  se le otorgo fue para comprar mercadería  para implementar su negocio. Sabemos que Mercy  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo la ayudaran.
texts.en:
Mercy lives with her partner and has one school-age child.  She is a member of the 'Sol Radiante de Huaycan' (Brilliant Sun of Huaycan) community bank.  This group has nine members who all work in commerce.  Mercy works in her own stationery store where she sells pencils, exercise books, paper and office supplies.  She has been in this business for one year.  She started her business because she wanted to provide a better quality of life for her son and also make better income because her partner earns minimum wage.

Thanks to her effort and commitment, Mercy has been able to buy small appliances and her son studies in a private school.  She was granted a loan to buy merchandise to stock her business.  We know that Mercy will accomplish her goals with a lot of work and effort and that Edaprospo's loans will help her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Sari Makmur Group

texts.en:
Ni Komang A. S., 27 years old, is chairman of the Sari Makmur group. The 10 members are applying for their second loan with a total of Rp. 15,000,000.  

Ni Komang A. S. has a loan of Rp. 1,500,000 which she will use to buy two pigs. With the remainder, she will renovate the pigpen. The price for one piglet is Rp. 350,000. After her first loan period she made a profit of between Rp. 200,000 and Rp. 250,000. This profit has been used for daily needs and the rest saved. She hopes the next loan can be greater and the loan period can be extended.

loans.use: To buy two pigs and use the rest to renovate the pigpen.

loans.name: Jerose

texts.en:
Jerose C. is from the village of Farmington, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 21 years old. Jerose is married and has one infant child. 

To make a living, Jerose owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business specifically in beauty salon. Jerose has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jerose joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Jerose is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials for her Beauty Salon services. This will be the first loan taken out by Jerose from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her Beauty Salon Business

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie B., from the village of Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte, is 51 years old, married, and has two grown children. To make a living, Rosie has been making and selling a variety of food products in the local community for over 10 years, earning approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Rosie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 3000 PHP to purchase more inventory and use as working capital, she plans to supplement the family's income with the additional revenue generated from the business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Rosito

texts.en:
Mr. Rosito A. is from the village of Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 61 years old. Rosito is married and has one adult child. 

To make a living, Rosito owns and operates a tailoring business. He has been engaged in his business for over 41 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In April 2010, Rosito joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Rosito has successfully repaid a loan of 15,000 PHP. He is now requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase cloth for dress making. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for the future use and loan repayment.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for dress making

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María tiene 47 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar, cuenta con  casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el distrito de Túcume, a 35 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de crianza y  comercialización  de animales, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 15 años, el negocio esta situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres quienes también se dedican a la misma actividad.  Además se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de chicha, bebida tradicional del departamento de Lambayeque.
 
María desea comprar  aves menores para engorde, alimento balanceado para aves y cerdos, esto permitirá ampliar su negocio y de esta manera percibir mayores ingresos.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old, married, and has one school-age child.  She owns her own home which is located in Túcume district, 35 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque department.

María raises and sells animals.  She has been in this business for 15 years and runs it from her home.  She learned the business from her parents who carried out the same work.  In addition to this, María makes and sells chicha (a corn-based drink) which is traditional in Lambayeque department.

María would like to buy some young birds to fatten and also some balanced feed for her birds and pigs.  This will enable her to expand her business and thereby make more income.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy young birds to fatten and also balanced feed

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José tiene 32 años de edad, reside con su familia en Cerco Quemado, ubicado en el distrito de Motupe.  Este distrito se caracteriza por la fe religiosa que profesan sus pobladores y se ubica a 1 hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

José se dedica a la venta de ropa para varones, mujeres y niños.  Él es muy conocido en Motupe, y cuenta con clientela bastante fidelizada quienes acuden a comprar siempre a su establecimiento.  Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los invierte en sus gastos personales y los de su familia.

José desea comprar más mercadería para poder venderla posteriormente.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
José, 32, lives with his family in Cerco Quemado located in Motupe District.  This district is noted for the religious faith practiced by its inhabitants and is located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Department’s capital.

José sells clothing for men, women and children.  He is very well known in Motupe and has quite a few regular customers who always come by his establishment to buy.  He uses income generated from this activity to cover his personal expenses and those of this family.

José wants to buy more merchandise for subsequent sale.  Because of this he’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Elenida

texts.en:
Elenida D. is 54 years old, married and has three grown children. She is from the village of Sta. Isabel, Dipolog City. 

Elenida owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 a month.

In 2005, Elenida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living conditions. Elenida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP.

Elenida is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a parcel of land which will be use as residential lot and for their new hog raising business. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a parcel of land 300 sq. meters lot for her residential lot and for her hog raising business

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es:
Estanislao tiene 34 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su familia, dicha casa está ubicada en el Caserío Los Boliches, perteneciente al distrito de Olmos, a 2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza la crianza de ganado ovino, esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 8 años. Cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos. Los ovinos cuando alcanzan tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona.

Estanislao anhela que su ganado alcance el peso y tamaño adecuado para venderlo, con los ingresos comprar más ganado y engordarlo, es por ello que quiere comprar alimento balanceado.  Sin duda lo logrará, es sabido que los pobladores de Olmos son gente emprendedora y pujante.  Para lograr su objetivo, Socorro ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Estanislao, 34, is married and has three children in his care.  He lives in his own house with his family located in Los Boliches hamlet which belongs to Olmos District, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Department’s capital.

He raises sheep, a business he’s been in for over 8 years.  He has appropriate, spacious corrals.  When the sheep reach ideal size and weight he sells them in the local market.  He has a well established local customer base.

Estanislao hopes that his livestock will reach size and weight adequate for sale.  With income earned he will buy more livestock to fatten up.  Because of this he wants to buy nutritionally balanced feed.  He will undoubtedly reach his goal because residents of Olmos are enterprising, vigorous people.  To reach his objective, he’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos.  ResiD. junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a labores ligadas a la agricultura.  Actualmente tiene cultivos D. limón, el cual una vez cosechado lo venD. a sus vecinos y comerciantes que visitan la zona. Raquel es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora, son estas características que le han permitido lograr todo lo que tiene a la fecha. Los ingresos que percibe los invierte en su familia.

Raquel desea comprar abono y fertilizantes para sus terrenos D. cultivo, es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo D. 2000 nuevos soles D. Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Raquel, 57, is married and has two children.  She lives with her family in the farming TambogranD. District, an agricultural zone located in Piura Region over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region’s capital.

She does farming related tasks.  She’s currently farming lemons which, once harvested, are sold to her neighbors and to merchants that tend to visit the area.  Raquel is an enterprising, hard working person.  These characteristics have maD. it possible for her to attain all she has to date.  Income she earns is invested in her family.

Raquel would like to buy manure and fertilizer for her fields so she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to do so.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa S. is married with two children. 

She sells children's clothing at the local market. Raisa has been in this business for eight years. Long experience and optimism help Raisa to maintain good sales. Moreover, children's clothing is always in demand.

Raisa is requesting a loan of 12,000 UAH. She would like to purchase inventories for her second business location that she started recently. This gives her a competitive advantage in attracting more clients and increasing sales.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for the second business location

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y tiene 1 hijo.  Jorge reside junto a su familia en el distrito de La Matanza, el cual pertenece a la Región Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Jorge se dedica al servicio de mototaxi, que es un vehículo que consiste en una moto y una cabina para transportar personas.  Su unidad está en buen estado y operativa, pero es necesario hacerle mantenimiento para mantener esta operatividad. Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus gastos personales y los de sus padres.

Jorge desea comprarse un terreno para construir allí su casa y pueda habitar con más comodidades con su familia.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Jorge, 40, is married and has a son.  He lives with his family in La Matanza District which belongs to Piura Region and is four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region’s capital.

Jorge provides transportation services with his mototaxi, a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin to transport people in.  His vehicle is in good working order but needs servicing to stay that way.  Income he earns covers his and his parents’ personal expenses.

Jorge wants to buy a lot to build his house on so that he can live more comfortably with his family.  Because of this he’s thought it convenient to obtain a 1500 new sol loan.

loans.use: to buy a vacant lot.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastián tiene 47 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposa.  Sus hijos son mayores de edad y no viven con él., su vivienda esta ubicado en un centro poblado del distrito de La Victoria. En el centro poblado ya tienen energia electrica y agua potable, ya que la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura como a la crianza y venta de animales y necesitan de este servicio para poder realizar sus actividades diarias.

Sebastián se dedica  a trabajar como peón agrícola, con una antigüedad de más de 06 años de experiencia, el trabajo que realiza es en las zonas aledañas donde vive. Los ingresos que percibe por su trabajo le permite mantener a su casa y su familia. 

Sebastián desea construir  horno de panadería que le permita producir pan y obtener más ingresos, así como techar parte de su vivienda.  Para lograr sus objetivos ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Sebastián is 47 years old and lives in his own home together with his wife.  His children are grown up and no longer live with him.  Sebastián's home is located in a village in La Victoria district.  The village has access to electricity and drinking water as most of the inhabitants farm or raise and sell livestock and they need this service in order to be able to carry out their daily activities. 

Sebastián works as an agricultural laborer.  He has more than six years experience in this line of work.  He works in neighboring areas and uses the income he makes to support his house and family.

Sebastián would like to build a bread oven which will allow him to bake bread and make more income.  He would also like to roof part of his home.  In order to achieve his goals, he has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to build a bread oven

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María  tiene 52 años de edad, es casado y tiene 1 hijo.  María reside junto a su familia en el distrito de La Matanza, el cual pertenece a la Región Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

María  se dedica a la venta de chicha y harina de maíz.  La chicha es una bebida que tomaban nuestros ancestros, la cual nos dejaron como herencia histórica.  Esta bebida es de muy buen sabor, lo que hace que la gente la consuma y prefiera. Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus gastos personales y los de sus padres.

María desea comprar más maíz y poder preparar más chicha, venderla y aumentar sus ingresos.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María, 52, is married and has a son.  She lives with her family in La Matanza District which belongs to Piura Region and is located four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region’s capital.

María sells chicha (beverage made from corn) and corn flour.  Chicha is a beverage that was consumed by our ancestors and which has come down as an historical legacy.  It has a very good flavor which causes it to be preferred and consumed by people.  Income she gets is used to cover her and her parents’ expenses.

María wants to buy more corn to prepare more chichi to sell and increase her income.  Because of this she’s thought it convenient to get a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Dana Kerti Group

texts.en:
Jro Ayu Putu P. A. is getting a second loan from MUK. The loan will be used to buy three piglets, which will be maintained for six months. 

Because the price of the special quality of feed needed is quite expensive, Jro Ayu Putu P. A. will feed the pigs with a combination of feeds, partly the good quality feed together with various types of leaves  that she can find in her garden.

Jro Ayu Putu P. A. has a dream of developing a bigger business raising pigs. With the profits she gets, she will build an additional stall to raise more pigs.

loans.use: To buy three piglets.

loans.name: Maria Bertha

texts.es:
María  tiene 39 años  de edad, de estado civil conviviente. Vive con su cónyuge y sus 03 hijos en una casa propia, la cual está ubicada en San Luis, el cual es un caserío pequeño rural que pertenece al distrito de La Victoria, en la provincia de Chiclayo. Sus actividades principales en dicho caserío son lla agricultura ,  crianza de animales de engorde y actividades artesanales.

La actividad que realiza es la crianza y venta de patos, cuenta con 10 años de experiencia. Cliente cría los patos en su corral, además cría pollos, pavos entre otros animales. Su cónyuge trabaja en la venta de helados. Ambos con los ingresos que perciben aportan a la economía familiar.

María necesita comprar calaminas para arreglar sus corrales, y tener más seguro a sus animales. .  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María, 39, lives with her spouse and three children in her own house located in San Luis which is a small, rural hamlet belonging to La Victoria District in Chiclayo Province.  Its main activities are farming, raising livestock and handicrafts.

Her activity is raising ducks for sale; she has 10 years experience.  She raises the ducks in a corral and also raises chickens and turkeys, among other animals.  Her spouse works as an ice-cream vendor.  With their two incomes they support their family.

María needs to buy sheets of plywood to repair the corrals and provide more security for the animals.  Because of this she’s deemed it convenient to obtain a 500 new sol loan.

loans.use: to buy sheets of plywood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She is married to a mason and he supports the family financially. She lives in a rental house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
Beatrice has operated a charcoal selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passers-by. She also operates a local brew sales business, which contributes as another source of income. In her business, she faces the major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, the supply of charcoal is lower than the demand hence she cannot meet customer demand in the market. Beatrice dreams of building her own permanent house in the future.
With her loan of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase 30 sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 30 sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny P. is from the village of Victoria, Alicia, Isabela. She is 46 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Jenny owns and operates a service-based business providing motorcycle repair services to local community members. Jenny has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2005, Jenny joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Jenny is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be her seventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia  is from the village of ZNAC, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 54 years old. Arsenia is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Arsenia owns & operates a business venture in snack vending. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Arsenia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arsenia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arsenia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from PMPC.  Arsenia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending in the local community. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Arsenia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Shaker

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children.

In 2007, Shaker opened a block factory. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a generator. He aspires to develop his work and to earn more income to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator.

loans.name: William Ntina

texts.en:
William Ntina N., 43 years old, is a resident of Olokurto-Narok,Kenya. He is married and blessed with four children. He is a wheat farmer, a business he has been running for the last seven years. 

He learned about KADET through a credit officer of KADET. This is his first loan from  KADET which he plans to use to buy wheat seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to generate profit and use it to add a number of acres to his plantation and start a livestock business.


His dreams are to buy and build on plots of land and to provide a better standard of living for his children. He is a conscientious man who can achieve more if funded.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tikosh Ole

texts.en:
Tikosh ole K. , aged 44 years, is married and has six children. He lives in NAROK, Kenya. He has been in farming for the last twelve years. 

 
He is a humble client. He learned about KADET through other clients registered with  KADET LTD in his  area. This will be his third loan from KADET LTD and he intends to spend it preparing the land for farming.


His anticipation for the profit generated is to plough it back into the farm since he dreams of being a big farmer. He can do more if provided with resources.

loans.use: to prepare the land for farming.

loans.name: Joebel

texts.en:
Mrs. Joebel B. is from the village of Baybay Triunfo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Joebel is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Joebel owns and operates a mini-grocery and restaurant business. Joebel has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Joebel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joebel has successfully repaid a loan of 35,000 PHP. Joebel is now requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to buy additional grocery stock. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, loan repayment and education of her children.

 About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery stock.

loans.name: Freda Cita

texts.en:
Freda Cita A. is from the village of San Pedro, Alicia, Isabela. She is 31 years old. Freda Cita is single. To make a living, Freda Cita owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling children's products such as toys & games in the local community. Freda Cita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Freda Cita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Freda Cita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Freda Cita is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Freda Cita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital for her store.

Marilou R. is from the village of San Pedro, Alicia, Isabela. She is 32 years old. Marilou is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Marilou from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Shamil

texts.ru: Shamil B. 23 qoda. On jenat i imeyet odnu dochku. Shamil jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i lubimoy dochkoy. Shamil uje 2  qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom on razvodit korov. Tak kak u neqo bizness noviy on imeyet maloye kolichestvo korov poetomu on seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya uvelicheniya molochnoqo produkta kotoroye on pradayet v magazini dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Shamil B. is 23 years old. He is married and has one daughter. Shamil lives in the Absheron region together with his wife and beloved daughter. Shamil has been doing animal husbandry and breeding cows for two years now. Because it's a new business he has a small number of cows and this is why he now needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to increase milk products which he sells to the stores.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Novemar

texts.en:
Novemar B. is 31 years old and married with two school-aged children. He is from the village of Barangay 17, Gingoog City. To make a living, Novemar owns and operates a mini-restaurant. His main source of income comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers such as adobo, caldereta, and afritada in the local community. Novemar has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

Novemar joined HSPFI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices, and vegetables. This is Novemar’s first loan with HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his loan to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as meat, spices, and vegetables

loans.name: Dominic Ole

texts.en:
Dominic Ole T. is 33 years old and married with one child. For the past two years, he has been in the animal trading business in Narok town. Dominic earns a monthly income of 4,000 KES. He is an industrious man who works hard to achieve his objectives.

Dominic was introduced to KADET LTD by the KADET staff in his area. He is applying for his first KADET loan of 30,000 KES to purchase goats and sheep to sell at a profit. Dominic desires to become a famous businessman in the area and give his child a higher level of education. He intends to use the returns from his loan to expand his business and repay his loan.

loans.use: to purchase goats and sheep to sell

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo tiene 48 años de edad. Vive con su pareja y un hijo en el distrito de Olmos, en un caserío cerca de Olmos, una zona agrícola bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino y caprino. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace muchos años. Conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuando sus animales ya han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso, los vende a los negociantes que suelen visitar las zonas. Cuentan con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Eduardo solicita un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y alimento balanceado. Con esta inversión, podrá aumentar sus ingresos  mejor cubrir sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Eduardo, age 48, lives with his wife and son in the in the district of Olmos in a small village near Olmos, a rather busy agricultural zone in Lambayeque Province. He is situated more than one hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Eduardo raises and sells sheep and goats. He has been in this business many years. He is very knowledgeable in this field. When his animals have reached a good size and weight, he sells them to merchants who visit the area. He has a well established clientele.

Eduardo is applying for a loan of 100 new soles in order to purchase more animals and balanced feed. With this investment he will be able to increase his income and better cover his family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock and balanced feed.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita A. is 44 years old and married with three adult children. She is from the town of Baligatan, Ilagan, Isabela. For the past 15 years, Carmelita has been selling fish at the market. She earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month. 

Carmelita joined ASKI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. This will be her first loan with ASKI. Carmelita plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Giovanna Del Pilar

texts.es: Giovanna tiene 26 años de edad y es soltera sin hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres la cual está ubicada en el Caserio Chacupe Bajo, un caserío pequeño rural que pertenece al distrito de La Victoria, una zona unos 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Aun no tiene servicios básicos de agua y luz. Las actividades principales en dicho caserío son la agricultura,  crianza de animales de engorde y actividades artesanales. Giovanna se dedica a la venta de leche que obtiene de las vacas propias que posee. Tiene mas de 06 años de experiencia en este negocio. Sus principales clientes son vendedores minoristas en su mismo caserío. Mientras dirige su negocio, Giovanna también estudia en la universidad. Con los ingresos de su negocio, ella puede solventar sus gastos universitarios. Solicita un crédito para comprar una computadora la cual le servirá para realizar sus estudios universitarios y mejorar su desempeño escolar. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). Este es su segundo préstamo y ella canceló el primer con puntualidad. Agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por el apoyo que le brinda en sus estudios.
texts.en:
26 year-old Giovanna is single and doesn't have any children.  She lives in her parents' home in the village of Chacupe Bajo.  This is a small, rural village which is located in La Victoria district, 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.  Giovanna's village still doesn't have access to basic services of water and electricity.  The main business activities in this village are farming, raising livestock and making handicrafts.

Giovanna sells milk which she obtains from her cows.  She has more than six years experience in this business.  Her main customers are retailers in her own village.  While she is running her business, Giovanna is also studying at university.  She uses the income from her business to cover her university expenses.

Giovanna is requesting a loan to buy a computer which she will use for her university work and in order to improve her educational performance.  She has requested a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa (a Kiva Field Partner).  This is her second loan and she repaid her first loan on time.  She is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support that they are providing her with in pursuing her studies.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her university studies

loans.name: Muneria Ole

texts.en:
Muneria Ole S. is 40 years old and the married father of four children. For the past five years, Muneria has been a farmer. His monthly income is 8,000 KES.

Muneria was introduced to KADET LTD by a client and is applying for his third loan. He is requesting 30,000 KES to buy farm supplies and prepare his land for planting. Muneria is a hardworking man who aims high and works to achieve his goals. He plans to reinvest the anticipated profit from his loan into his farm and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and prepare land for planting

loans.name: Wimer

texts.es: Wimer tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 2 hijos. Vive junto a su familia en el distrito de La Matanza, ubicado en la provincia de Morropon, en el norte de Perú. Gana la vida trabajando en el campo y en las chacras de su caserío. Con los ingresos de sus trabajos, el puede solventar sus gastos familiares. Wimer solicita un préstamo para invertir en la educación de sus hijos. Ahora que la temporada escolar ha comenzado, desea usar su crédito para pagar sus gastos escolares. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). Edpyme Alternativa le ofrece el crédito a una tasa más baja que otras entidades y prestamistas informales. Con el préstamo, Wimer puede continuar a trabajar tranquilo y solventar sus gastos familiares sin perjudicar su liquidez diaria. Por ello, Wimer les agradece mucho a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Wimer, 33, is single and has two children.  He lives with his family in La Matanza District located in Morropon Province in northern Perú.  He earns his livelihood working in the countryside and on his hamlet’s farm plots.  With income from his jobs he’s able to cover family expenses.

Wimer is asking for a loan to invest in his children’s education.  Now that the new school term has started he wants to use his loan to pay their educational costs.  Because of this he’s thought it convenient to request a 500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

Edpyme Alternativa offers him a loan at a lower interest rate than other informal lending entities.  With the loan, Wimer will be able to continue working worry free and cover family expenses without damaging daily liquidity.  Because of this, Wimer thanks Kiva lenders very much for their support.

loans.use: to pay for his two children's school costs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita M. is 46 years old and married with three school-aged children. She is from the village of San Pedro, Alicia, Isabela. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a general store. Her main source of income comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. 

Teresita joined ASKI in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teofilo tiene 45 años de edad. Vive en casa propia junto a su pareja y su  hijo en el caserio de Mocape, cerca de la ciudad de Olmos, una zona agrícola bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Vive en la parte rural del distrito y no cuenta con servicios básicos de agua y luz. Teofilo se dedica a la comercialización de pescado en el mercado local. También se dedica a la venta de animales menores como ganado ovino, caprino, aves de corral y chanchos. Desea ampliar su ganado con la compra de más animales para criar y vender y alimento balanceado. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).
texts.en:
Teófilo, 45, lives in his own house with his spouse and son in Mocape hamlet near the city of Olmos, an agricultural zone that’s quite commercial and belongs to Lambayeque Province and is located over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. He lives in the rural part of the district and does not have the basic utilities: water and electricity.  

Teófilo works selling fish at the local market.  He also sells small farm animals like: sheep, goats, pigs and barnyard fowl.  He wants to expand the livestock business buying more animals to raise and sell and also buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.  Because of this he’s thought it convenient to request a 500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to buy more livestock and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
Princess B. is 24 years old and married with an infant child. She is from the town of Osmena, Ilagan, Isabela. Princess owns and operates a frozen-food selling business. She has been engaged in her business for almost one year and earns 2,000 PHP a month.

Princess joined ASKI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase the raw ingredients she needs to make products for sale. This is the first loan taken out by Princess from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve and expand her business.


About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make products for sale

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa A. is 21 years old and single with an infant child. She is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. To make a living, Jessa owns and operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes primarily from buying and selling phone cards (electronic loads) and cell phone cases in the local community. Jessa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. 

Jessa joined HSPFI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional electronic loads for several networks. This is Jessa’s first loan with HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve and expand her business.


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase phone cards (electronic loads) to sell

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni tiene 32 años de edad. Vive junto a su pareja y cinco hijos menores en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Tiene más de dos años  en su negocio. Compró su mototaxi al contado con dinero en efectivo. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de CDs y videos de música cristiana en un puesto ambulante en el mercado de Olmos. Ambos se apoyan mutuamente para brindarles una buena vida a sus hijos. Sus negocios han sido creciendo. Han podido usar sus ingresos para mudarse de una casa alquilada a su casa propia. Marleni desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y solicita un préstamo para arreglar y mantener su mototaxi. Con los arreglos, podrá seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por el apoyo que le brindan.
texts.en:
Marleni is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and five young children in the district of Olmos, a rather busy agricultural zone in Lambayeque Province. She is situated more than one hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Marleni transports passengers in her mototaxi, a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle and a compartment in which passengers ride. She has had this business for more than two years. She paid cash for her mototaxi.

Her husband is engaged in the sale of CDs and Christian music videos from a mobile booth in the Olmos market. They both support one another mutually in order to offer their children a better life. Their businesses are growing and they have been able to use their earnings to move from a rented house into their own home.

Marleni wants to continue investing in her business and is applying for a loan to repair and maintain her mototaxi. With the repairs she will be able to continue offering good service to her customers. She is thankful to Kiva lenders for the support offered to her.

loans.use: to repair and maintain her mototaxi in good condition.

loans.name: Taporu Ole

texts.en:
Taporu Ole K. is 44 years old and married to Elizabeth K.. They have five children. For the past ten years, Taporu has been a farmer. Farming is a good profession in his area due to favorable local conditions. Taporu’s monthly income is 5,000 KES.

Taporu learned about KADET LTD through KADET staff outreach. He is applying for his first loan with KADET for 50,000 KES to buy farm supplies. Taporu has never borrowed money from a microfinance institution before. He is an honest man who will achieve much if he receives financial support.  Taporu plans to use the proceeds from his loan to expand his farm.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita D. is 44 years old and married with four school-aged children. She is from the town of Baligatan, Ilagan, Isabela. To make a living, Angelita owns and operates a general store. Her main source of income comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Angelita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,200 PHP a month. 

Angelita joined ASKI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This is Angelita’s first loan with ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ranel

texts.en:
Ranel A. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. He is 31 years old. Ranel is married and has 1 adult children. To make a living, Ranel owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" services to local community members. Ranel has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Ranel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ranel is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ranel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.es

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service.

loans.name: Blanca Irene

texts.es: Blanca tiene  30 años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa de padres en la zona rural del distrito de Mochumi en el norte de Perú. Solo cuenta con el servicio básico de luz, no de agua potable. Su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado de 30 familias. Gana la vida vendiendo abarrotes, productos de primera necesidad y recargas de teléfonos móviles. Ademas, ofrece el servicio de peluquería. Estas actividades las realiza desde hace 03 años. Su negocio está situado en su domicilio. Emprendió este negocio ante la escasez de oferta de abarrotes y recargas asi como también de peluquería en su comunidad. Estudió cosmetología en Lambayeque,  es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Es muy conocida y cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona y en zonas aledañas. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de más abarrotes para surtir su bodega y atender todas las necesidades de la comunidad. Con esta inversión, podrá generar mayores  ingresos en el corto plazo. Blanca tiene muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. Ya ha manejado préstamos y demuestra puntualidad en pagar sus obligaciones. Su negocio muestra muy buena rentabilidad debido a que el costo de producción es muy bajo. Agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por el apoyo que le brindan en seguir creciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca, 30, is single.  She lives in her parents’ house in the rural part of Mochumi District in northern Perú.  She only has electricity, not potable water.  Her community is small; it has approximately 30 families.  She earns her living selling groceries, basic need items and mobile phone recharges.  She also provides barbering services.  She’s been in these activities for three years.  Her business is located in her home.

She started the business because groceries, mobile phone recharges and barber services were unavailable in her community.  She studied Cosmetology in Lambayeque, that is to say, she knows the occupation to perfection.  She is very well known and has an established customer base in the zone and from surrounding areas. 

She will use the loan to buy more groceries to stock the store and meet all her community’s needs.  With this investment she’ll be able to generate higher income in the short run.  Blanca has very good personal and work-related references.  She has handled loans in the past and she’s shown herself to be punctual with her repayments.  Her business is having good profitability because production costs are low.  She is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they provide her to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma A. is from the village of Tayong, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Alma is separated from her spouse and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, biscuits, shampoo, soap & bread in the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Alma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods.

loans.name: Aydin

texts.ru: Aydin M. rodilsya v 1988 qodu. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Aydin projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. U Aydina semya bednaya i on starayetsya rabotat mnoqo chtobi pomogat semye. Mladshaya sestra Aydina uchitsya v kolledje, yeyo uchebu toje oplachivayet Aydin. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye zapchasti dlya toqo chtobi pochinit svoyu mahsinu. On uje 3 qoda kak rabotayet taxistom. U neqo mahsina staraya i poetomu chasto nujdayetsya v pochinke , a koqda mashina ne rabotayet on ne mojet zarabativat dostatochno dlya pomoshi svoyey semye.
texts.en: Aydin M. was born in 1988. He is not married and doesn't have children. Aydin lives in the Absheron region together with his family. Aydin's family is poor and he tries to work a lot to help his family. His younger sister is studying in college, Aydin pays for her tuition too. At this time he needs 2300 AZN to buy necessary spare parts to fix his car. He has been working as a taxi driver for three years. His car is old and needs to be repaired often, because when his car is not working he cannot make enough money to help his family.

loans.use: to buy necessary spare parts for the car

loans.name: Trương

texts.en:
Sự Trương Thị (20203050050) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 3 adult children. Sự owns & operates a food production and sales business, primarily selling pork products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month.

In 2009, Sự joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Sự has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7.840.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase  some kitchen equipment to make her business more qualified to attract more customers to come. She is now requesting a new loan of 8.736.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to make improvements to her house.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Sự Trương Thị (20203050050) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, Sự Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ T.t heo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Sự thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Sự kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, Sự đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.
