Sự đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.736.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Sự dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  tu bổ nhà cửa của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase  some kitchen equipment

loans.name: Magno

texts.es: Magno tiene 34 años de edad y es casado con 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia junto a su familia en el Distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua y luz. Se dedica a la agricultura, teniendo plantas limón, a las cuales los cosecha semanalmente. También se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y aves corral, los cuales una vez que alcanzan un tamaño y peso ideal los vende en el mercado local. Cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en estas actividades. Cosecha su cultivo de limo en un pequeño terreno que es propio. El destino del crédito será para la compra de fertilizantes y agroquímicos para su cultivo de limón que mejorará la calidad y cantidad de los frutos. También desea comprar alimentos balanceados para su ganado. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1600 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Magno is 34 years old and married with 2 children. He lives in his own house with his family in Tambogrande district, an agricultural zone located in Piura province, more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. Magno resides in the rural portion of the district and lacks  both water and electrical services.

Magno is a farmer who grows lemon trees and picks them weekly. Also, he raises sheep and poultry. Once they reach the desired size and weight, he sells them in the local market. Magno counts on his 5 years of experience in these activities. He harvests his lemons on a small plot of land he owns.

The purpose of the loan is to purchase fertilizers and agrochemicals for cultivating his lemons and improving the quality and the harvest. Also, Magno pans to buy feed for his sheep. For this reason, he found it expedient to request a loan of 1,600 new sols through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: TO BUY FERTILIZER AND AGROCHEMICALS FOR CULTIVATING LEMONS AND, ALSO, FEED FOR HIS SHEEP

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To rebuild and enlarge his shop.

loans.name: Bakhtigul

texts.ru: Норматова Бахтигул проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 24 года. Она не замужем. У нее среднее образование. Живет вместе с родителями. Ее брат находится заграницей на заработках. Сама Бахтигул занимается торговлей, она в основном продает разные ткани. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже два года. Кредит берет для покупки тканей. То есть для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Bakhtigul N. lives in the Shahrituz region. She is 24 years old. She is not married. She has secondary education and lives with her parents. Her brother is now working abroad. Bakhtigul is in retail, she mainly sells different kinds of fabrics. She has been in this business for two years. She is taking out the loan to buy fabrics and to increase the variety.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace B. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 26 years old. Mary Grace is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Grace owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing pedicure & manicure services to local community members. Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Mary Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Grace is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed like nail polish and brushes. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Mary Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed like nail polish and brushes.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica S. is from the village of Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 52 years old. Monica is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Monica owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Monica has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

Monica joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Monica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Monica is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Monica from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.

location.town: Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Umju

texts.en: Umju  is currently in the business of selling charcoal. She is 25 years old, married, with four children and three of them go to school. Umju took out a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to open a shop with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma S. is from the village of Panghiawan, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Thelma is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Thelma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap & beverages, especially soft drinks, in the local community. Thelma has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Thelma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thelma is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional beverages & canned goods. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Thelma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional beverages & canned goods.

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
B. Nguyễn Thị (20203050116) is a 22-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong -  Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 1 infant. B. owns & operates a furniture making business where she makes and sells general household furniture to local businesses and community members.  B. has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month.

In 2009, B. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. B. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.496.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offering. B. is now requesting a new loan of 7.840.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This will be her 3rd loan from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


B. Nguyễn Thị (20203050116) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong -  Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 1 trẻ ở độ tuổi nhỏ.  Để kiếm sống, B. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  B. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, B. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, B. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  B. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  B. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo B. biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay B.  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old and married. He lives with his wife and two other family members, both of whom work. 

In 2009, Hussein opened his own shop for accessories; he sells women’s clothing and accessories. He has a long experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2100 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He aspires to develop his work and to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Imeda

texts.en:
Imeda is 24 years old and lives with his younger brother and mother in the village of Gantiadi, Adjara region. Both brothers are hard workers, but they work in different fields. Imeda’s brother works in a local company, while Imeda is heading the agricultural activities in the family. He has a tangerine garden with an area of 1500 sq meters. Also, he grows different types of vegetables. Harvested fruit and vegetables are sold locally. Along with the above-mentioned activities, Imeda has a pond, where he grows locally widespread species of fish. Starting from the spring season the fish will start to spawn and he will re-start intensive sales of them. 

With the requested amount he wants to purchase feed for his fish. He hopes that the price of fish will not go down and his income will be enough to make some improvements in the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed for fish.

loans.name: Rosita Dumalte's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosita D., 56 years of age, married, is a resident of P6 Montol, Ozamiz City. Rosita is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rosita D.’s Group. 

Rosita is married to Lurenio D., a farmer, and blessed with eight children, five married and three also adults. To help her husband in supporting their family, she decided to engage in a root-crop sales business with major crops like sweet potato, "ube", "gabi", carrots and "lutya". For 25 years already, she has been able to manage this business  and now she is earning an average net income of not less than P 2,000 a month which is very helpful to their family income. She is requesting an amount of P 7,000 as her 2nd loan to add to her capital for her existing root crop business. The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions for her family, to meet their basic needs and save for future use, especially for her children’s education.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for additional capital to buy and sell root crops.

loans.name: Ney

texts.es:
Ney tiene 40 años D. edad. Es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia,  que está ubicada en el caserío Peñarol  en el distrito D. TambogranD., una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia D. Piura, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque. Vive en la parte rural D. este distrito y no cuentan con los servicios básicos D. agua y energía eléctrica. 

Ney se dedica a la crianza D. ovinos y vacunos así como aves D. corral como pavos y gallinas, los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realizan desD. hace más D. 6 años en la parte posterior D. su casa. El destino del crédito será para la compra D. alimentos balanceados para el engorD. D. los ovinos, vacunos y aves D. corral, para que logren un tamaño y peso ideal para venderlos a un mejor precio. Con esta inversión, Ney podrá seguir creciendo en su negocio y aumentando sus ingresos. Con sus ganancias, Ney ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico D. su familia. Agradece a los prestamistas D. Kiva por su apoyo en crecer su negocio y ofrecer una mejor calidad D. vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ney is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in her own home which is located in the village of Peñarol, in TambogranD. district.  This is an agricultural area of Piura province, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.  Ney lives in the rural part of this district where they do not have access to basic services of water and electricity.

Ney's business is raising sheep and cows, and also poultry such as turkeys and hens.  She raises and fattens the animals and then sells them in the local market.  She has been in this business for more than six years and raises the animals in an area behind her home. 

Ney will use this loan to buy balanced feed to fatten her sheep, cows and poultry so that they reach an ideal size and weight.  She will then be able to sell them for a better price.  Through this investment, Ney will be able to continue growing in her business and increasing her income.  She uses her profits to help her husband to financially support their family.

Ney is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they give her in growing her business and providing her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten her livestock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth S. is from the village of Catibac, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Elizabeth is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling green bananas & coconuts in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas & coconuts. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas & coconuts.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and has one child.

In 2005, Karim opened a bookshop. He sells all the school supplies. He has much experience in this field and has a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,100 loan to enlarge his bookshop. He is aiming to expand his business so he can improve his family's quality of life

loans.use: To enlarge his bookshop.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, age 35, earns a living by selling bread. She and her husband, who works as a policeman, have seven children, all of whom are enrolled in school. 

Christine has requested a loan in order to stock more bread to offer for sale. She hopes eventually to build a house for the family with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more bread to offer for sale

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 55 years old.  She is married and has 3 children who are in school.  Catalina is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  She has a bamboo trading business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.  

Catalina has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more bamboo to sell.  In the future, she would like to renovate her family home and save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college..

loans.use: purchase more bamboo to sell

loans.name: Mae Ann

texts.en:
Mae Ann owns and operates a dry goods sales business. She and her husband have two children and she works hard to help support her family. 

Mae Ann has requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy an Envirofit cookstove. This will make the firewood that she buys last longer because the Envirofit stove needs less fuel in order to cook food. Mae Ann is aware that by using the Envirofit, she is not only saving money but is also helping the environment, as well as reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy an Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Haidee

texts.en:
Haidee runs a fishing business. She and her husband have two children and she works hard to help support her family.

Haidee has requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she knows she will save money by being able to use the dried wood from her surroundings as firewood. Haidee is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money but is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros A. is 52 years old and married with 1 child.

Milagros works hard to provide for her family. She runs a party supplies business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional supplies of party accessories to sell.

Milagros has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the party supplies business for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending and tailoring.

Milagros aspires to save money to expand her business and purchase a gas range.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of party acessories to sell

loans.name: Attiyeh

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has three children.

In 2005, Attiyeh opened his own shop to sell mobile phones and phone accessories. He has five years of experience in this field and he has a good reputation, He is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to renovate his shop and enlarge it. He is aiming to expand his business so he will be able to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and enlarge it.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen C. is a 57-year-old widow with six children.

Carmen works hard to provide for her family. She sells plastic and glassware in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her business.

Carmen has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for 30 years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Carmen aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional plastic and glassware.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila tiene 38  años y es madre soltera de un hijo. Vive en casa de padres en la cual está ubicada a tres minutos del centro de la ciudad de Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. Zoila gana la vida brindando el servicio de costura. Zoila confecciona blusas,  pantalones, vestidos de fiesta, polos, carteras y otros tipos de ropa y accesorios. Cuenta con clientela fidelizada ya que tiene 05 años de experiencia en el rubro. Zoila desea invertir su crédito en la compra de una máquina recubridora, con la cual tendrá mejores acabados en la confección de polos. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Con esta inversión, Zoila podrá seguir ofreciendo un servicio de alta calidad. Con los ingresos de su negocio, cuida a su hijo y solventa sus gastos familiares. Zoila ha manejado otros préstamos y ha pagado sus cuotas con puntualidad.
texts.en:
Zoila, 38, is a single mother of one son.  She lives in her parents’ house located three minutes from downtown Lambayeque in northern Perú.  Zoila earns her livelihood working as a Seamstress.  She makes blouses, pants, party outfits, polo-style shirts, purses and other types of clothes and accessories.  She has a base of regular customers because she has 5 years experience in this line of work.  

Zoila wants to use her loan to buy a cover stitch sewing machine that will produce better finishings on the polo shirts.  Because of this she’s thought it convenient to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  With this investment Zoila will be able to continue to offer a high quality service.

With income from her business she cares for her son and covers family expenses.  Zoila has had loans in the past and has paid her installments punctually.

loans.use: to buy a covers stitch sewing machine.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 30, is a charcoal vendor. She and her husband have three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. 

Elizabeth has requested a loan in order to stock more charcoal to offer for sale. In the future, she hopes to build up her business with her extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert M., age 58, owns and operates a confectionery business. He lives in Sevan with his wife and son, and Albert’s whole family contributes to the business, which consists of preparing and selling confectionery. Three years ago, Albert equipped a spot in the yard of his own house as a place for his new business endeavor. Before that, he worked as a builder in Russia, but then he decided to come back to his native land and start his family business. 

At this point, his product is very popular in the entire Gegharkunik marz, whose centre is Sevan city. Albert provides many shops and school buffets with his confectionery, and while he was pleased that his business had expanded, he experienced difficulty delivering his product to such a large region. Therefore, with his first Kiva loan, Albert was able to buy a minibus for providing customers with his fresh products on time.  

Albert intends to diversify his product, so he is currently asking for a 600.000 AMD loan in order to buy the necessary equipment for the production of salty stick confectionery.

loans.use: to buy the necessary equipment for the production of salty stick confectionery

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran O. and his wife Nunu live in the village of Taniaantpari, Kartli Region. They have two adult sons and an 8-year-old daughter. Amiran works in a local construction company, but this job is seasonal and not reliable. During the whole year he is busy with family agricultural activities. In particular, the O. family have two milk cows and sell their dairy products in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). Besides that, they have a plot of land with an area of 1.25 ha, where they grow maize, potatoes and haricot beans. Part of the grains and vegetables are consumed in the family and the other part is sold locally.

With the requested credit Amiran plans to purchase an additional milk cow. The family will be able to sell more dairy products and increase their income. The increase in the income will be reinvested in further development of the family dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow.

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en: Ma. Corazon, who is a 40-year-old married mother of six children, works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as toothpaste, sugar, groceries, etc. Ma. Corazon has thus far borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF and aspires to save money to expand her business. She has been running the sari sari store for seven years and also earns an income from food vending.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, age 31, is a vendor of tea. She and her husband have five children, three of whom are enrolled in school. 

Victoria has requested a loan in order to stock more tea to offer for sale. In the future, she hopes to build a shop with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more tea to offer for sale

loans.name: Susanita

texts.en: Susanita, who works hard to support her family, is married and has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines for 20 years now. She is requesting a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for fishing boat repairs and more fish to sell. In the future, Susanita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing boat repairs and more fish to sell

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.en:
Raymunda is a tailor. She and her husband have five children, and she works hard to help support the family. 

Raymunda requested a PHP 1,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy an Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family. Raymunda is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money but is also helping the environment, as well as reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To buy an Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel N. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is married and has four children.  Two of his children are currently in school.  Emmanuel has a tailoring business, which he has had for four years.         

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more materials for making clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Emmanuel hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Emmanuel hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to make clothes for resale.

loans.name: Trương

texts.en:
H. Trương Thị (20203050052) is a 29-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children. H. owns & operates a livestock business, raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month.


In 2009, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.496.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. H. is now requesting a new loan of 7.840.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be her 3rd loan from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay her children's tuition fees.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Trương Thị (20203050052) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  thanh toán tiền học phí của con của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, age 48, has been selling fuel on a retail basis for the past eight years. He started with 800,000 shillings and the business is steadily growing. He now has a working capital of two million shillings. He faces the challenge of the current state of inflation in the country, which has resulted in high fuel prices. His desire is eventually to have a petrol station. 

George and his wife have five children. The family lives in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. George is charged with the responsibility of supporting the family, and his dream is to educate his children up to the university level.

George intends to use his loan to buy fuel to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy fuel to offer for sale

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses M., age 27 and unmarried, has worked as a farmer for the past four years. His monthly income is KES 9,000, with which he supports his parents. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a KADET staff member and is now applying for  his first loan with the organization. He plans to use his loan to buy essential farm inputs. 

With the profits generated he plans to expand his farming efforts and to expand into a livestock-keeping business.

He dreams eventually to be rich. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more despite his limited resources.

loans.use: to buy essential farm inputs

loans.name: Kakoro

texts.en: Kakoro is currently in the business of selling fruits and vegetables. She is a 39-year-old widow, with 3 children, two of whom go to school. Kakoro borrowed a loan to stock more fruits and vegetables to sell. She hopes to build a house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Hermosa

texts.en:
Hermosa T., 50, aims for completeness in life.  Hermosa completed college and is single.  Together with her brother Robert, she manages her ornamental plants business and oversees an operation of renting out all party needs. They live in Pooc 2, Silang, Cavite, Philippines.

Hermosa has been raising and selling all kinds of flowers and ornamental plants for 10 years now.  She raises ornamental plants and flowers which are normally present at Filipino home gardens. She serves hobbyists, offices, schools and her local community.  Along with this business, she also manages a party rentals business.  She rents out tables, chairs, and balloons for parties. Every month, Hermosa earns an estimated net income of around 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

To help her continue operation of her businesses, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan.  She plans to use this to pay for additional sacks of fertilizers for her flower and ornamental plants farm.  She also intends to use part of this loan to buy new materials for her party rentals business.

Hermosa desires a successful business, a healthy body, and a peaceful and happy life. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group’s weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for flowers and other ornamental plants

loans.name: Mepukori Ole

texts.en:
Mepukori Ole N., aged 38, is married to Nadutari and has three children. He has been farming on his piece of land for the past ten years and earns a monthly income of 4,000 KES.

He has been a good client. He applied his third loan with KADET with which he plans to purchase farm supplies. He hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children and expand his farming. He dreams to prosper in farming to provide a better life to his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella N. lives in the Nakulabye neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has no children.  Angella has a bar.  She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Angella sells her products at home, by wholesale and retail.

Angella has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin.

The main business challenges for Angella include defaulters and the rainy season because she works in a muddy area. Angella lives in a home that has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz P. lives in the village of Mukhrani in Kartli Region. He is married and lives with his wife, children and parents. Tamaz’s wife works as teacher in a kindergarten. Tamaz has three children: 7- and 5-year-old sons and a 4-year-old daughter. 

Tamaz is a joiner and likes his trade. He often gets orders to design different types of furniture. Along with this, he is also heading the small farm in the family. They have two milk cows and two pigs. They sell dairy products in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). Also the family produces and sells different types of pickled vegetables (marinades). With the requested credit Tamaz will expand the dairy farm. With the first half of the credit, Tamaz will purchase additional milk cows to get more milk and sell more dairy products. The second half will be used to pay for vegetables, to be pickled and sold. The increase in their income will be used for expansion of the pig-farm.

loans.use: for purchase additional milk cows and paying for vegetables to pickle for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is currently in the business of selling bricks. She is 35 years old, married, and has 7 children all of whom got to school. Mary took out a loan to stock more bricks to sell. She hopes to build a shop in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more bricks to sell

loans.name: Trương

texts.en:
H. Trương Thị (20203050054) is a 27-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children. H. owns & operates a furniture making business where she makes & sells general household furniture to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month.

In 2009, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.496.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offering. She is now requesting a new loan of 7.840.000 VND which will be used to purchase tools & other equipment to expand the business. This will be her 3rd loan from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Trương Thị (20203050054) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa pH..  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua dụng cụ & thiết bị khác để mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase tools & other equipment to expand the business

loans.name: Heriyono

texts.en:
Heriyono, a 44 -year-old man is living in Buraen Village with his wife - Sri and 4 children, namely: 
-	Titin who is 17 years old and in the 2nd grade of senior high school
-	Nurti who is 15 years old and in the 3rd grade of junior high school
-	Ayu who is 10 years old and in the 4th grade of elementary school, and 
-	Sadewo who is 4 years old.

Heriyono is working as a freelance mechanic for vehicles and diesel engines. He worked in a repair shop in East Timor for 12 years. Having gained experience from his previous employer in East Timor, Heriyono tried to use his skills by offering service for vehicles and diesel engines. Being a freelance mechanic doesn’t always provide Heriyono with a sufficient and stable income. This situation then him to operate a kiosk business as an alternative income source; moreover his children are growing up and will require more money for their education needs.  

To deal with the difficulty that he faced, Heriyono got information on TLM’s lending program. He is interested in joining the program and requesting a loan of  5,000,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) from TLM. He would like to purchase items for his kiosk such as instant noodles, soaps, shampoo, snacks, herbs, etc. He really hopes that TLM will assist him so he can provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase instant noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bulls for resale

loans.name: Kabende Tukwatanize Group

texts.en:
James is a member of Kabende Tukwatanize group, which literally means "we should cooperate" and as a group policy each member has to guarantee the other in accessing a loan. 

James is 32 and lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a number of businesses including tailoring and charging phones. He is also the headmaster of a secondary school. James has been in service for 6 years and he is still doing well despite challenges in finance and bad debts. Nonetheless, he dreams of setting up a tailoring school in the next 5 years. James wants to buy a tailoring machine his portion of the loan.

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Jean works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Jean is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. Jean has been sustaining her business activities with her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream – to save enough money so she can send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Trương

texts.en:
H. Trương Thị (20203050055) is a 34-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, H. owns and operates a business making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. H. has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,496,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase machinery to expand the business.  H. is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Trương Thị (20203050055) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua máy móc để mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials

loans.name: Kimir Ene

texts.en:
Kimir Ene L. is 33 year old, married and has 2 children. She has been farming on her own piece of land for the last 6 years, with a monthly profit margin of 5,000 KES. 

She learned about KADET from the KADET staff. She paid the previous loans well, and has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD, which she would use to purchase agricultural inputs.


She hopes to use the profit generated from the loan to expand farming. She dreams of educating her children to a higher level. She is a hard-working woman who puts a lot of effort into her work.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
Prescilla is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Prescilla has been in this business for 10 years. Prescilla earns more income from food vending.

Prescilla has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
N. Hadjah lives in the Nabulagala neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members.  Hadjah has a business selling fish.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. 

Hadjah sells her products in a shop, retail. Hadjah  has requested  a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more fish. The main business challenge for Hadjah is seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are expanding her business.   

Hadjah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of fish.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. Nenita is married and has a Soft Shell Craft  business in the Philippines.

Nenita is borrowing PHP 1,800  through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family.

Nenita is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove,she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase an Envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Riza works hard to support her family.  She has a crab business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending & food vending.  Riza is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase more crabs to sell for her business.

Riza has sustained her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more crabs to sell

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Florinda works hard to support four children. She is a widow and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Florinda requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to save money by using dry wood she can pick from her surroundings.

Florinda is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase an Envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima works hard to support five children. She is married and has an aqua-farming business in the Philippines.

Fatima requested a PHP 1,500 loan through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to avoid future lung diseases resulting from continued toxic smoke inhalation.

Fatima is also aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To buy an Envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice N. is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Alice has a drug shop, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more medicine for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Alice hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food for the family.  In the future, Alice hopes to expand her drug shop business.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Shella

texts.en:
Ma. Shella works hard to support her family. Ma. Shella is married and has a firewood sales business in the Philippines.

Ma. Shella is borrowing PHP 1,500  through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to make the firewood that she buys last longer because the Envirofit stove needs less fuel to cook food.

Ma. Shella is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove,she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To buy an Envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
N. Lucy lives in the Ndeeba neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.

 Lucy has a business selling spare parts.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Lucy sells her products in a shop, retail.    

Lucy   has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of spare parts.The main business challenges for Lucy   include seasonality and ever increasing rent prices.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing spare parts from Japan. 

Lucy lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of spare parts.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 65 years old and married with seven children. Mercedita works very hard to provide for them.

Mercedita runs a General Store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sugar, groceries, etc in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Mercedita has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as oil, noddles, sardines, etc. In the future Mercedita would like to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy additional items for her general store.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina N. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has four children.  Three of her children are currently in school.  Amina has an outside catering business, which she has had for six years.         

To help expand her business, Amina has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more cooking oil for making chapatti for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Amina hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food for her children.  In the future, Amina hopes to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil to make chapatti for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John S. is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children.  One of his children is currently in school.  John has a business selling charcoal, which he has had for three years.         

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, John hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child.  In the future, John hopes to expand his business and to also own another business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia  is 28 years old, married to Morris, and they have two children between ten and four years. She operates a retail shop in Sultan Hamud trading center. This is her primary business and she has been running it for four years. 

This is her fourth loan from KADET LTD.  She has not borrowed from other financial institutions apart from KADET.  Cicilia hopes that she will be able to add more stock and grow the business substantially.

She hopes to grow her business so that she will be able to complete the construction which had begun on her business premises.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, maize flour, grains, rice, and other food items.

loans.name: Esnas

texts.en:
Esnas is a single mother of one child, who attends school. They own a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transportation costs. For the past six years, she has operated a hand bag business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also operates a beauty salon, and sells shoes and clothes for another source of income. 

Esnas's business has improved greatly and she now dreams of selling at wholesale in the future. With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase bales of hand bags for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of hand bags for sale.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael M. is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Michael has a metal workshop, which he has had for over 10 years.         

To help expand his business, Michael has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more metal materials for the work shop for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Michael hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Michael hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more metal materials for the workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sand, ballast, and blocks

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam N. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has two children.  Both of her children are currently in school.  Zam has a business selling eggs at a wholesale price, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Zam has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more trays of eggs for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Zam hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Zam hopes to own another business.

loans.use: to purchase more trays of eggs for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. lives in the Bwaise neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (orphans).  Mary has a business selling chicken feed.  She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Mary sells her products in a shop.    

Mary has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of maize bran and fish  The main business challenges for Mary include seasonality and ever increasing prices of maize bran and fish .  Her goals for her business are to start raising chickens.   Mary lives in a home that she rents.   She has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food, and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of  maize bran and fish

loans.name: Mansura

texts.ru: Mansura M. 38 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v shkole. Mansura yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. Ona uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit kuric i utok dlya uvelicheniya i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Mansura M. is 38 years old.  She is married and has two children who go to school.  Mansura is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her loving family.  She has been poultry farming for five years.  Now she needs 2300 AZN to buy chickens and ducks to enlarge and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and ducks

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison K. has been a farmer for the last eight years. He is 30 years old, married and a father of three children.

He learned about KADET LTD from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area.  This is his third loan from KADET, and he plans to spend it on farm supplies.

He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm. His dreams are to be the best, and best-known, farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cereals to sell.

loans.name: Gulbibi

texts.ru: Уринова Гулбиби проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 53 года. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Её муж находится в России. Сама она имеет среднее образование. Она уже 13 как занимается растениеводством. При доме у нее имеется участок земли, где она сеет пшеницу и выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит просит для закупа семян, чтобы посеять и получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Gulbibi U. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 53 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is in Russia. She has a secondary education. She has been working in agriculture for thirteen years.  At her home, she has a plot of land where she sows wheat and grows vegetables for sale. She is taking out a loan to buy seeds to sow so that she will reap a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year-old married man from Lebanon, living with his wife and three school-aged children. He has acquired 24 years of experience working in his own car repair shop. His work is specialized in painting cars and performing the needed repairs on them.  Because of his loyalty, this talented man has been able to build a very good business reputation during his professional career.  In parallel, he has worked as a car dealer since 2008, purchasing both used and new cars in order to sell them to customers at good prices after doing the needed maintenance on them. We note that he is the main income source of the family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new mechanical tools and equipment in order to make his work much easier and so as to be able to serve more customers which will in return provide him with superior income. In the future, he is planning to rent a showroom where he will continue his car trading business properly.

loans.use: to buy new mechanical tools and equipment.

loans.name: Priscillah Wambui

texts.en:
Priscillah has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 15 years. She is 48 years old, married to Stephen M.. and they have four children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan. She repaid for her previous loan of Kshs 14,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Priscillah hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jeina

texts.en: Jeina is currently in a business of selling bread and charcoal. She is 40 years old, married, with 8 children and all of them go to school. Jeina borrowed a loan to stock more bread and charcoal to sell. She hopes to build a concrete house in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more bread and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elma

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Ma. Elma works hard to support her family.   She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling herbal medicine.  Ma. Elma is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase an additional stock of breads for her food vending business.

Ma. Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17th loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of bread to sell

loans.name: Mary Nyambura

texts.en:
Mary has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town most of her life. She is 28 years old, married to James G.. and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan. She repaid her previous loan of Kshs 15,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Mary hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a married man with six children, all of whom are adults. They own a house that has electricity but not piped water. In addition he also owns rental houses which contributes to his income. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past twenty years Mohamed has operated a wholesale coconut-selling business. He sells to retailers at the market and to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to sell more coconuts and build more rental houses in the future. With the Kshs 30,000 he is requesting, he wants to pay for installation of electricity in his rental houses. He decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To pay for installation of electricity in his rental houses.

loans.name: Daniel Kariuki

texts.en:
Daniel has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 23 years.  He is 73 years old, married to Mary Wambui.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers and this will be his fourth loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Daniel hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sheep to rear for wool production.

loans.name: Nancy Mugure

texts.en:
Nancy has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 22 years.  She is 48 years old, married to Onesmus M., and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field staff and this will be her second loan.  She repaid her previous loan of Kshs 10,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Nancy hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Murman

texts.en:
Murman lives in the village of Kokotauri, Keda district. He is married and has two children – a 15-year-old son and an 11-years-old daughter; both of them go to school. Murman’s family consists of six persons – Murman, his wife Natela, their two children, Murman’s sister and his father, who is retired. 

The total income of the family is 1000 Laris per month. A small part of this amount is the social assistance given to the Z. family by the Georgian government, as a family living below the poverty line. The biggest part of their total income comes from agricultural activities. In particular: three milk cows, the dairy products of which are sold locally. Besides, they have a plot of land with an area of 1 ha, where vegetables are grown. Also the family grows different types of fruit, which is sold locally. 

With the requested amount Murman plans to build a small greenhouse, where vegetables will be grown. This will allow Murman to grow more and better quality vegetables and sell them, which will be positively reflected in the family income and family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Mpeki Selewa

texts.en:
Mpeki Selewa L. is 29 years old, married and has one child. He has been a wheat farmer for the past seven years and earns a monthly income of KES.1000.

He found out about KADET, LTD., through a registered client, and he has applied for his third loan of KES.45,000 from KADET LTD.   He plans to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers. 

He hopes to make a profit and use it to purchase sheep for fattening. He dreams that, at the age of thirty, he will be stable and his children will live better lives.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nushaba

texts.ru: Nushaba M. 37 let. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Nushaba zamujem i imeyet 2 detey , odin iz kotorix uchitsya v kolledje druqoy v shkole. Nushaba seychas nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa. Ona uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. On delayet yogurt, kefir i prodayet u sebya doma.
texts.en: Nushaba M. is 37 years old.  She in an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her family. Nushaba is married and has two children.  One child goes to college and the other to school.  Nushaba needs 2300 AZN to buy a cow to expand her business.  She has been raising cattle for seven years.  She makes yogurt and kefir and sells it from her home.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. Her husband is a businessman, and he supports his family with his earnings. 

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling Lesos (African women's attire) and cloth.  She sells from door to door to her neighbors and passersby, especially women.  Riziki dreams of establishing a shoe business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of cloth and Lesos for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth and Lesos for sale.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha B. is from Tawi-Tawi, Aloran, Mis Occ. She is 33 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store and a hog-raising business. She has been engaged in this business for three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to buy other pigs. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used for additional capital for her business. This will be the first loan taken out by Juditha B. from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living standards of her family. 

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more pigs

loans.name: Teresia Wambui

texts.en:
Teresia has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 20 years.  She is a 40 year-old, single mother of two children.

She was introduced to KADET, LTD., by one of our field staff, and this will be her second loan.  She repaid her previous loan of Kshs 10,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Teresia hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Fritzee

texts.en:
Fritzee P. is from Manabay, Ozamiz City. She is 26 years old and single.  She runs a direct selling activity in the local community especifically beauty products. She has been engaged in this business for three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fritzee has successfully repaid her first loan. She is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase beauty products for her direct selling business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Fritzee P. from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living standards of her family. 


About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products for her direct selling business

loans.name: Uzokjon

texts.ru: Хакимов Узокчон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 41 год. Он женат, имеет двоих детей. У него среднее образование. Уже три года как он занимается растениеводством. При доме он имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Целью кредита является покупка земли и семян. Он хочет расширить свою деятельность для того чтобы получить больше прибыли.
texts.en: Uzokjon H. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 41 years old, married, and has two children. He has a secondary education. He has been working in agriculture for three years. He has a plot of land at home where he grows vegetables. He is taking out a loan to buy land and seeds. He plans on expanding his business to bring in a greater profit.

loans.use: to buy land and seeds

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is currently in a business of selling bread. She is 30 years old, with 3 children.  Only one of them goes to school. Regina requested a loan to stock more bread to sell. She hopes to buy a motor cycle with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell.

loans.name: Parsinante  Ole

texts.en:
Parsinante Ole P. is 28 years old, married, and has two children.  He has been a potato farmer for the past five years.

He learned about KADET, LTD.,  through an advertisement done by KADET staff. He has applied for his third loan of KES.60,000 from KADET, LTD., with which he plans to buy potatoes for planting and also chemicals for spraying. 

He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to plow back into the farm. He is an honest man who will be able to achieve if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for planting and also chemicals for spraying

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Jejaymar

texts.en:
Jejaymar S. is from the village of Langcataon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 21 years old. Jejaymar is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Jejaymar owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop selling products for daily use, such as shampoo, soap, & toothpaste.  Jejaymar has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.
