In 2010, Jejaymar joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jejaymar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  Jejaymar is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jejaymar from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Bok Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOK JOM est créé le 26 août 2009. Il est composé de 16 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elles on monter leur groupe par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de DAGATH

Madame KHOUD. S. (debout à l'extrême droite du groupe sur la photo avec une écharpe verte claire) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de sa petite fille. 

Elle fait du petit commerce de légumes. Elle a une bonne maîtrise de cette activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle s'approvisionne au marché centrale de la ville de Louga. Et comme activité secondaire elle fait de l'embouche ovine.
texts.en:
The lending group BOK JOM was created on 26 august 2009, and is comprised of 16 women from the same village who met either through being neighbors or family ties. The group is part of the Village Bank DAGATH.

Mrs KHOUD. S. (the woman standing on the far right of the photo wearing a green scarf) is the leader of the group. She is 49 years old, married, and with six children. She is also caring for her granddaughter. 

She has been selling vegetables for a living for more than 20 years, and is thus quite efficient at this business. She stocks up on vegetables at the central market in the village of Louga. She is also involved in the fattening of sheep as a second income-generating activity, she is also

loans.use: Purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jomar

texts.en:
Mr. Jomar S. is from the village of Gotocan Daku, Ozamiz City. He is 33 years old, married, and has one infant child. To make a living, Jomar owns and operates a motorcab business, picking up passengers in the local community. Jomar has been engaged in his business for three years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In December 2010, Jomar joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve both his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. 

Jomar is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to fully finance and repair for his motorcab. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family and to save for future emergencies.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to fully finance and repair for his motorcab.

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She has operated a retail shop, for the past three years, in the market, whereby passersby and neighbours are her potential customers. Her husband is a shop keeper and he helps his wife in the shop. 

Mwanapili faces a major challenge in the high cost of paying the business permit license. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of rice, beans and coconuts to sell. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, beans and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and a chuffcutter.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela R. is from the village of New Bethlehem, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 46 years old. Marcela is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Marcela owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Marcela has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Marcela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marcela is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products for her retail store. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Marcela from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products for her retail store.

location.town: New Bethlehem, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Mary Wanjiru

texts.en:
Mary, 56 years old, has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past four years. She sells her products at the local market. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and on time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Mary hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Norabel

texts.en:
Norabel P. is from the village of Kimanait, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Norabel is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Norabel owns & operates a business, selling snacks & other delicacies like halo-halo, rice & cassava cakes in the local community. Norabel has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Norabel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Norabel is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like milk, sugar & food flavorings. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Norabel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed like milk, sugar & food flavorings.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina T. is from the village of Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 41 years old. Crispina is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Crispina owns & operates a business  selling specialty food products in the local community. Crispina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Crispina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Crispina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Crispina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Crispina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Hojiakbar

texts.ru: Бекманов Хочиакбар житель Яванского района. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Живет вместе с родителями. Жена, домохозяйка. Брат находится в России. Сестра, работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам он занимается животноводством, он в основном разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. В этой области два года. Кроме того он занимается изготовлением окон и шкафов из дерева. Целью кредита является закуп скота.
texts.en: Hojiakbar B. lives in the Yavan area.  He is 25 years old, married, and has one child. He lives with his parents. His wife is a housewife. His brother is in Russia. His sister works on a small farm.  He works in animal husbandry.  He basically raises cattle at home for resale. He has been doing this work for two years. He also works making windows and wardrobes from wood.  He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Sop Sa Aladji Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SA ALADJI est créé depuis l'inauguration du Banc Villageois DAGATH qui l'abrite (26 août 2009) . Le groupe est composé de 15 femmes qui sont toutes issues du village. Elles sont unies par des liens de voisinage et d'affinité. 

Madame MAREME N. D. (debout tout à fait à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 04 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés soit par des parents ou des proches.

Elle est vendeuse de petit déjeuné. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 05 ans. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle pourra renforcer son activité de vente de petit déjeuné en augmentant son niveau d'approvisionnement en lait, café, sucre, pain, etc. 

Son objectif est de faire croitre ses bénéfices afin de mieux participer à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The lending group SOP SA ALADJI was created at the same time as the Village Bank DAGATH was established (26 August 2009). The group comprises 15 women who are from the same village, united through family and neighborhood ties.

Mrs Mareme N. D. (standing up on the far right of the photo) is the leader of the group. She is 40 years old, married, and the most of 6 children. She is also taking care of four other children, responsibility for them was given to her by their parents or close family members.

She has been selling breakfast foods for more than five years. 

She is hoping to use this loan to improve her business of selling breakfast by purchasing larger quantities of milk, coffee, sugar, bread, etc. Her goal is to increase her profits in order to better take care of her family.

loans.use: Purchase provisions for the sale of breakfast

loans.name: Charles Kimani

texts.en:
Charles has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 20 years. He is 32 years old, married to Julia Wanjiku and they have one child.  

Charles was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fifth loan. He has repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the new loan amount to buy a chaff cutter. In the future, Charles hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married. He has an 8-year-old daughter and a 3-year-old son. He lives in Ivano-Frankivsk. Oleg runs an egg hatching business along with his wife and father in law. He started this family business only 2 years ago. Oleg manages to combine the egg-hatching business with the transportation services that he offers, as a taxi driver in free hours, and his regular job of a chef in a local restaurant called ‘Vulik’ (‘Beehive’).   

Oleg is requesting a 15,000 Grivnya loan to purchase 20,000 eggs and hatch them in his incubator. He admits that he is only learning all the tricks of the breeding business. However, Oleg is willing to continue expanding the trade by turning it into another successful course of his entrepreneurial activity. He is hoping his hatching and incubating venture will continue to grow and bring a stable income to he and his family, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 20,000 eggs and to hatch in the incubator.

loans.name: Cerlina

texts.en:
Cerlina D. is from the village of Malipayon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Cerlina is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Cerlina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily canned goods, junk foods, biscuits, shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Cerlina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 5000, Cerlina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cerlina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Cerlina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, beverages & junk foods. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Cerlina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, beverages & junk foods.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married with a grown son. She lives in the small town of Privetnoye, Ukraine. Valentina is a farmer and grows vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, cabbage, onions and beets. She first tried her luck farming twenty years ago. Currently, she has already invested about 80,000 UAH in this enterprise.

Valentina is seeking a loan of 15,000 UAH. She is planning to spend 3,000 UAH on fertilizers, 3,000 UAH on seeds, 5,000 UAH on wood, 3,000 UAH on a drip irrigation unit and 1,000 UAH on polyethylene film. She is going to cultivate 20,000 tomatoes, 20,000 peppers, 50,000 cabbage heads, 100,000 onions and 5 tons of beets.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, plastic film, seeds, wood and a drip irrigation unit

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah M. is married; her husband is a driver, and they have two children aged thirteen years old and twenty-four. She describes herself as determined, honest and trustworthy.

Milkah ‘s family lives near the busy Kongowea market in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites including the Indian ocean’s white beaches.

Milkah sells clothes and shoes to the local people. She has been in this business for the last nine years and works very hard to keep her business going well. She says that this business is profitable, but her major problem is financial constraints. She is using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy more clothes to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to diversify someday and open her own pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza V. 38, is married and has four school-aged children. She is from the village of Langcataon in the municipality of Pangantucan, a part of Bukidnon province on the Mindanao islands. Analiza runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she buys and sells biscuits, breads, snacks and candies to the local community. She has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Analiza joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She has successfully repaid a previous loan, her seventh from HSPFI, of 13,000 PHP which she used to purchase additional inventory and gain some working capital. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional snacks and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional snacks and canned goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase assorted souvenirs

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is married with a twelve-year-old son named Denis. He is a farmer from Kamenka which is a predominantly agricultural region in Ukraine. Roman owns four big greenhouses and a separate one for seedlings on his property. He started this business twelve years ago. Presently, he has already invested about 75,000 UAH on his farm.

Roman is seeking a loan of 12,000 UAH: 6,000 UAH on quality fertilizers and chemicals, and other 6,000 UAH on plastic film to recover his greenhouses, ensuring protection for fragile plants. One of Roman’s further business plans is to reconstruct his greenhouses and install heating units in them.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and plastic film

loans.name: Kamolidin

texts.ru: Зоиров Камолидин проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 34 года. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Его брат находится в России на заработках. Сам Камолидин уже год как занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кроме того в свободное время он предоставляет услугу, такси. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Kamolidin Z. lives in Yavan. He is 34 years old, married, and has four children. His wife is a housewife. His brother is working in Russia. Kamolidin has been working in animal husbandry for a year.   He raises cattle for resale.  In his spare time, he runs a taxi service.  He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Fatima

texts.ar: فاطمه في عمر 34 سنة تعمل في بيع الالبسة الجاهزة لها في عملها سنتين تحب عملها وهو كل اهتمامها فاطمه في طور تكوين اسرة فهي مرتبطة وتسعى الى تأمين منزل جيد لها ولخطيبها تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة للمحل لتزيد من مدخول المحل وشراء بعض المستلزمات المنزلية لمنزلها الجديد لها حب كبير في تأسيس مستقبل جيد بالاعتماد على نفسها وتأمين مستقبل جيد
texts.en: Fatima is 34 years old and works selling clothes. She has two years of experience in this field. She likes her work and gives all of her attention to it. Fatima is at the stage in her life when she wants to start a family. She is engaged, and she is now trying to secure a good house for her and her fiance. With a loan from Al-Majmoua, she would like to buy goods for her store in order to increase the store's revenues. She would also like to buy certain needed items for her new house. Fatima very much desires to secure a good future for herself by working hard and relying on herself.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise for her clothing store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He has been working as a car painter for 13 years and started managing his own work in 2000. He has taken advantage of five Kiva loans and was a very good client who paid on time. He notes that these loans helped him in his business expansion and permitted him to hire three full-time employees. His wife works in a locA. company in order to gain extra money for the family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additionA. painting tools and supplies. In the future, he hopes to continue the growth of his business and be able to take on more projects.

loans.use: to purchase additional painting tools and supplies

loans.name: Namoz

texts.ru: Табаров Намоз проживает в районе Яван. Ему 48 лет. Он женат, имеет 11 детей. Жена домохозяйка. Его старший сын находится на заработках в России. Сам Намоз вместе с детьми занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает овощи и арбуз, а весной он сеет пшеницу. В этой области уже 25 лет. Кредит берет для покупки топлива и семян.
texts.en: Namoz T. lives in Yavan. He is 48 years old, married, and has eleven children. His wife is a housewife. His eldest son is working in Russia. Namoz and his children work in agriculture. He raises vegetables and watermelons, and in the spring he sows wheat. He has been doing this work for 25 years. He is taking out a loan to buy fuel and seeds.

loans.use: to buy fuel and seeds

loans.name: Iasha

texts.en:
Iasha T. is 60 years old. He is married and lives with his wife Naira in the village of Supsa, Lanchkhuti District. Iasha and his wife are engaged in agricultural activities. They have a plot of land where cucumbers are grown. The harvested cucumbers are sold locally. Also, Iasha has a tractor. In case of orders, he tills the plots in his and neighboring villages. He uses his tractor on his plot as well.

With the requested credit, Iasha plans to purchase fuel for his tractor and fertilizers in order to cultivate his land. Afterwards, he will sow the cucumbers. According to Iasha’s estimations, after cultivation he will have more and better quality cucumbers than in previous years, as he hasn’t fertilized the plot for several years. Part of the profit will be reinvested in the business. In addition to the cultivation, he plans to renovate his tractor for the next season. He hopes that some funds will be left for renovation of the house as well.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two young children. The children are still attending school. She has been working as a beautician for the last eight years and opened her own beauty salon in 2009. She offers different beauty services such as make up, laser, hair removal etc.  She has a part-time employee who helps her accomplish the work. Women continue to play an important role in Lebanese society, especially in the development of the family. Women are able to serve as strong role models for their children while also helping to supplement their household incomes. In almost all parts of Lebanon, demand for beauty and fashion products continues to be high. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more beauty products. In that way, she will be able to serve more customers and therefore increase her income. She has high hopes for the future of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of more drugs to stock her pharmacy

loans.name: Nuriya

texts.ru: Nuriya Zamujem i imeyet odnoqo rebonka. Nuriya I. 30 let. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoimi detmi i mujem. Nuriya uje 3 qoda kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit kuric i indeyek dlya uvelicheniya i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Nuriya I. is married and has one child.  She is 30 years old.  She in an IDP (Internally Displaced Person), a refugee from Fuzuli city, who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her child and husband.  Nuriya has been poultry farming for three years.  Now she needs 2300 AZN to buy chickens and turkeys to enlarge and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and turkeys

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima A. is a married lady whose husband works in construction; they have eight children aged between seven and thirty-five years old. Milkah is a masseuse. She serves the local people and has been in business for over thirty years now. Besides massage, she owns rental units which she rents to the local populace. She works very hard to keep her business going well; she describes herself as determined and open minded. But her major problem is insufficient funds. 

Halima and her family live in Mombasa, the coastal region of Kenya well known for its many tourist attraction sites including the Indian ocean with its white sand beaches. 

Halima is using her loan of 20,000 KES to renovate the rental units to ensure that the units are good for use by the tenants. With any remainder, she will buye shoes to grow her business and meet the demand by her customers. She hopes to grow the shoe sales business and become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: Renovate rental units

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan T. is a 27-year-old farmer. He lives in the village of Khidmaghala. Levan is married and has a four-year-old daughter. She goes to a local kindergarten. Levan lives with his wife Nana, his daughter and parents. All family members are involved in agricultural activities. They grow cucumbers and sell them at the local market. Also, the family owns four milk cows and sells traditional Georgian cheese locally. 

The requested credit will be used for cultivation and purchasing of fertilizers. Levan hopes that after fertilizing the land, he will get more cucumbers than in previous years. The profit gained on the harvest season will be reinvested in agricultural activities: cucumber growing and the dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and cultivate his land

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik M. is 29 years old and he lives in Sevan, Armenia, with his parents who help Arayik in his business. Initially, he worked as a shop assistant in a food market, then had a shop where he sold mixed products.

Arayik now supports his family through his butcher shop, which he opened three years ago. Thanks to the income from his business, he hopes to expand in the future.

Arayik is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 AMD to buy some calves to raise and sell. This would be his second loan from Kiva and third loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy some calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph N. Muiruri is 48 years old, married to Esther Gathoni, and they have three children. He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 23 years. 

Joseph was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his fifth loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Joseph hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Merii

texts.ar: مرعي عمره 62 سنة يعمل في مطعم لبيع الدجاج المشوي له في عمله 31  سنة يحب عمله ويريد ان يطوره وان يزيد من مدخوله هو متزوج  وله 1 يعمل بجد وتعب يريد ان يؤمن مستقبل جيد له ولأولاده يسعى الى تطوير العمل وتحسين يتميز بالنظافة والدقة في العمل يتمنى ان يكون لديه مزرعة كبيرة يكون فيها كل انواع الفروج والدواجن يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراءالمواد الاولية للمطعم وشراء عدة
texts.en: Meri'i is 62 years old and works in a restaurant where he sells grilled chicken. He has 31 years of experience in this line of work. He likes his work, and would like to develop his business and increase his income. He is married and has one child. He works very hard, and he would like to secure a good future for himself and his children. He is trying to improve his business. He stands out in his work due to the cleanliness of his establishment and his attention to detail. He hopes to own a big farm in which he will raise all kinds of chickens and livestock. With a loan from Al-Majmoua, he would like to buy some raw materials for his restaurant, as well as some equipment.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and equipment for his chicken restaurant.

loans.name: Jane Wairimu

texts.en:
Jane Wairimu N., 67, has farmed in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 21 years. She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Jane hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jane Waruguru

texts.en:
Jane has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 16 years. She is 45 years old and married to John Chege. They have two children.   

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan.  She paid for her previous loan of KES. 10,000 well and in good time. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Jane hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For over three years, she has operated a food stall business from home where villagers are her potential customers.

Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season, she experiences low customer turn out compared to the hot dry season where the demand is high and she experiences a high number of customers. With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase two sacks of beans, two bundles of maize flour, sugar, and rice and to renovate her selling stall. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of beans, two bundles of maize flour, sugar, and rice and to renovate her selling stall.

loans.name: Jane Wambui

texts.en:
Jane has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 13 years. She is 38 years old and married to Ben N..

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan.  She paid for her previous loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Jane hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Geoffrey Gathungu

texts.en:
Geoffrey has been practising farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last eight years.  He is 31 years old, married to Teresaiah, and they have three children.  

Geoffrey was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend.  This will be his fourth loan.  He had repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Geoffrey hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To set up a water pump and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bakary Sidibé est un homme marié de 32 ans et père de 2 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille traditionnelle élargie, chez son père, dans le quartier Dougounina de la ville de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire moderne, très vite il commença les activités économiques, notamment l’achat vente de pièces détachées. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son père qui fut un mécanicien garagiste très réputé de la place. Avec une expérience de 15 ans, il maîtrise son activité. 
Avant d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, Monsieur Bakary Sidibé n’arrivait pas à mener à bien son activité à cause d’un manque de fonds de roulement.
C’est ainsi qu’il décida d’intégrer l’institution afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroitre. Il est à son deuxième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter, une grande quantité de pièces détachées auprès des grossistes et effectuera sa vente en détail et au comptant.
Le bénéfice mensuel de 75 000FCFA qu’il espère gagner va lui permettre d’agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr Bakary Sidibé is a 32 year old man, married, and the father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in a traditional family, at his father's home, in the neighborhood of Dougounina in the city of Bougouni.

Having not attended school, he began working at a young age, notably in the purchasing and sales of spare car parts. He learned this activity from his father, who was a well-respected mechanic.  He is very good at his work, having done this for the past 15 years. Prior to joining the microlending organization Soro Yiriwaso, Mr Sidibé was struggling to maintain his business due to a lack of consistent funds. He decided to join the organization in order satisfy the demands of his customers to be able to grow his business. He is asking for a second loan from Soro Yiriwaso, after having reimbursed the first loan on time. 

This loan would allow him to purchase a large quantity of spare parts from wholesalers and then re-sell either to retailers for cash. The estimated monthly profits of approximately 75,000 FCFA [approximately 160 USD] he hopes to receive will allow him to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase spare car parts

loans.name: Mary Wanjiku

texts.en:
Mary is 57 years old.  She has been practising farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.    She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend.  This will be her first loan.  She plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Mary hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Gabriel Kariuki

texts.en:
Gabriel has been practising farming in Njabini town for the last 11 years.  He is 41 years old and is married to Esther Muthoni.  

Gabriel was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan.  He had repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Gabriel hopes to become a leading farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of items for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials to build a cow shed

loans.name: Joseph Muchai

texts.en:
Joseph has been practising farming in Njabini town for the last seven years.  He is 41 years old, married to Jane Nyambura, and they have two children.  

Joseph was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He has paid his previous loan of Kshs 40,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Joseph hopes to become a leading farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato K. is 37 years old. She lives in the village of Supsa, Lanchkhuti District. She lives with her husband Arsen, 11-year-old son, 9-year-old daughter and mother-in-law. Her children go to school. Nato’s mother-in-law is retired. Nato’s husband works as a handicraftsman and earns 150 Laris per month. The main source of income for the family is agriculture. Nato is leading the agricultural activities of the family.  They grow cucumbers and sell them in season. Along with the above-mentioned activities, the family has five milk cows and sells traditional Georgian cheese in the local market. 

With the requested credit, Nato plans to cultivate the land and purchase fertilizers. Afterwards, Nato will sow the cucumbers. She hopes that after cultivation and fertilizing, she will get a good harvest and increased income. Part of the profit will be used for financing her children’s education and the other part will be reinvested in cucumber growing.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and cultivate the land

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a married woman with two children, all of whom are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past year, she has been operating a food stall business, selling fish from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanamkasi faces a major challenge in seasonality. During the rainy season, the availability of customers visiting her food stall is lower compared to the dry hot season when the demand is higher. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she is requesting, Mwanamkasi wants to purchase an ice cooler box to store fish to sell, 20 litres of cooking oil, and roofing materials (makuti) to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase an ice box to store fish, cooking oil, and roofing materials

loans.name: Ediatu

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Ediatu.  She is married and has 2 children, one is a boy aged 3 and the other is a girl aged 13.  Her son is in a nursery school while her daughter is in a junior secondary school.   Ediatu supports 2 additional dependents, who are her late sister’s children. 

For the past 10 years, Ediatu has been selling cooked rice (locally called cookery) and drinks.  Her business is located in the central business district of Freetown.   Ediatu said "I have passion for this business because since I dropped out of school, it is through this business I have become self reliant."  She opens her business 5 days a week for 6 hours each day.  

Ediatu has a good loan repayment history. She has requested a loan of Le 3,000,000 to buy bags of rice, gallons of vegetable oil, and other food items for her business.   Ediatu has employed two young girls to help her sell the food that she prepares.  She wants to educate her children to university level, and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, and other food items

loans.name: Hachem

texts.ar: هاشم عمره51 سنة متزوج وله اربع اولاد يعمل في بيع اجهزة الهواتف النقالة له في عمله 10 سنوات له زبائن من محطيه وجيرانه واهل قريته يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة للمحل اجهزة خليوي واكسسوارات له تاريخ جيد في عمله ويسعى الى تطويره دائما لكن ما يعيقه هي المنافسة في محيطه لكثرة المحال التي تعمل في هذا المجال يريد التميز في العمل حتى يتمكن من مواصلة المنافسة يريد هاشم دائما التطور وتأمين العيش الجيد وتحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي لأولاده
texts.en: Hachem is 51 years old and married with four children. He works selling mobile phones and mobile phone accessories. He has ten years of experience in this line of work. He has customers from his community, from among his neighbors, and from among the residents of his town. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy goods for his store, such as mobile phones and mobile phone accessories. He has a good history in his mobile phone business, and he is always striving to develop his store. However, what is hindering him from doing this is the competition in his community, for there are many mobile phone stores in his community. He would like to stand out in his sector of the market so that he can continue to compete in the mobile phone business. Hachem consistently desires to develop himself and secure a good life for himself, as well as improve his children's material situation and social status.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and mobile phone accessories for his mobile phone store.

loans.name: Samuel Ngigi

texts.en:
Samuel has been practising dairy farming in Njabini town for the last 15 years.  He is 38 years old, married to Hannah Wanjiru, and they have four children.  

Samuel  was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend.  This will be his 2nd loan.  He had repaid his previous loan of Kshs 45,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use this new loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, Samuel hopes to become a leading dairy farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette M. N. is thirty five years old.  She is married to a businessman and they have two children, aged ten years old and nine months old. Her business is located in Gikomba, a very busy market in Nairobi, the capital city of Kenya. She has been selling second-hand clothes to the local people for the last eleven years. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is fluctuating market prices.  Bernadette works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more clothes to expand her business. 

Bernadette hopes to have many stalls for selling clothes in the future. She describes herself as honest and committed to her work.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water pump and irrigation pipes

loans.name: Grace Wangui

texts.en:
Grace has been practising farming in Njabini town for the last four years.  She does poultry and dairy farming on her small farm.  She is 43 years old, married to Francis Thuo, and they have six children.

Grace was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend.  This will be his sixth loan.  She had repaid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use this new loan amount to buy 15 chicks to raise and sell later for profit.

In the future, Grace hopes to become a leading farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: To buy 15 chicks

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Mariatu.  She is single and has 2 boys, aged 7 and 16. She has 1 additional dependent whom she adopted from her relatives living in the provinces. 

For the past 9 years, Mariatu has been selling drinks and provisions such as sugar, milk, ovaltine, margarine, sardines, etc.  Mariatu began this business because she was inspired by the successes of her friend in the same type business, and believed the business can make her self-reliant. She opens her business 7 days a week for 11 hours each day. 

Mariatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 to buy:  50 crates of soft drinks for Le 27,000,1 carton Guinness for Le 85,000, and 30 crates of Star beer for Le 45,000.  

Mariatu plans to build a house and get a well-established bar and restaurant.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and beer for her business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.ar: حسن في عمر 40 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في بيع وتركيب الستالايت له في عمله 10 سنوات يحب عمله ويعتبره مميز لأنه قليل في مكان عمله هو يتميز بكثرة الطلب ولكن حسن يريد دائما التطور والتحسن في العمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى تطوير المحل وشراء بضاعة جديدة ومعدات وتركيب خزان مياه للأرض حيث انه الى جانب عمله يهتم بزراعة ارضه التي تعتبر مصدر خاص لمعيشة اولاده من خلال اطعامهم ما هو طبيعي قائم على زراعته يهتم لصحة عائلته كثيرا والى تأمين العيش الكريم لعائلته وتعليمهم وتربيتهم بشكل جيد
texts.en: Hassan is 40 years old and married with three children. He works selling and installing satellite dishes. He has ten years of experience in his field. He likes his work and believes that his business is rather unique for his community seeing as there aren't many satellite dish businesses there. He stands out in his field due to the large demand for his services. Still, Hassan always likes to develop and improve his business. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to improve his store by buying new goods and equipment for it. In addition, he would like to install a water tank for his land since he farms on the side. With his farm, he is better able to provide for his children as he can grow natural foods for them to eat. He is very interested in the health of his family, and he would like to secure a respectable life for them. Moreover, he is also interested in providing them a good education and in raising them well.

loans.use: to buy goods and equipment for his satellite dish store.

loans.name: Jane Wangui

texts.en:
Jane has been practising farming in Njabini town for the last three years.  She is 33 years old, married to Bernard K., and they have one child.

Jane was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers.  This will be her second loan. She had repaid her previous loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use this new loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Jane hopes to become a leading farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jesinta Waithira

texts.en:
Jesinta has been practising both dairy farming and grow crops in Njabini town for the last 20 years.  She is 57 years old, married to James Kimani, and they have two children.

Jesinta was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend, and this will be her secnd loan.  She paid for her previous loan of Kshs 30,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Jesinta hopes to become a leading farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and animal feeds

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.ar: موسى عمره 39 سنة متزوج وله ولدان يعمل في مطعم لبيع الوجبات السريعة له في العمل سنتين  يحب عمله ويتميز به حيث انه يملك وجبات مميزة يسعى الى تطوير عمله والى تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي له ولعائلته يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى زياة البضاعة في المحل من دجاج ولحوم والى صيانة المطعم حتى يستطيع مواصلة المنافسة مع غيره له زبائن من جيرانه واصدقائه كان للقرض السابق الأثر الجيد على عمله وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة
texts.en: Mousa is 39 years old and married with two children. He works in a fast food restaurant, and has two years of experience in his position. He likes his work and stands out in his field because the food he makes stands out among other fast food options in the area. He is trying to develop his business and improve his and his family's material situation and social status. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to increase the chicken and meat supplies of his restaurant, as well as have maintenance completed on various items in his restaurant. These improvements will help him to continue to compete with the other businesses in his line of work. He has customers from among his neighbors and his friends. His last loan had a positive effect on his business, and during it, he received the full support of his family.

loans.use: to purchase chicken and meat for his restaurant, and to replace old equipment in his restaurant with new equipment.

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en:
Jeneba B. is a 41-year-old business woman.  She is also a widow with 3 children: 2 boys and a girl.  She has 1 additional dependent in her elderly mother. 

In 2005, Jeneba established a cosmetics and provisions business.   She is very determined to conscientiously improve her business. She opens her business 7 days a week from 8:30 am to 11:30pm. 

Jeneba needs a loan for Le 3,000,000 to buy assorted cosmetics and provisions such as sugar, milk, sardines, butter, etc. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and provisions to resell

loans.name: Peter Mwangi

texts.en: Peter Mwangi K. has been farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 28 years.  He is 68 years old, married, and has  three children.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  In the future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water pump and other irrigation equipment

loans.name: Santina

texts.en: Santina is currently in the business of selling paste and bread. She is 27 years old, married and has 4 children who all go to school. Santina will use her loan to stock more paste and bread to sell. In the future she hopes to buy a car with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more paste and bread to sell

loans.name: Hadi

texts.ar: هادي عمره 29 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في بيع الخضار والفواكه الموسمية له في عمله 5 سنوات يحب العمل يريد دائما ان يطور مستقبله وان يؤمن مستقبل جيد لأولاده يريد ان يزيد من مدخول محله وان يطور عمله يسعى الى تحسين الوضع المادي من خلال تحسين المحل وزيادة البضاعة فيه يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى تقوية المحل وشراء بضاعة يتميز يدقة في عمله يريد ان يطور محله حتى يصبح سوبر ماركت كبيرة تضم سلع غذائية كثيرة يهتم ثيرا في تعليم اولاده ويريد لهم المستقبل الجيد
texts.en: Hadi is 29 years old and married with three children. He works selling seasonal fruits and vegetables. He has five years of experience in his field, and he likes his work. He is always striving to improve his future and to secure a good future for his children. He would like to increase the revenues of his store and develop his business. He is trying to improve his financial situation by improving his store, in this case, by increasing his store's inventory. With a loan from al-Majmoua he would like to buy new goods for his store. He stands out in his field due to his attention to detail in business matters. He would like to develop his store into a supermarket which will sell all sorts of foodstuffs. He is very concerned with providing his children a good education, and he wants a good future for them.

loans.use: to buy seasonal vegetables for his grocery store.

loans.name: Crecer Unidos Group

texts.es:
Éste banco comunal se llama “Crecer Unidos” conformado por 15 emprendedores que se desempeñan en diferentes negocios, los cuales son kioscos, tienda de ropa, repostería, amasandería, taller de tejidos, taller mecánico, verdulería y una residencial de alojamiento. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca. 
Patricia quien en la foto aparece sentada en la primera fila y segunda del lado izquierdo, viste una chaqueta color violeta y zapatillas color café. Su cabello es corto y su color es castaño. Se dedica a la producción y venta de empanadas, además realiza productos de amasandería y repostería. En febrero estuvo participando de una feria costumbrista, donde vendió sus productos. Ella se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 4 años. Durante la semana y fin de semana se dedica a la producción de empanadas. Sin embargo son los fines de semana que le dan mayores ganancias. Patricia vende sus productos de acuerdo a los pedidos que realicen sus clientes, a veces sus ventas superan las 200 empanadas.
Los insumos los compra en un minimarket y las cebollas las compra al por mayor. 
Con éste préstamo comprará un fogón, ya que el que utiliza en la actualidad se encuentra en mal estado. 
Sus metas son tener un local establecido para la venta de sus productos de amasandería y repostería. Además de obtener el permiso y patente para vender. 
Patricia vive junto a su esposo e hijos. Sin embargo de acuerdo al trabajo que realiza su marido, él debe ausentarse del hogar por 15 días debido a su jornada laboral. Uno de sus hijos es quien la ayuda en el negocio, ya que le gusta el rubro del comercio y ventas. Las motivaciones de Patricia de continuar en el negocio, son para costear los estudios universitarios de su hija. Además éste negocio le ha servido como terapia, para superar su estado anímico, ya que a Patricia la aqueja un cáncer que ha debido tratar durante 5 años. En la actualidad asiste a controles médicos y su estado anímico es favorable.
Ella está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza. Debido a las facilidades de pago en el crédito. Lo que le permitirá invertir en su negocio y generar más ganancias.
Le gusta mucho participar de las reuniones, ya que aprende con las capacitaciones, además ha podido integrar estos conocimientos de contabilidad a su negocio.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Crecer Unidos” (To Grow Together). It has 15 entrepreneurs who are in a variety of businesses like: kiosks, clothing store, pastry making, bakery, textile workshop, auto repair shop, vegetable stand and an inn.  All of them are from the city of Talca.

Patricia, who in the photo is seated in the front row second from the left, is wearing a violet jacket and brown sandals.  Her hair is short and dark brown.  She makes and sells turnovers and also makes baked goods and pastry.  In February she participated in a cultural fair where she sold her products.

She’s been in this line of work for four years.  During the week and on weekends she makes the turnovers but weekends is when her profits are greatest.  Patricia sells her products based on prior orders from her customers and sometimes her sales are in excess of 200 turnovers.

She buys her ingredients at a minimarket and she buys the onions at wholesale.  She will use this loan to buy a stove because the one she’s using now is in bad shape.  Her goal is to have an established locale to sell her bakery products and pastry.

Patricia lives with her husband and children.  However, according her her husband’s job requirements he sometimes has to be away from home for two week periods due to his work schedule.  One of her children helps her with her business since business and sales are enjoyable.

Patricia’s motivation to continue in business is to cover her daughter’s university costs.  Besides, this business has served as therapy for her and has raised her spirits because she’s been in treatment for cancer for the last five years.  She currently is going in for medical supervision and her state of mind is positive.

She is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza because of the easy loan terms that make it possible for her to invest in her business and generate more profits.  She very much enjoys taking part in the meetings because she learns with the training; besides she’s learned how to apply the bookkeeping skills she’s learned to her business.

Talca is part of Maule Region in the central part of the country.  It is the administrative, economic and cultural center of the region since it’s the most important city in the Chilean Central Valley.  There is an interesting phrase in Chile about Talca: “Talca, París y Londres.” Among the myths alluding to it some say that it comes from something an Englishman once said:  “Talca seems like London” (Talca parece Londres) because of the thick fog that frequently covers the city in winter like in the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add two dairy cows

loans.name: Bateesa Women's Group-Mpigi

texts.en: N. Resty is a 41-year-old, mobile clothes sales business-woman who operates mostly in Mpigi Town. She has been selling clothes for the past decade. With the earnings from her business she has, in certain respects, been able to shoulder most of her family's responsibilities. Previously she was operating a restaurant. She says she is able to make a weekly profit to the tune of shillings 100,000. With this loan, Resty says she is going to purchase more bales of clothes to resell.

loans.use: The purchase more bales of clothes to resell

loans.name: Patrick Ngigi

texts.en:
Patrick has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past eight years. He is 26 years old, married to Monicah Wambui and they have four children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend. This will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan of Kshs 10,000 well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Patrick hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Francis Kimani

texts.en:
Francis has operated his retail shop in Naivasha town for the past three years. He is 39 years, married to Grace Mugure and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more goods to sell in his retail shop.

In future, Francis hopes to grow his retail shop to a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy more retail goods for sale

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert K. K. is sixty years old and is married to a business lady. They have three children aged between 33 and 28 years old. His business is located at the busy Likoni market in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attractions,  not forgetting the Indian ocean white beaches. 

He sells fruits and vegetables to the local people. He has operated this business for the past twelve years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenges he faces are financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 60,000 to buy fruit and vegetables to expand his business. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. He also hopes to get permanent premises from which to run his business. He describes himself as determined and patient.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.ar: مهدي عمره 42 سنة يعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية وخطوط تعبئة للهواتف النقالة له في عمله12 سنة اعزب يسعى الى تأمين مستقبل جيد حتى يتمكن من تأسيس عائلة يحب ان يكون له عائلة كبيرة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء مواد اولية للمحل وخطوط تعبئة للهواتف النقالة له خبرة في عمله يريد دائما تطوير العمل وتحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه واصدقائه وقد ساهم القرض السابق من المجموعة الى تحسين وضعه المادي وكان يلقى دائما الدعم الكامل
texts.en: Mahdi is 42 years old and works in a grocery store where he also sells mobile phone lines. He has twelve years of experience in this line of work. He is a bachelor, and he is trying to secure a good financial future for himself so that he can start a family. He would like to have a big family. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy supplies and mobile phone lines for his store. He has experience in his business, and he is always striving to develop it, as well as improve his financial situation and his social status. He has customers from his community and from among his neighbors and friends, and his last loan from al-Majmoua helped him to improve his financial situation. He also received much support from his community during his last loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies and mobile phone lines to sell in his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastic buckets and bowls for her business

loans.name: Benson Mureithi

texts.en:
Benson has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past 10 years. He is 48 years old, married to Grace Wanjiku and they have three children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Benson hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Joseph Kinuthia

texts.en:
Joseph has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past nine years. He is 25 years old, married to Judy Mukami and they have four children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, Joseph hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 50-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children. She is from Lebanon. She established 25 years ago a tailoring business in her home. With this large experience, she became well known in her town and its surroundings. She produces women's clothes such as robes and skirts and delivers her products to the clothing stores she deals with.  She helps her husband with the household expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase textiles and pearls in order to expand her business operation and earn more profit. This will be her second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase textiles and pearls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more goods to sell in his retail shop.

loans.name: Vobiya

texts.en: Vobiya is 54 years old, a widow, and has five children, none of whom go to school. She currently runs a business selling charcoal. Vobiya has taken a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to build a concrete house in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Joseph Ng'ang'a

texts.en:
Joseph is 52 years old, married to Mary Njeri and they have three children. He has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 26 years. He was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He has paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.
In the future, Joseph hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Abdul Rahman

texts.en:
This is Abdul Rahman K.. He is 48 years old, married, and has five children aged 16, 14, 12, 6 and 4. He has three additional dependents, who live with him because they are his late wife’s relatives.
In 2010, Abdul established his timber business. He began this business because he wanted to be self-employed and become self-reliant. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like to request a loan of 5,000,000 SLL. With this loan, he will buy a new power saw for more timber production. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 400,000 SLL. In the future, Abdul plans to educate his children to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy another machine for timber processing

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Juan es cliente antiguo.  El esta casado tiene dos hijos pequeños, ellos viven en casa de sus suegros pero de manera independiente. El Sr. Juan es una persona bastante trabajadora y con ganas de superación.  La actividad que el realiza todos los días es el transporte libre (taxi), el vehículo que maneja es de su propiedad, el recorre todas las calles de la ciudad, su esposa la Sra. Elizabeth también ayuda con los gastos del hogar ella trabaja de secretaria en un  Colegio cerca de su casa,  es una pareja joven que desean para sus hijos un futuro mejor es por ello que ambos se esfuerzan por salir adelante, con el dinero del crédito comprara llantas y un equipo de sonido para su movilidad,  ambos se encuentran muy agradecidos con la Institución por brindarles la oportunidad de cumplir sus sueños. En la foto esta el Sr. Juan y su esposa.
texts.en:
Juan is a long standing client.  He’s married and has two small children.  They live in his in-laws’ house but independently.  Juan is a very hard working person with the will to get ahead.  He works every day driving a taxi.  He owns the vehicle he uses and he covers all the city’s streets.  His wife, Elizabeth, also helps with household expenses working as a Secretary at a school near their house.  They are a young couple who want a better future for their children and that’s why they both work hard to get ahead.

He will use the loan to buy tires and a stereo set for his car.  They are both very grateful to the Institution for providing the opportunity of making their dreams come true.  Juan appears in the photo with his wife.

loans.use: to buy two tires and a stereo set.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria es comerciante de cosméticos y artículos de belleza, lo cual es su principal fuente de ingreso; con el dinero del préstamo comprara material de construcción como ser: arena, cemento, ladrillos ya que Maria desea refaccionar la cocina de la casa donde vive. Vive en casa de un pariente ubicado en la zona Vino Tinto de la ciudad de  La Paz,; está casada y tiene un hijo. Maria se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que se le otorgaron y esta es la segunda vez que el crédito va a través de Kiva.
texts.en: María is a cosmetics and beauty supplies merchant; this is her main source of income.  She will use the money from the loan to buy building materials and supplies like: sand, cement and bricks because María wants to refurbish the kitchen in the house where she lives.  She lives in the house of a relative in the Vino Tinto neighborhood of La Paz.  She’s married and has one son.  María is very satisfied with the loans she was granted and this is the second time the loan is through Kiva.

loans.use: to refurbish her kitchen.

loans.name: Eron

texts.en:
Eron N. lives in the Kyebando Nsooba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.
Eron has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works six days out of every week. Eron sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail. She also generates additional income through poultry farming. Eron has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.
The main business challenges for Eron include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only. Eron lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. lives in the Nabulagala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has no children.
Sarah has a business selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days out of every week. Sarah sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail. She has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.
The main business challenges for Sarah include defaulters and the increasing price of clothes. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing second-hand clothes. Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia N. is 42 years old. He lives in the village of Tsiskhisdziri in the Kartli Region. Gia is married and lives with his wife Lena, two children (8- and 6-year-old boys) and mother. The children go to school. 

The main income of the family comes from Gia’s business, which is a beer pub he started seven years ago. The pub is located in the same village and he works there intensively in the summer and fall period. Now as the season starts, Gia requested credit to purchase beer and other inventories to re-start the pub.

Along with the pub, the family is busy with a dairy farm. They have two milk cows and sell dairy products locally. Lena is in charge of dairy activities, though Gia helps her as well.

Gia hopes that he will have a successful and profitable season. He plans to reinvest the profit in further expansion of both businesses: the beer pub and dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase beer and other inventories for his pub

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria Rosario es empleada del Ministerio de Economía y su esposo trabaja como carpintero; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de una impresora ya que el anterior crédito lo utilizo para la compra de una computadora. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Sopocachi en la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene dos hijos.
texts.en: María Rosario is employed by the Ministry of Economics and her husband works as a Carpenter.  She needs the loan to buy a printer since she used the previous loan to buy a computer.  She lives in her parents’ house located in La Paz’s Sopocachi zone.  She’s married and has two children.

loans.use: to buy a printer.

loans.name: Virginia Wangari

texts.en:
Virginia has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. She also does tailoring on the side, making clothes for her clients.  She is 52 years old and is married to Joseph M.. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Virginia hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 42 years old, married to Joseph Kamau and they have seven children. She has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last year. She was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Lydia hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry chicks and feed

loans.name: Rahab Wanja

texts.en: Rahab is 47 years old and a single mother of three children. She has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 23 years. She was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by one of our field staff and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 60,000 KES well and in good time. She plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Rahab hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school.
Mariam has a retail shop business. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works six days out of every week. Mariam sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. She also generates additional income through poultry farming.
The main business challenges for Mariam include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van. Mariam lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and paying utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister).
Margaret has a business selling cereals .She has been in this business for ten years, and she works six days out of every week. Margaret sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale/retail. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of groundnuts. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.
The main business challenges for Margaret include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van. Margaret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and paying utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of groundnuts

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma forma parte del banco comunal “Lonko-Domo” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco.
Ella se dedica al comercio ambulante, desde hace 4 años. Vende productos de paquetería, específicamente; pañuelos, cortinas, manteles, paños de cocina y artículos para decorar una casa. Norma trabaja de lunes a sábado, recorriendo los domicilios de sus clientes frecuentes, que son muchos. Ya que Norma brinda facilidades de pago a sus clientes y utiliza un trato afable, lo que ha generado vínculos de amistad entre su clientela. Actualmente está incorporando a su negocio la venta de ropa de invierno, rubro que genera mejores ganancias.
Su mercadería la compra usualmente en una importadora y la ropa en la ciudad de Santiago.
Con el préstamo comprará mercadería específicamente; ropa y productos de paquetería. 
Las motivaciones de Norma de continuar con el negocio, se deben a que le gusta lo que realiza, no sólo vender, sino que también tener contacto con las personas, tener un trato más cercano y empático con su clientela. 
Su sueño es tener un gran capital con el cual pueda invertir y comprar más mercadería, así con esto obtener mayores ganancias y tener una vida más confortable y tranquila. 
Norma vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 23 y 19 años de edad.
Para Norma Fondo esperanza ha significado una gran ayuda para su vida y negocio, por lo que está muy contenta y agradecida de participar. Ella también asiste a las reuniones, en las cuales disfruta mucho, además ha aprendido a manejar y organizar mejor su negocio.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Norma is part of the “Lonko-Domo” communal bank belonging to the city of Temuco.  She’s been a street vendor for four years.  She sells home goods, specifically, handkerchiefs, curtains, tablecloths, napkins and home decoration articles.  Norma works Monday through Saturday visiting homes of her customers, who are numerous, because Norma gives them easy payment plans and treats them kindly; this has led to bonds of friendship among her customers.  She is currently incorporating the sale of winter clothes into her business, a line that generates better profits.  She usually buys her merchandise from an importer and she buys the clothes in the city of Santiago.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise, specifically clothes and home use items.  Norma’s motivation to stay in business is that she enjoys what she does, not only selling, but also having contact with people and having a close, empathetic relationship with her clientele.

Her dream is to have a large capital to invest and buy more merchandise so that she can earn higher profits and have a more tranquil and comfortable life.  Norma lives with her husband and two children who are 23 and 19 years old.

For Norma, Fondo Esperanza has meant a great help for her life and business which makes her happy and grateful to participate.  She attends the meetings which she enjoys very much.  Besides, she’s learned to manage and better organize her business.

Temuco is the capital of the La Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (capital of Chile).  In its surroundings are a series of lakeside spas (Pucón, Villarica) and a showy native flora and fauna concentrated in nearby natural parks.   It’s worth stressing that 50% of the Mapuche, indigenous people existing in our country, lives in this region.

loans.use: to buy clothes and home goods.

loans.name: Joram Boaragu

texts.en: Joram is 47 years, married to Alice Nyaboke and they have two children. He has operated his food stall in Naivasha town for the last 14 years. He was introduced to Kiva patner, KADET, by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 75,000 KES well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy cooking fat, flour, cereals and sugar in bulk for his food stall. In the future, Joram hopes to develop his food stall into a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, flour, cereals and sugar in bulk for his food stall

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is 28 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom go to school. She is currently in the business of selling fish. Flora has taken a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell

loans.name: John Gitau

texts.en: John is 62 years old and married to Grace Muthoni. He has operated his food stall in Naivasha town for the last six years.
