He was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use this loan to buy cooking fat, flour, cereals and sugar in bulk for his food stall. In the future, John hopes to develop his food stall into a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, flour, cereals and sugar in bulk for his food stall

loans.name: Salome Wangari

texts.en: Salome is 28 years old, married to Joseph Wanjiku and they have one child. She has operated her beauty salon shop in Naivasha town for the last three years. She was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by her friend and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 20,000 KES well and in good time. She plans to use this loan to buy hair products and chemicals for use in her salon. In the future, Salome hopes to expand her beauty shop and be able to offer more services.

loans.use: to buy hair products and chemicals for use in her salon

loans.name: Joel Ntakaine

texts.en:
Joel is 29 years old, married to Christine Mausa and they have four children. He has practised farming in Naivasha town for the last nine years. He was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by his friend and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.
In the future, Joel hopes to become a leading farmer in the Naivasha area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 30 years old and married to Deborah Owuor who is a housewife. They have four children aged seven, five, three, and two months old. Joseph runs an electronics shop in Mutwot trading centre in Kapsabet town and has been in operation for the past 10 years. He earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.
Joseph has taken a loan from Kiva partner, KADET, for 40,000 KES and this will be his second loan. He serviced his previous loan successfully. Joseph hopes to use the loan to add stock to his business. He will use the anticipated profits as savings for future investments. His hope is to live a life that is successful.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his business

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen lives in an industrial city of Pakistan known as Faisalabad. She has lived there in a 2-room brick house in the area of Mian Pind for the past 16 years. She is a housewife and does her household works, staying at home. She doesn’t have any children. Her father and brother also live with her and both of them are involved in different jobs. Her father is a security guard while her brother sells vegetables.  

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. He is a painter and paints houses and buildings on order. He deals with different companies and individuals and earns good income after completing their work. Using the loan, he will buy different colors of paint and paint brushes to provide better quality service to his clients. 

Nasreen is hopeful that her husband will successfully be able to grow his business to a level where his family can have a better standard of living. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she proved herself to be a responsible client by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with her hand raised is Nasreen”

loans.use: To buy paint and paint brushes for husband's house-painting business.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a resident of Mian Pind which is a small residential area located in Faisalabad. Faisalabad is Pakistan’s third largest city and well known for its textile industry. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family for the past 12 years. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who operates a vegetable-selling business on his donkey cart. He sells different seasonal vegetables to his clients and makes reasonable profits. Using the loan investment, he will buy a new cart because his current cart has become rough and needs replacement and buy fresh seasonal vegetables as well. The new cart will help him transport more vegetables to make more profits. 

Naseem has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Her sons are enrolled in a local school and getting their education while her daughter is only three years old and has not started getting an education yet. She is hopeful that her husband will be able to gain positive financial results from the loan investment. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has proved herself a responsible client by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy a new cart & fresh seasonal vegetables for vegetable-sales business.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra forma parte del banco comunal “Newen” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco. 
Ella se dedica al corte y confección de ropa, desde hace 12 años. Trabaja desde su casa, ya que ahí tiene su taller con 6 máquinas de coser, además Alejandra trabaja junto a su hermana. Su clientela son colegios, consultorios y empresas, además de clientes particulares. Alejandra cuenta con la publicidad necesaria para ofrecer sus servicios, ya que tiene una página de Internet, en la cual aparecen sus costuras. Sus clientes solicitan sus servicios durante todo el año, sin embargo la temporada más baja es durante los mese de enero y febrero correspondiente a las vacaciones de verano. 
Su mercadería o insumos, los compra en una tienda de costuras y las máquinas de coser las compró en una tienda comercial. 
Con el préstamo comprará una maquina de coser (overlook), además de una orilladora.  
Su meta es comprar una maquina para bordar.
Sus sueños a nivel personal son obtener su casa propia y seguir costeando los estudios de sus hijas. De aquí las motivaciones de continuar con el negocio. 
Alejandra vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas de 15 y 10 años de edad. Ambas estudian en colegios particulares.
Alejandra está muy contenta y agradecida de la ayuda otorgada por Fondo esperanza, ya que con el préstamo ha podido invertir en su negocio, además asiste a las reuniones del banco comunal y participa con mucho ánimo, ya que éstas son muy gratas. Junto con esto realizó un curso de ventas, aprendizaje que ha podido incorporar en su negocio. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Alejandra is part of the “Newen” communal bank belonging to the city of Temuco. She’s been a Seamstress for 12 years.  She works at home; she has a workshop there with six sewing machines. Alejandra works alongside her sister.  Her customers are schools, doctor’s offices and firms as well as private customers.  Alejandra has adequate publicity for her services because she has a web page on the Internet where here creations appear.  Her customers request her services year round but her weakest months are January and February which correspond to summer vacation.  She buys her supplies at a sewing supplies store and she bought her sewing machines at a department store.  She will use the loan to buy an overlock sewing machine as well as an edger.  Her goal is to buy an embroidery machine.

Her dreams on a personal level are to buy a house of her own and to continue to pay for her daughters’ education.  This is where her motivation to continue in business comes from.  Alejandra lives with her husband and two daughters who are 15 and 10 years of age.  Both go to private school.

Alejandra is very happy and grateful for the help provided by Fondo Esperanza because she was able to use the loan to invest in the business.  Besides, she attends communal bank meetings and participates very actively because the meetings are very enjoyable.  Together with this she took a sales course, acquiring learning that she was able to apply to her business.

Temuco is the capital of the La Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (capital of Chile).  In its surroundings are a series of lakeside spas (Pucón, Villarica) and a showy native flora and fauna concentrated in nearby natural parks.   It’s worth stressing that 50% of the Mapuche, indigenous people existing in our country, lives in this region.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Rosio Micaela

texts.es: La Sra. Rosio, vive en  la zona de  Molle Molle,   viven en alquiler  hace varios años en la misma zona, tiene  dos hijos  su esposo es profesor , la Sra. Rosio tiene una tienda de barrio a una cuadra de la escuela de la zona en plena esquina ella atiende su tienda de lunes a domingo se levanta desde muy temprano para abrir su tienda y atender a su familia, es una pareja joven trabajadores  están trabajando ambos  con la ilusión  de poder  ahorrar para comprar un terreno y así poder tener su propia casa . El préstamo lo destinara  para surtir su tienda comprando dulces, refrescos, abarrotes, la Sra. Rosio esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del  crédito.
texts.en:
Rosio has lived in the Molle Molle neighborhood in a rented home for a few years.  She has two children and her husband is a teacher.  

Rosio has a convenience store that is located one block from the local school.  She tends the store from Monday to Sunday.  She gets up very early to open the store and care for her family.  Rosio and her husband are a hardworking young couple who are working together to be able to save money to purchase land and be able to have their own house.  

She will use this loan to stock her store with sweets, drinks, and groceries.  Rosio is thankful to the institution for the support they have given by granting the loan.

loans.use: to stock her store with sweets, drinks, and groceries.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Bernardina, es soltera y tiene 53 años de edad,  tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 5 de ellos son independientes y 1 de ellos tiene 22 años de edad, y aún depende de su madre, la socia tiene como principal actividad la agricultura y tiene sus terrenos de cultivo, la socia siembra y cosecha maíz, cebada, trigo, papa, ella vende en las ferias al por mayor todos sus productos, la socia requiere el préstamo para cubrir la nueva siembra lo que significa remover la tierra para prepararla y comprar semillas, abono, y a media etapa deshierbar, quiere decir deberán limpiar las hierbas que crecieron alrededor del cultivo y limpiar la zona cultivada. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la nueva siembra de productos andinos agrícolas.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Bernadina is a member of the community bank San Martin de Zurite, located in the town of Zurite in the Anta province and Cusco department.  Bernadina is 53 years old, single, and has six children, of whom five are independent and one is 22 years old and still depends on his mother.  

She works in agriculture and has land to cultivate. She plants and harvests corn, barley, wheat, and potatoes.  She sells her crops in the wholesale market.  

She is asking for this loan to cover her new planting, which means removing the soil to prepare it, purchasing seeds and fertilizer, weeding at the middle stage to clear the grasses that grow near the crops, and cleaning the cultivated area.  She is asking for this loan to invest in a new planting of Andean agricultural products.

Bernadina values and is thankful for the loan given and promises to make her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to cover the costs of planting a new crop of Andean agricultural products.

loans.name: Kadija

texts.en: This is 31-year-old Kadija K.. She is married and has four children aged 15, 12, 7 and 3. In 1998, Kadija K. started selling foodstuffs. She began her business after gaining enough experience from her elder sister. Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, she earns about 500,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan of 3,000,000 SLL in order to purchase more food stuff for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. In the future, Kadija plans to build her own dwelling house and educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: FELIPA G. A.: CASADA DE 40 AÑOS TIENE 4 HIJOS DE LOS CUALES 1 YA ESTA CASADO SU SEGUNDO HIJO TRABAJA Y LE AYUDA PARA SACAR ADELANTE A SUS OTROS DOS HIJOS MAS QUE ESTAN ESTUDIANDO,ELLA TIENE NEGOCIO DE VENTAS DE REFACCIONES Y TAMALES, INICIO VENDIENDO HACE 20 AÑOS Y GRACIAS A LA VENTAS Y EL APOYO DE SU ESPOSO PUDO DARLE UNA CARRERA A NIVEL MEDIO A SU HIJA Y SE SIENTE MUY FELIZ AL SABER QUE GRACIAS A SU TRABAJO A PODIDO DARLES LO MEJOR A SU FAMILIA,ELLA NOS CUENTA QUE QUIERE PONER UNA VENTA DE ZAPATOS AMERICANOS YA QUE SOLO VENDE LOS DIAS MIERCOLES,VIERNES Y SABADO. Y EN LAS MAÑANAS SE DEDICA A CUIDAR A UN NIÑO PARA GANERAR UN INGRESO MAS DE DINERO, ELLA SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE ZAPATOS AMERICANOS DE SEGUNDA MANO EL SUEÑO DE ELLA ES SEGUIR APOYANDO A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR Y DARLES UN MEJOR FUTURO A SUS HIJOS.
texts.en:
Felipa García A., 40, is married and has four children.  One of them is already married and her second son works and helps her support her other two children who are still in school.  She has a business selling refreshments and tamales.  She started selling 20 years ago and thanks to sales and help from her husband she was able to provide her daughter with a middle level career.  She feels very happy to know that through her work she was able to give the best to her family.

She tells us that she wants to set up an American shoe sales business on Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays.  During mornings she babysits a little boy to earn extra income.  She is asking for the loan to buy used American shoes.  Her dream is to continue to help her husband with household expenses and provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: to buy used American shoes.

loans.name: Mayra Francisca

texts.es: Mayra Francisca tiene 42 años, es casada y juntos tiene dos hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. Su negocio consiste en la compra y venta de cerdos, recuerda que se inició por su esposo, pues fue con el tiempo que logro hacerse cargo del negocio. Actualmente  su negocio es la principal fuente de ingresos económicos, además tiene más de 4 años con este negocio ya que siempre esta brindado un buen servicio y esto les gusta a sus clientes. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de su local. Este es su segundo crédito se encuentra muy emocionada por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando durante las fechas establecidas. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de cerdos.
texts.en: Mayra Francisca, 42, is married and they have two children who work independently.  Her business consists in buying and selling pigs.  She recalls that it was started by her husband and in time she took over running the business.  Currently it’s their main source of income.  She’s had the business for four years since she always provides good customer service and her customers like this.  Her plan for the future is to expand the business and improve her locale’s conditions.  This is her second loan and she’s very excited so she’s pledging to continue repaying according to the established schedule.  She plans to use the loan to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Lucelly

texts.es:
Lucelly es una mujer que toda su vida ha trabajado para salir adelante junto con su hijo, desde hace 3 años comenzó a vender productos por catálogo, labor en la que se ha capacitado y actualmente le genera los ingresos necesarios para su bienestar, además de eso ella se siente muy afortunada por no tener que cumplir con horarios de oficina, ya que es independiente, trabaja desde su casa y con la comodidad de sus propios horarios.
Lucelly debe surtir mercancía cada determinado tiempo como estrategia para generar más ventas y mayores utilidades, sin embargo su capital no es suficiente para dicha comprar. Su mayor sueño es poder generar un ingreso fijo cada mes gracias a sus ventas.
texts.en:
Lucelly is a woman who has worked all of her life to succeed along with her son.  Three years ago, she began selling products from a catalog, a job which she is very skilled at, and currently generates the income necessary for her well-being.  Additionally, she feels very fortunate that she does not have to follow office hours, since she is independent, and works from home with the convenience of her own schedule.  

Lucelly wants to stock up her merchandise every so often as a strategy to generate more sales and higher profits, however, her capital is not sufficient to make the purchases.  Her dream is to earn a fixed income every month thanks to her sales.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica, de 23 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Hace 5 años convive con Julio, con quien tiene 2 hijos: Harinson y Medaly; a los que cuida en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de San Antonio. Hace 3 años que se dedica a la agricultura, sus principales cultivos constan de papa y flor de gladiolo, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, ya que según menciona; los propios comercializadores de papa llegan a sus terrenos agrícolas para negociar su cosecha, mientras que la flor de gladiolo, lo vende en el mercado central de flores de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ayudar en los gastos familiares a su esposo; pues comparte el cuidado de sus 3 toros, con los que Julio hace el arado de la tierra, con el mantenimiento de sus terrenos agrícolas. Así ambos se organizan para poder tener ingresos extras y de esa manera poder ahorrar para el futuro de sus hijos, a quienes desean brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosa”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe, pues le ayuda a invertir en el mejoramiento de sus cultivos. Angélica, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de 3 toros medianos los cuales criará y engordará para luego venderlos a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Angélica, 23, is a hard working woman.  She’s been living with Julio for five years.  They have two children: Harinson and Medaly, who she cares for in her own house located in the hamlet of San Antonio.  She’s been a farmer for three years.  Her main crops are potatoes and gladiolas which she cares for with much dedication because, as she mentions, the potato wholesalers come to her fields to negotiate for her crops; she sells the gladiolas at Tarma’s central flower market.


What she enjoys the most about her work is being able to help her husband with household expenses because she shares caring for their three bulls which Julio uses to till the soil and maintain his farmland.  This is how both of them organize themselves to earn extra income and save for their children’s future that they want to provide a better quality of life for.

She’s a member of the “Santa Rosa” communal bank and this is her third loan with MFP.  She’s grateful for the help she receives because it will help her invest in the improvement of her crops.  Angélica will use the requested loan to buy three medium size bulls that she’ll raise and fatten up to sell later at a higher price.

loans.use: to buy three bulls.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar comes from Faisalabad which is Pakistan’s third largest city and known for its textile industry. She has been living there in a 4 -oom brick house with her family in the area of Daood Nagar for the past 16 years. She is 35 years old, married to S. K., and has two sons and three daughters. Due to their financial constraints, her elder son couldn’t get an education. He is a professional cook while three of the remaining four are studying at a local school. 

Her husband has a Paan(betel leaves) and cigarette shop in the market. In his shop he also sells cold drinks like Coca-Cola to his customers. Kosar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. Using the loan, he will buy betel leaves, cold drinks and cigarettes of different brands to sell in his shop. 

She hopes that the loan investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and his monthly income will grow.  

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Kosar.

loans.use: To buy betel leaves, cold drinks and cigarettes.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es:
María es una pequeña comerciante, de venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos, siendo su medio para apoyar a sus hijos.
Inicio con fondos propios, dinero de un alquiler de cuarto, y gracias a los financiamientos que Afodenic dio por medio del préstamo. Siendo su tercer ciclo, lo que vino a mejorar sus ventas al comprar más cantidad de ropa, zapatos, para grande y pequeños.
Con este nuevo préstamo será invertido en la compra de una docena de pantalón de vestir de varón, una docena, de blusas para dama, faldas, sandalias, a si como la compra de cosméticos. Lo que espera seguir trabajando para obtener mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
María is a small businesswoman; she sells clothes, shoes and cosmetics.  This is how she supports her children.  She started out with funds of her own, money she got from renting out a room, and thanks to loans from Afodenic.  This is her third cycle.  What improved her sales was buying larger amounts of clothes and shoes for adults and children.

This new loan will be used to buy a dozen pairs of men’s dress pants, a dozen women’s blouses, skirts and sandals as well as to purchase cosmetics.  She hopes to continue working to attain better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy assorted clothes, sandals and cosmetics.

loans.name: Indiana Del Socorro

texts.es: Indiana  tiene su negocio que es una pulpería. Inicio poco a poco ahorro y de esta manera, hoy en día gracias a todo el esfuerzo que realiza diario es que sigue con este negocio. Su fuerza luchadora que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para convertirse en una mujer empresaria. Ahora ha ganando experiencia, confianza y ya es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes. Con este crédito comprará diferentes tipos de productos como leche, carnes, golosinas, avena café,  sopas, enlatados, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal. Indiana está contenta con la actividad que realiza día a día y agradece al Fundación León 2000 y Kiva por contribuir con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Indiana has a grocery store.  She started bit by bit.  She saved and today, thanks to all her daily effort, she’s still in business.  Her strength as a fighter that’s always characterized her and the desire to get ahead through her own efforts have led her to become an enterprising woman.  Now, she has experience, confidence and is very well known and liked by her customers.

She will use this loan to buy different types of products like: milk, meats, sweets, oatmeal, coffee, soup, canned goods, home cleaning supplies and personal hygiene items.  Indiana is happy with the activity she carries out daily and is grateful to Fundación León and to Kiva for contributing to the realization of her dreams and reaching her goals.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad, de 34 años es una mujer trabajadora que junto a su esposo Erick; con quien convive desde hace 7 años. Cuidan de sus 4 hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de San Antonio. Desde que tenía 15 años comenzó a dedicarse a la agricultura, aprendiendo de sus padres todas las técnicas de cultivo. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, arveja y habas, productos que cuida y fertiliza constantemente en sus propios terrenos agrícolas que le fue heredado de sus padres, a quienes quiere mucho. Menciona que le va muy bien en la comercialización de estos alimentos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, pues tiene habilidad en la negociación de sus productos. Asimismo se dedica a la venta de madera, comprando grandes lotes de árboles, para después procesarlos. Su principal inconveniente son los gastos económicos que realiza en la educación de sus hijos. Teniendo que alquilar una casa en la ciudad de Tarma para que pueda estudiar y recibir una mejor educación. Por eso sus planes son ahorrar lo necesario para comprar su casa propia, y así poder minimizar los gastos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosa”, y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo constante que recibe de parte de sus integrantes. Soledad, invertirá el crédito en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja, como también varios sacos de abono orgánico; que esparcirá después de la siembra.
texts.en:
Soledad is 34 years old. She and her husband Erick have been together for seven years. They have four children and live in their own home in the village of San Antonio. Soledad began farming 15 years ago, utilizing the cultivation techniques that she learned from her parents. Her main crops consist of potatoes, peas, and beans. She cares for and constantly fertilizes the crops grown on the land that she inherited from her parents who she loves dearly. Soledad says that she has done a good job selling her products at the wholesale market in the city, where she is able to utilize her negotiation skills. In addition, she sells wood. Soledad buys tree trunks by the lot for subsequent processing. Her main challenge is being able to pay for her children’s education. She rents a house in the city of Tarma so that her children can study and receive the best education. For this reason, she plans to save enough money to buy a house so that she can minimize her expenses.

Soledad is a member of the Santa Rosa Communal Bank. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is grateful for the constant support that she receives from the other members. Soledad will invest her loan in the purchase of a bag of seeds for planting peas and several sacks of organic fertilizer that she will apply on her crops after they have been sown.

loans.use: purchase sacks of organic fertilizer and seeds for planting peas.

loans.name: Blanca Isvelia

texts.es: Blanca F. P., es una mujer muy trabajadora que vive  en Carrizal, un barrio al sur de Barranquilla de gente trabajadora alegre y dinámica,  donde la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo tiene una gran acogida;  allí también funciona su  negocio de vender suero al por mayor,  producto elaborado a base de leche, con el cual ha logrado generar ingresos para el mejoramiento de su familia, conformada por ella y sus tres hijos ya en las edades de 22 a 30 años. Ella tiene clientes en la ciudad y los distribuye  en compañía de otras personas pero fracasaron en esta actividad mientras Blanca Isvelia salió adelante y aun la sostiene, en ella creyeron sus proveedores y fueron ellos  quienes principalmente la apoyaron para sostenerlo en la primera etapa; Con su negocio ha logrado  la educación de sus hijos  y la adquisición de su vivienda, ella en sus tiempos libres trabaja en un almacén ubicado cerca a su vivienda y con ello genera otros ingresos para su hogar; este es su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el primero   logró  mayor tranquilidad al poder comprar de contado y con menos afanes; su sueño es ahora  adquirir un local, porque el que actualmente tiene está ubicado en su vivienda y ocupa mucho espacio de ella. Mientras tanto Blanca continua trabajando con utilidades promedias sobre las ventas  de un 30% , que quiere seguir incrementando en la medida en que más rote su cartera.Con la aplicación de su credikiva comprará suero en mayor cantidad, porque se han incrementado sus clientes e incursionará en otros sectores donde ya tiene solicitud.
texts.en:
Blanca F. P. is a hardworking woman who lives in Carrizal, a neighborhood in southern Barranquilla full of working class people who are cheerful and dynamic. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo also has a great reception in this area. Blanca has a wholesale business selling powdered whey (a nutritional product made from milk) that has enabled her to generate income to support her family that consists of herself and three children who range in age from 22 to 30. She has customers all over the city and started distributing her products with other people who failed in this same type of business. However, Blanca has been able to succeed and maintain her business. Her suppliers trusted her and were the ones responsible for supporting her during the early stages of her business. Through her business, Blanca has been able to provide her children with an education and acquire a home.

This is her second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Her first loan provided greater peace of mind because she was able to buy inventory with cash and without any hassles. Now her dream is to acquire a storefront because she currently works at home and her business is taking up much space. Meanwhile, Blanca continues to work and generate an average of 30% profit from her sales. She wants to increase her margins by shortening her product turnover period. With this Kiva loan, Blanca will purchase powdered whey in large quantities so that she can increase her customer base and expand to other areas that are requesting her product.

loans.use: to purchase powdered whey in bulk.

loans.name: Gloria Franceny

texts.es:
Hace 3 meses a Gloria  M. se le presentó la oportunidad de montar su propio negocio, una cafetería ubicada en un punto estratégico del municipio de Sonsón en el departamento de Antioquia donde hoy en día puede aplicar todos los  conocimientos obtenidos en otro lugar donde trabajó durante 9 años; a pesar de tener su propio negocio Gloria arrienda tanto el local como la silletería y los utensilios necesarios para llevar a cabo su actividad, lo que ocupa gran parte de sus ganancias.

Gloria quiere surtir su cafetería con gran variedad de productos, que puede comprar al por mayor, pero como su negocio apenas comienza y las ventas aun no generan suficientes utilidades necesita capital para poder comprar la mercancía. Su gran sueño es poder tener un local propio y dotado completamente para ser la dueña de su cafetería y así poderle asegurar bienestar económico a sus 2 hijos, quienes aun son muy pequeños.
texts.en:
Gloria M. was presented with the opportunity three months ago to start her own business, a cafeteria located in a strategic area of the town of Sonsón in the Department of Antioquia. Today she is able to apply all of the knowledge she obtained while working at another establishment for nine years. Despite owning her business, Gloria pays rent on her location as well as the dining sets and utensils needed to operate her establishment. These expenses consume a large part of her earnings.

Gloria wants to stock her cafeteria with a wide variety of products. She wants to buy in bulk, but since her business just started and her sales have not generated enough profit, she needs capital to buy this merchandise. Her greatest wish is to have a shop that is fully equipped and become the outright owner of her cafeteria. This will enable her to secure the financial welfare of her two children, who are still very young.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es: Zulema, de 26 años; convive desde hace 4 años con Héctor, con quien tiene una hija llamada Sharmely, a la que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Tapo. La actividad a la que se dedica es la agricultura, el cual lo realiza en sus propios terrenos ubicados a las afueras de la comunidad. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, habas, arveja y maíz; ya tiene 3 años de experiencia y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder trasmitir el conocimiento que le heredaron sus padres. Asimismo afirma que siembra en sociedad con una señora, con quien comparte los gastos de semilla, abono y fertilizantes que requiere sus cultivos; pero lo que más le agrada es el cuidado de animales menores, como cuyes; los cuales comercializa a un buen precio en el mercado modelo de la ciudad de Tarma donde vende de acuerdo a los pedidos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosa”, y este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde oportunidad de progreso que le brindan. Zulema, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de 2 toros medianos, los cuales cuidará y engordará para luego comercializarlo a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Zulema is 26 years old and has lived with Héctor for four years. They have a daughter named Sharmely who they take care of in their own home in the village of Tapo. Zulema earns her living through farming. She has her own land located outside of the community. Her main crops consist of potatoes, beans, peas, and corn. She has three years of experience farming and what she enjoys most about her work is passing on the knowledge she gained from her parents. Zulema also says that she partners with another woman with whom she shares the costs of seeds, compost, and fertilizers used for their crops. However, what gives her the most enjoyment is taking care of domesticated animals such as guinea pigs. She sells the animals at a good price at the standard market in the city of Tarma, the place where she receives her orders.

Zulema is a member of the Santa Rosa Communal Bank. This is her third loan with MFP, the organization that has provided her with opportunities to make progress. She will invest the loan she requested in the purchase of two medium-sized bulls that she will care for and fatten so that she can sell them later at a better price.

loans.use: to purchase two bulls for fattening.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy tiene 45 años, su actividad económica es la venta de comida. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio, el lucha todos los días por salir adelante con su negocio. Inicio poco a poco con la ayuda de su esposa ofreciendo muy pocos platillos porque no tenía el suficiente capital para ofrecerles a sus clientes una variedad de productos, pero esto no desanimo a Freddy a seguir creciendo con su negocio, por lo que más tarde decidió realizar financiamientos con el fin de mejorar en su negocio. Actualmente solicita un financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de golosinas, sopas, jugos, gaseosas y frutas. Su deseo es satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Freddy is 45 years old and has been in the business of selling food for more than 18 years. He struggles every day to stay ahead in his business. Freddy started out little by little offering a few dishes with the help of his wife, but he did not have sufficient capital to provide a varied menu to his customers. This did not discourage Freddy from continuing to expand his business. Later on he decided to secure financing so that he could improve his business.

At the moment, the loan he is requesting will be used as operating capital for purchasing sweets, soups, juices, sodas, and fruits. His wish is to satisfy the demands of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase sweets, soups, juices, sodas, and fruits.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Lucia, es casada y tiene 50 años de edad,  la socia tiene 10 hijos de los cuales 7 están vivos, la socia aún apoya a 5 hijos  (20, 18, 16, 15, 10) años de edad; La socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, ella tiene este pequeño negocio en casa y así mismo la socia posee tierras agrícolas en las cuales produce papa, maíz y verduras. La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la alimentación de sus animalitos, ella cría pollos, gallinas, cuyes, y las verduras que le producen sus tierras las vende al por mayor en la feria a los compradores mayoristas que llegan para comprar toda la cosecha de los pobladores y llevárselas al exterior del país. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y comprar animales menores.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucia is a member of the Communal Bank “San Martin de Zurite” which is located in the town of Zurite in Anta Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 50 years old, married, and has 10 children but only 7 are living. Lucia supports five of them (ages 20, 18, 16, 15, and 10). She raises farm animals and has a small business in her home. Lucia also has farmland on which she grows potatoes, corn, and vegetables. She needs a loan to invest in the feeding of her animals. Lucia raises chickens, hens, and guinea pigs. The vegetables that are produced on her land are sold in bulk at the fair to wholesalers who come to acquire the entire harvest of the villagers in order to sell the produce abroad. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and farm animals.

Lucia appreciates and values the loan that has been provided to her. For this reason, she promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and farm animals.

loans.name: Saira's Group

texts.en:
Saira got an education up to 10th standard, but couldn’t get higher education due to her parents' poor financial conditions. She got married 10 years ago to K. A. who operates a detergent-sales business. He used to wash clothes.
 
Saira has given birth to four children. Three of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education while her youngest one is only two years old. She herself is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is also a very caring mother and takes care of her children very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. Using the loan, her husband will buy washing powder in bulk quantity to sell and to increase his profits. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Saira is hopeful that after investing the loan into his business, her husband will be able to improve the financial condition of his business further. 

She comes from an industrial city of Pakistan known as Faisalabad. She lives there in a 2-room brick house in the area of Daood Nagar. She  moved here after her marriage 10 years ago. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Saira.

loans.use: To buy detergent for resale.

loans.name: Yury Marcela

texts.es: Yury Marcela desde hace varios años se desempeña como regente de farmacia, sin embargo su familia ha sido agricultora y su padre ha trabajado la tierra todo su vida, es por esto que Yury quiere no solo poder aprender y ayudar a su padre en los cultivos que actualmente tiene, sino también poder recibir otros ingresos; así no solo inicia su propio negocio, sino que también puede mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Yury Marcela has worked as a pharmacy manager for many years.  However, her family is in agriculture and her father has worked the land all of his life.  For this reason, Yury not only wants to learn how to farm, but help her father with his current crops so that she can receive another source of income.  By starting her own business, she will be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To pay for compost and irrigation.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol, de 30 años, convive desde hace 11 años con Percy, su esposo. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Lizbeth y Zidane, a los que quiere mucho en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de San Antonio. La actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 11 años es la agricultura. Sus principales cultivos constan de papa, arveja y maíz. Productos que siembra en las afueras de su localidad, donde tiene sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las temporadas de campaña agrícolas, donde tiene mayores ingresos económicos, ya que realiza buenos negocios en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Ahora tiene sembrado arveja y habas, que cosechará dentro de unos meses. Marisol, tiene terrenos que se conectan con el río por eso puede sembrar en cualquier temporada del año.”No tengo problemas con el clima”, afirma. Es por está razón que necesita capital de trabajo constante, ya que siembra y cosecha de manera inmediata. Ella pertenece al banco comunal, “Santa Rosa”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan. Marisol, invertirá el crédito en la compra de semilla de papa de la variedad “única”, lo cual sembrará en sus terrenos agrícolas que tiene acceso al río, y de esa manera podrá regar a sus cultivos para que den fruto.
texts.en:
Marisol, age 30, has been living with her husband Percy for 11 years.  They have two children, Lizbeth and Zidane.  She and her family have their own home in the village of San Antonio.  Marisol has been farming for 11 years.  Her main crops consist of potatoes, peas, and corn.  She grows these products on land that she owns on the outskirts of her community.  What she enjoys most about the work is being able to sell her crops because she is able to generate a good income.  Marisol conducts a good level of business at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  At the moment, she has planted peas and beans that will be harvested in a few months.  Marisol has land that is connected to the river, which allows her to plant at any time of the year.  “I have not had any problems with the weather,” she claims.  For this reason, she is in constant need of operating capital so that she can plant and harvest immediately.  

Marisol is a member of the Santa Rosa Communal Bank.  This is her first loan with MFP and she is grateful for the opportunity that has been given to her.  Marisol will invest the loan in the purchase of potato seedlings of the “única” variety so that she can begin planting on her land that has access to the river, which allows her to irrigate her crops so that they can bear produce.

loans.use: to purchase potato seedlings.

loans.name: Solema

texts.es: Solema, de 43 años, es una mujer humilde y muy sencilla. Vive junto a su esposo, con quien convive desde hace 25 años. Ambos tuvieron 7 hijos; pero solo viven con 6 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de San Antonio. Todas las mañanas se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas ubicados a las afueras de su localidad, como es de costumbre se dirige con sus instrumentos de trabajo, ya que diariamente tiene que sacar la maleza que crece de entre sus cultivos. Sus principales productos son papa, arveja, maíz, habas y zanahoria, productos que comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde viaja en cada cosecha. Asimismo, como mujer del campo se dedica a la crianza de toros, los cuales compra para después engordarlos, llevando a la ciudad de Huancayo, donde los vende a un mayor precio, “crío un promedio de 3 a 4 ejemplares, donde gano S/. 200 soles como mínimo”, menciona. Su principal inconveniente son los gastos de alimentación y vestido de sus hijos, por los que continuará trabajando con más esfuerzo y ahínco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosa”, y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que le brindaron por tantos años. Solema, terminó el periodo de cosecha; por ello con el crédito solicitado comprará 2 toros, los cuales engordará y venderá a un mayor precio, y así tener capital de trabajo en el nuevo periodo de cosecha.
texts.en:
Solema, age 43, is a simple and humble woman. She and her husband have been together for 25 years. They have seven children, but only six live with them in the house they own in the village of San Antonio. Every morning Solema proceeds to her farmland located outside of town. Her daily routine involves carrying her work tools with her because she spends a great deal of time removing weeds that can negatively impact the growth of her crops. Her main products are potatoes, peas, corn, beans, and carrots. These products are sold at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, the place where she travels to after each harvest. In addition, Solema engages in raising bulls. After purchasing her animals, she fattens them before taking them to the city of Huancayo to be sold at a better price. “I raise three or four young bulls at a time and earn at least 200 PEN for each one,” says Solema. Her main challenge is being able to clothe her children and provide them with an education, so she continues to work with great effort and dedication.

Solema is a member of the Santa Rosa Communal Bank. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is grateful for the support that has been extended to her over the years. She just finished the harvest period, so she is requesting a loan to buy two bulls to fatten and sell at a better price. This will provide her with operating capital for the next harvest season.

loans.use: to purchase two bulls.

loans.name: Wayna Taucaray Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “WAYNA TAUCARAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Griselda; ella es soltera y tiene 28 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de huevos por paquetes, ella vende los días domingo en el mercado y los otros días ayuda a su mama en el negocio de restaurant, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de huevos y también el negocio del restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar huevos y productos para cocinar para el restaurant.                                                                    

Los otros socios  se dedican la venta de chicha, transporte, tienda de abarrotes, maestro de construcción  y venta de frutas. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Wayna Taucaray” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

Srta. Griselda is one of the members. She is 28 years old and single. Griselda works in her own business selling packets of eggs. She sells at the market on Sundays, but on other days she helps her mother with her restaurant business. Griselda works from 8am to 7pm. She wants to improve her egg business as well as her mother’s restaurant. Griselda is requesting a loan to buy eggs and cooking supplies for the restaurant.

The other members sell “chicha” (a beverage made of corn), engage in transportation, sell groceries, work in construction, and sell fruits.

Griselda is grateful to be part this group so that she can fulfill her dream. She promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase eggs and cooking supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Doña Ana H. P., es casada, tiene 45 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. asistir a una escuela, tiene 3 hijos 2 D. los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica a oficios domestico y a la crianza D. animales, lleva 12 años D. experiencia con este oficio, inició este oficio por iniciativa propia y deseos D. superación; cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica a la confección D. tejidos.

DeciD. organizar un grupo con el objeto D. solicitar un préstamo a ASDIR, que servirá como capital para comprar cerdos y gallinas para crianza, para que cuando han crecido los revenda a mayor costo. Las integrantes D. este grupo se dedican a diversas activdades como: Venta D. ropa deportiva, venta D. ropa típica, atender tienda D. consumo diario, confección D. pants, sudaderos y playeras, y la crianza D. animales doméstiC.. Esperan ver su negocio granD. y con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana H. P. is a 45-year-old married woman who never had the opportunity to go to school. She has three children, two of whom are in school. She has been working as a housekeeper and raising animals for 12 years now. Ana began working of her own initiative because she wanted to improve her situation. She has the support of her husband, who makes fabric for a living.

Ana decided to organize a group in order to request a loan from ASDIR. This loan will allow the group to buy pigs and chickens which they will raise and then sell for a higher price once they are fully grown. The members of this group have different kinds of jobs including: selling sportswear, selling traditional clothing, working in a store which sells basic goods, making pants, sweatshirts and shoes, and raising pets. They would like to grow their business and earn more money.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Marina, es viuda y tiene 76 años de edad,  tiene 4 hijos y 9 nietos; la socia nos comenta que ya sus hijos son independientes y que ella desea continuar en el grupo de bancos comunales porque esto la mantiene ocupada y le da fuerzas para continuar trabajando y viviendo, ella es una mujer muy alegre y de buen sentido del humor, la socia tiene como principal actividad la agricultura y aunque en la actualidad los hijos y nietos le ayuden a sembrar y cosechar las tierras de cultivo, ella sigue siendo participe, la socia también cría animales menores, ella cría chanchos, cuyes, pollos, la socia está en el grupo desde el inicia, cuando este grupo se formo se hizo las reuniones en su casa y actualmente lo siguen haciendo aquí, la socia tiene 12 años en el banco como miembro activo, ella desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de alimento para sus animales, y aumentar pollos y cuyes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores y alimento.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Marina C. B. is a member of the village bank, “San Martin De Zurite." This bank is located in the village of Zurite in the Anta province of the department of Cusco.

Marina is a 76-year-old widow. She has four children and nine grandchildren and she tells us that her children are already independent. Marina wants to keep participating in the village banking group because it keeps her busy and gives her the strength that she needs to keep working and living. She is a very happy woman and has a good sense of humor. 

Marina mainly works as a farmer. Currently her children and grandchildren are actually working alongside her to plant and harvest the crops on her land. She also raises small animals such as pigs, guinea pigs and chickens. Marina has been in the village banking group since the beginning. Back when the group was formed, she would hold the meetings at her house and this is where they are still held today. Marina has been an active member of the group for 12 years now. She plans to use the loan to buy feed for her animals and to purchase more chickens and guinea pigs. She would like to purchase more small animals and animal feed.

Marina appreciates and is grateful for the loan that has been awarded. She promises to be very disciplined about making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase small animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Olga Lucía

texts.es: Olga Lucía desde hace 20 años trabaja como Profesional de Belleza, sin embargo desde hace 17 años ella tiene su sala de belleza en su casa, donde atiende a todos clientes y les brinda un espacio para la buena atención, es por esto que para poder tener una mejorar su servicio y así incrementar sus clientes Olga Lucía necesita dotar la sala de belleza con implementos necesarios para su servicio, además de esta forma puede incrementar sus  ingresos y continuar enseñándole a su hija esta labor que por 20 años ha sido su forma de vida.
texts.en: Olga Lucía has worked as a beauty professional for 20 years. For the past 17 years, she has run a beauty salon out of her home where she provides all of her customers with special care and attention. This is how she has been able to improve her customer service and thus gain more customers. Olga Lucía needs to equip her beauty salon with the necessary supplies. What's more, this will allow her to increase her income and continue teaching her daughter the profession that has been her way of life for 20 years now.

loans.use: to purchase beauty supplies.

loans.name: José Jesús

texts.es: José Jesús tiene 48 años, es un hombre muy luchador y además disfruta mucho de su trabajo. La actividad económica de José es la venta de dulce, sorgo, maní entre otros productos. Hace 18 años que se dedica a este negocio, este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres que eran negociantes y le enseñaron de este medio de vida. José sale todos los días en su camioneta a vender los diferentes productos que ofrece para él es reconfortante que sus clientes se encuentren satisfechos con lo que ofrece. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compa de la variedad de productos que ofrece como dulce, sorgo, maní, granos básicos.
texts.en: José Jesús is a very hardworking 48-year-old man. What's more, he really enjoys his work. José works selling candy, sorghum and peanuts, among other products. He has been in this business for 18 years now. He learned the trade from his parents, salespeople who taught him this profession. José goes out every day in his truck to sell various products. He is glad to know that his customers are happy with their purchases. The reason he has requested this loan is to purchase the various products that he sells, such as candy, sorghum, peanuts and dry grains.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products to sell such as candy, sorghum, peanuts and dry grains.

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan is a resident of Daood Nagar which is a small residential area located in Faisalabad. Faisalabad is Pakistan’s third largest city and well known for its textile industry. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family for the past 9 years. 

Her husband's name is A. and he is a security guard. She is the mother of one son who is a bus conductor. He couldn’t get an education due to the family's poor financial conditions and started work at an early age to financially support the family. 

To help support her family financially, Bashiraan runs a grocery store adjacent to her home. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy groceries for her grocery store. She started this business 5 years ago and has managed to attract a good clientele base in her area because she offers them quality goods at cheap prices
. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Bashiraan.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her own grocery store business.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de helados y crianza de animales y también ella trabaja en un grifo desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m y en las tardes vende los helados, la socia quiere ampliar los negocios. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer los helados y alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a member of the village bank, "San Isidro de Yanahuara." The bank is located in the Urubamba district of the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco.

Luz Marina is a 30-year-old married woman with two children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her work selling ice cream and raising animals. She also works at a gas station from 8:00am to 1:00pm and she sells ice cream in the afternoon. She would like to grow her business. She requested the loan in order to buy ingredients to make ice cream and animal feed. 

Luz Marina is grateful for the loan and is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make ice cream and animal feed.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Héctor, de 23 años, vive en concubinato desde hace 2 años con Angélica; con quien tuvo 2 hijos: Roli y Abel, a los que cuida en una casa alquilada, ubicada en Vista Hermosa-Tarma. Como joven trabajador y responsable, se dedica a varias actividades. Una de ellas es la agricultura, donde siembra papa, en su terreno agrícola del caserío de San Antonio. Asimismo se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras y hortalizas en el mercado de San Ramón (selva central peruana), donde obtiene buenas ganancias, ya que por esa zona es muy escaso el producto. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es el apoyo que recibe de parte de su familia, quien le ayuda en la venta diaria de las verduras, ya que también se dedica al trabajo de alcantarillado del gobierno local de Tarma, donde recibe un dinero extra por parte del estado. Por ello cada noche, como menciona; se siente agotado por los múltiples trabajos que realiza, pero con el fin de ver a sus hijos cómodos y brindándole lo necesario; le estimula para seguir adelante. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosa”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde es el más joven de los miembros por lo que agrade los consejos que recibe de parte de ellos. Héctor, constantemente necesita capital de trabajo para su negocio, por ello invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios kilos de verduras y hortalizas.
texts.en:
Héctor, 23, and Angélica have lived together unmarried for the last two years. They have two children: Roli and Abel that they care for in a rented house located in Vista Hermosa-Tarma.  Being a hard working, responsible young man he has several jobs.  One of them is farming.  He grows potatoes on his land in the hamlet of San Antonio.  He also sells vegetables in the San Ramón market (Peruvian central jungle) where he earn good profits because it’s area where these products are scarce.

What he most enjoys about his work is the support he gets from his family that helps him with his daily vegetable sales because he also works for the local Tarma government earning a salary working in drainage.

As he mentions, therefore, every night he’s exhausted because of the various jobs he does but wanting to see his children comfortable and with everything they need he’s motivated to continue forward.

He’s a member of the “Santa Rosa” communal bank and this is his 6th loan with MFP where he’s the youngest member.  He enjoys the advice he gets from them.  Héctor constantly needs working capital for his business so will use the requested loan to buy several kilograms of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy several kilograms of vegetables.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Josefina; ella tiene 69 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales, ella cria animales como gallinas, cuyes y chanchos y luego los vende al público en general a los que tienen restaurant y preparan caldo de gallina, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos, cuyes y chanchos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Josefina, 69, is a member of the “San Isidro de Yanahuara” communal bank located in Urubamba District which belongs to Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.

She is a widow and has 7 children.  She alternates her daily chores with a livestock raising business; she raises animals like chickens, guinea pigs and pigs that she later sells to the general public and to restaurant owners who make chicken soup.  She wants to improve the business of raising animals and is asking for a loan to buy chickens, guinea pigs and pigs at wholesale.  She is happy about the loan and commits to pay her installments.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs and pigs at wholesale.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Haydee, es casada y tiene 45 años de edad,  tiene 3 hijos de 25,24,14 años de edad la socia tiene un pequeño kiosco escolar en la escuela fiscal de Zurite, la socia vende desde galletas y todo tipo de golosinas hasta bebidas frías, la socia mantiene su kiosco surtido y siempre tiene lo que a los niños les gusta, ella también vende sándwich de pollo, jamón, queso y huevo; ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, la socia cría chanchos, cuyes y los vende en las ferias al por mayor, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y apoya en los estudios a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores y comprar golosinas, bebidas e implementar su kiosco escolar.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The associate, Ms Haydee, belongs to the communal bank "SAN MARTIN Zurita" located in the Town of Zurite, Anta province and department of Cusco.

Ms. Haydee is married, 45 years old and has 3 children aged 25,24,14.  She has a small kiosk in the tax school Zurite, where she sells everything from cookies and all sorts of goodies to cold drinks.  She, keeps the kiosk stocked and always has what the kids like, including sandwiches of chicken , ham, cheese and eggs.  The associate is also engaged in raising small animals, such as pigs and guinea pigs and sells them wholesale at trade fairs.

She is a hard-working woman and supports the studies of her children. The associate requests the loan to buy small animals as well as to buy sweets and drinks for her school kiosk.

She values ​​and appreciates the loan and agrees to comply with the payment of its debts in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: buy small animals as well as to buy sweets and drinks for her school kiosk.

loans.name: Sugey Marina

texts.es: Sugey Marian B. de 34 años es una mujer que trabaja incansablemente dedicada al comercio; ella tiene un negocio donde vende ropa, calzado, cosméticos y variedades; con este negocio ha logrado incrementar los ingresos familiares y sacar adelante a sus dos  hijas de 13 y 15 años en su desarrollo personal y educativo. Este es el cuarto financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está aplicando a su credikiva con el cual comprará ropa femenina y calzado,  para atender la demanda de estos productos, a propósito de la secuencia de épocas especiales que se avecinan, como el día de la madre, del padre etc.  Sugey ha sido todo el tiempo una mujer emprendedora, cuando inició en el año 2000 su vida como comerciante, lo hizo con un estanco vendiendo licores en Concordia, una población del departamento  del Magdalena y más adelante cuando se trasladó a Barranquilla inició su negocio de mercancías variada y hasta la fecha no se ha detenido, obteniendo diariamente pequeños y grandes logros, como el incremento de su capital de trabajo, con el apoyo de los financiamientos de la Fundación y el fortalecimiento de su autonomía e independencia como mujer separada , en la búsqueda de un mejor bienestar para sus hijas. Su sueño ahora se concentra en tener su casa propia pues en la actualidad habita en una familiar, por eso se desvive por aumentar cada día más el número de clientes y ofrecer las mejores opciones del mercado mientras su rentabilidad no es menor de un 21% y ella imprime todo su dinamismo al servicio de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sugey Marian B. is 34 years old and  is a woman who works tirelessly in her business.  She sells clothing, footwear, cosmetics and a variety of other goods and with this business she has managed to increase family income and support her two daughters, who are 13 and 15 years old, advance in their personal and educational development. 

This is the fourth loan that she receives from the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.   It is being implemented with Kiva to buy women's clothing and footwear to meet the demand for these products expected due to the sequence of special events to come, such as mother's day, or father's day etc. 

Sugey has always been an enterprising woman.  When she began her life as a trader in in 2000, she worked in a tobacco store selling liquor in Concordia, a town of Magdalena department.  She later moved to Barranquilla where she began her business of selling various goods and to date has not stopped, with large and small achievements daily, including increased working capital through funding support from the Foundation and the strengthening of her autonomy and independence as an independent women in search of better welfare for her daughters. 

Her dream is focused on owning her own home, because she now lives with a relative.  That is why she is works hard every day to increase the number of her customers and offer the best options in the market.  With profitability not less than 21%, she puts all her dynamism to the service of her customers.

loans.use: purchase women's clothing and foorwear for sale

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lisbeth; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales, ella cría los animales como pollos y cuyes y luego los hace engordar y luego los vende  en forma ambulatoria y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere refaccionar su habitación donde habita. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como cemento, yeso y arena para refaccionar la habitación.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Lisbeth, a member of the San Isidro de Yanahuara Communal Bank, located in the Urubamaba district, Urubamba province and Cusco department.

Lisbeth is 32 years, she lives with her partner and she has 2 children. She alternates her daily chores with an animal breeding activity. She breeds animas such as chickens and “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig); she fattens them and then she sells them on the streets. Thanks to this job she is able to provide for her children. She wants to make repairs to her house, and the loan she is requesting will be used to buy materials such as cement, plaster and sand to have her house repaired.

She is happy with the loan and she commits to complying with the repayments of her dues.

loans.use: To buy materials such as cement, plaster and sand to have her house repaired.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO-YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Vicente; el tiene 53 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ganado y también tiene negocio de transporte, ella tiene una combi que hace servicio urbano en la ruta de yanahuara y Urubamba y por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de ganados y de transporte. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para el ganado y mantenimiento para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Señor Vincente is 53 years old, married and has 3 children.  He is a member of the communal bank San Isidro-Yanahuara located in the district of Urubamba in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.  He alternates his daily activities between his business of buying and selling livestock and his transport business.  He has a combi [micro van]  that he uses to provide urban transportation services on the Yanahuara and Urubamba route.  Through these businesses he is able to provide for his children.  He wants to improve his livestock sales business and his transport business.  He is requesting a loan to purchase livestock feed and to maintain his vehicle.  He is happy about the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: Emilio tiene 43 años es un hombre trabajador que ama mucho a su esposa Sonia, con quien vive desde hace 25 años, y producto de su unión nacieron 5 hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de San Antonio. Desde muy joven conoció la responsabilidad y el trabajo arduo que le enseñó la agricultura. Actividad en la que se dedica desde hace 26 años aproximadamente, sus principales sembríos constan de papa, arveja y habas; los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, pues sabe que cada día es vital para poder tener una buena cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son los últimos días de periodo de maduración de sus cultivos, pues ve concretado su esfuerzo. Asimismo cuenta que paralelo a este trabajo se dedica a la crianza de 50 carneros, los cuales engorda para después venderlos a un carnicero de la localidad de Acobamba que lo visita cada mes. Por ahora, desea seguir produciendo la tierra y cuidando de sus animales, los cuales realiza con la ayuda de 2 caballos que le sirven como trasporte, además de los 2 toros que le ayudan en el arado de la tierra y de sus 2 vacas que producen la leche que consume diariamente. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosa”, y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente realizado, pues encontró una oportunidad para salir adelante. Emilio, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico que esparcirá en sus sembríos de papa de la variedad “canchan”, que cosechará en el mes de julio aproximadamente y si el dinero le alcanza comprará un toro para engordar.
texts.en:
Emilio is 43 years old and is a hard worker, who very much loves his wife Sonia, with whom he has lived for 25 years, The product of their union is 5 children that they care for in their own house in the village of San Antonio. At a young age he learned the responsibility and hard work taught by agriculture. He as been devoted to this activity for approximately 26 years and his main crops consist of potatoes, peas and beans, of which he takes great care, knowing that every day is vital to having a good harvest. What he likes most about his job are the final days of the ripening period for his crops, when he sees his efforts materialized. 

In addition to this work, he is dedicated to raising his 50 sheep, which he fattens to sell to a butcher in the town of Acobamba, who he visits each month. For now, he wants to continue producing on his land and tending his animals, with the help of his 2 horses that serve as transportation, in addition to the 2 bulls that help in plowing and his 2 cows that produce the milk they consume daily. 

He belongs to the communal bank "Santa Rosa", and this is the seventh loan from MFP, where he feels fulfilled and has found an opportunity to succeed. Emilio will invest the requested loan to buy bags of organic compost to spread on his "canchan" variety potato fields, which are generally harvested in July. If there is sufficient money he will buy a bull to fatten.

loans.use: buy sacks of organic compost.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jovita; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos entre otros productos y también se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos y ganados, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar y aceite al por mayor y también para comprar animales para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA” community bank. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and departament of Cuzco.

This member is named Jovita. She is 50 years old, married and has 3 children. She alternates between her daily activities and her grocery store business. She sells  basic neccesity products such as rice, sugar, and pasta, among others. She also works in the business of raising animals such as pigs and cattle. She wants to expand her grocery store and animal raising business. She is asking for the loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, and oil wholesale and also to buy feed for the animals. 

Jovia is happy with the loan and is committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar and oil wholesale as well as to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El padre de Juan Carlos trabaja la agricultura en la producción de palos de aguacate para la comercialización, Juan Carlos desde hace 3 años comenzó aprender esta labor y su padre le cedió un espacio en el invernadero para que el inicie su propio negocio; es por esto que él quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para iniciar su negocio y así podrá construir un mejor futuro para él y su familia.
texts.en: Juan Carlos' father works in agriculture, producing avocados for market. Three years ago, Juan Carlos started to learn the trade and his father gave him some greenhouse space so he could start his own business. That is why he wants to buy the necessary materials to start his own business and thus build a better future for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy traditional clothes

loans.name: Barbara

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Barbara; ella tiene 71 años de edad y es casada y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de mates medicinales, ella prepara de diferentes hierbas y también se dedica a la agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde siembra maíz, papa y zanahoria y luego lo vende en Urubamba, la socia quiere ampliar sus negocios. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar hierbas medicinales y para comprar semillas para sus tierras de cultivo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Barbara is a member of the “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Barbara is 71 years old, married, and has seven children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling medicinal infusions.  She prepares her infusions from different herbs and also farms.  She has a plot of land where she grows corn, potatoes and carrots which she sells in Urubamba.  Barbara would like to expand her businesses.  She is requesting this loan to buy medicinal herbs and to buy seeds for her farmland.

Barbara is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy medicinal herbs and to buy seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca tiene 58 años. Ella se dedica a brindar el servicio de costura,  tiene más de 6 años de tener esta actividad, es una persona muy responsable y disfruta  de tener este medio de vida. Inicio este medio de vida por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos del hogar, ya que ella necesita de este medio de vida. A pesar de no tener muchos productos inicio con lo necesario para salir adelante. El financiamiento es para la compra de telas, agujas, hilos, tijeras entre otros productos necesarios. Ella sueña con aumentar los ingresos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca is 58 years old and has a sewing business.  She has more than six years experience in this business.  She is a very responsible woman and enjoys her work.  Juana started out doing this work because she needed to cover her household expenses.  She needs to do this work.  In spite of the fact that she didn't have many products, she started out with the basic essentials she needed in order to get ahead.

Juana will use this loan to buy fabric, needles, threads, scissors and other products she needs.  She dreams of increasing her household income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, threads, scissors and other products she needs

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Angelica; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos y aceite, ella atiende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Angelica is a member of the “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Angelica is 36 years old, lives with her partner, and has four children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business.  Angelica sells essentials such as rice, sugar, noodles and oil.  She serves in her store from 6.00am to 9.00pm and, through her business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Angelica would like to expand her grocery store business.  She is requesting her loan to buy essentials.

Angelica is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.
