loans.use: to buy essentials

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is a working lady, selling clothes to her community clients. She purchases clothes from the wholesale market of her own city, Faisalabad, to fulfill the orders in a timely manner. She gets regular orders every month from her clients because she provides them with good quality clothes at reasonable prices. 

Her husband’s name is L. M. and he is a retired government employee. He gets a pension every month.  Shameem is the mother of one son who works in a private company for a low income.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy clothes in bulk. The bulk purchasing will help her offer more variety to her clients and increase her profits. She has been operating this business for past 2 years and is hopeful that her business will improve after making a loan investment into it. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

She is a resident of Daood Nagar which is a small residential area located in Faisalabad. Faisalabad is Pakistan’s third largest city and well known for its textile industry. Her home is a small one containing two rooms where she moved six years ago with her family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shameem.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Main Dans La Main Plus Group

texts.en:
“Main dans la main Plus” is a group of owners of small businesses chaired by Marie. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.
Blandine N. is determined to be a successful businesswoman. She started her general store business in 2008. Today, she sells chemical products in a market to the east of Kinshasa. With good management skills and thanks to accumulated profits, she has succeeded in making her business thrive. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business, which earns her $150 per month. She works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts to achieve her goals. Blandine is a trustworthy client of Kiva partner, HOPE RDC, having obtained and correctly repaid eleven loans. She will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by buying chemical products in bulk and reselling them at a profit. Forty-year-old Blandine is married and is the mother of five children, whose ages range between 6 and 13 years old. Four of them go to school. Her ambition is to open a chemical product storage facility in her environment.

loans.use: to purchase chemical products in bulk

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Marcelina, es casada y tiene 44 años de edad,  tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 1 de ellos es independiente, mientras que los otros tiene (20, 18, 17) años de edad, La socia tiene como principal actividad la agricultura y la ganadería actualmente ella compra y vende vacas y toros, la socia tiene vacas lecheras, toros, vaquillas, ella vende la leche de sus vacas en las ferias y a pedido, también elabora queso, la socia en esta oportunidad desea el crédito para poder invertir en el alimento de sus ganados, ella dice que debe comprar alimento balanceado, sutuchi de la cervecería y sales minerales. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado y vitaminas para sus ganados.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE” community bank which is located in the town of Zurite, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Marcelina is 44 years old, married, and has four children.  One of her children lives independently while the others are 20, 18 and 17 years old.  Marcelina's main business activity is farming and livestock raising.  She currently buys and sells cows and bulls.  She owns dairy cows, bulls and heifers.  She sells the milk from her cows in street markets and also to order.  In addition, she makes cheese.  On this occasion, she would like a loan to invest in feed for her animals.  She says that she needs to buy balanced feed, sutuchi from the brewery ('sutuchi' is the final residue from making corn-based drinks which is used as animal feed) and mineral salts.

Marcelina is requesting this loan to invest in buying balanced feed and vitamins for her animals.  She appreciates the loan she has been granted and is grateful for it.  She pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and vitamins for her cattle

loans.name: Rosa Angélica

texts.es:
Desde hace varios años Rosa Angélica tiene una tienda donde ofrece una gran variedad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, su tienda se encuentra en la Vereda Cascajo Arriba y los fines de semana se desplaza al atrio de la Iglesia de la Vereda con el fin de incrementar sus ventas. 

Esta emprendedora quiere comprar más surtido para su tienda con el fin de ofrecer más variedad de productos y de esta manera incrementar sus ventas y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Aunque Rosa es de origen campesino es una luchadora incansable que sueña con un negocio cada vez más grande.
texts.en:
Over the last few years Rosa Angélica has had a shop where she sells a great variety of products to fulfil the needs of her customers. Her shop is located at Vereda Cascajo Arriba and at the week-end she also sells near the church of La Vereda. 

Rosa would like to buy a wider range or products for her shop to be able to offer a greater variety of products, so as to increase sales and hence improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase rice, eggs, oils, and butter

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 32 años, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, es una mujer muy rabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Julián de 35 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor bienestar. El cultivo de cacao, café y hojas de coca es la actividad que realiza diariamente Ana, junto con la ayuda de su pareja, quien le ha enseñado todo sobre esta actividad. Ambos han logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas; lo cual ha generado que sus cultivos sean de muy buena calidad y muy cotizados en los mercados de la ciudad de San Francisco, lugar donde recibe mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, desde la chacra hasta los secaderos; el secado de los productos es la última etapa que realiza Ana antes de llevar ha comercializarlos. Ana solicita el crédito para renovar la madera vieja de su vivienda por madera nueva. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras y poder sembrar más productos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, manifiesta que el crédito le ayudará mucho con el progreso de su trabajo. Se siente muy contenta con la creación del banco comunal en su pueblo, por lo cual participará en los futuros créditos que la institución le facilitará. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará madera aserrada para cercar las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana is 32 years old and originally from the city of Santa Rosa. She is a very hard-working woman. She lives in her own house alongside her partner Julian, aged 35, and their 3 dear children, to whom she wants to provide a greater quality of life. Every day she works in the cultivation of cocoa, coffee and coca leaves  with the help of her partner, who has taught her everything about this activity. Jointly they have managed to achieve very productive lands, which means that their crops are high quality and sought-after in the markets of the city of San Francisco, where she gets the best prices for her products.  

What she likes the most about her job is looking after her crops and she does so with great care. She has been doing it for 10 years and she thinks that the most difficult thing is to transport her products from the farm to the dryers; drying the products is the last stage Ana takes prior to selling them. 

Ana is requesting the loan to replace the old wood surrounding her home for new wood. In future she would like to buy more land and plant more produce. This is her first loan with MFP and she says that the loan will help greatly with her work. She is very happy with the creation of community bank in her village, and she plans to participate in future loans granted by the institution. With the 1,000 soles requested she will buy wood panels to enclose the walls of her house.

loans.use: to buy wood to enclose the walls of her home.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Josefina, es conviviente y tiene 30 años de edad,  tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 1 años y 8 meses; La socia se dedica al negocio minorista de compra y venta de animales menores, la socia compra cuyes, pollos y todo tipo de aves de corral, la socia se encarga de comprar los animales cuando son bebes los cría y alimenta con comida balanceada, una ves que estos alcanzan su madures, ella los vende al por mayor, estos se reproducen y así se genera la ganancia, la socia desea comprar 20 pollos y otro tanto de cuyes para la crianza, alimentación, reproducción y venta final al por mayor de los más adultos, ella los vende en la feria del pueblo y también distribuye en los diferentes negocios, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Josefina is a member of the "SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE” community bank which is located in the town of Zurite, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Josefina is 30 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children aged 8 and 1 year and 8 months.  Josefina buys and sells animals.  She buys guinea pigs, chickens and other kinds of poultry.  She buys the animals when they are babies, raises them, feeds them with balanced animal feed and then, once they have grown, she sells them wholesale.  The animals reproduce and thereby make her a profit.  Josefina would like to buy 20 chickens and 20 guinea pigs to raise, feed, breed and finally sell the oldest animals wholesale.  She sells her animals in the town market and also distributes them to different businesses.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying young animals.

Josefina appreciates the loan that she has been granted and is grateful for it.  She pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying animals

loans.name: Erick

texts.es: Erick tiene 23 años, es un joven muy trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su querido hijo Dayron de 05 años; quien desea brindar una buena educación. Erick a su corta edad es un joven centrado en sus responsabilices y obligaciones, la vida le enseñó tropiezos pero no se amilana. hoy trata de sobresalir con la venta de cacao, café y frutas cítricas, los cuales después de cosecharlos los comercializa en la ciudad de San Francisco, en donde ya tiene diversos compradores, que sabiendo de la calidad de su producto no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todos sus cultivos al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva 06 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus chacras de la plaga, ya que tiene que hacerlo con mucho cuidado por que los productos químicos causan reacciones y teme por su salud posteriormente. El crédito solicitado es para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos. En adelante, espera seguir ahorrando sus ingresos por que desea comprar nuevas tierras. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. Se siente contento por pertenecer al grupo de socios de su banco comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, contratará jornaleros para que lo apoyen en el mantenimiento respectivo de sus cultivos como: la poda, el desmonte y la fumigación.
texts.en:
Erick is 23 years old.  He is a very hard-working young man who lives in his own home together with his beloved son Dayron who is 5 years old.  He would like to provide his son with a good education.

Even at his young age, Erick is a young man who is centered on his responsibilities and obligations.  Life has dealt him some setbacks but he remains undaunted.  Today he works to get ahead selling cacao, coffee and citrus fruits which, after he has harvested them, he sells in the city of San Francisco where he has a number of buyers who know that his products are good quality and so don't hesitate to buy his entire crop wholesale.

What Erick most enjoys about his work is sowing his land and making it fertile and productive.  He has been in this business for six years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be spraying his farm.  He has to do it very carefully because the chemical products cause reactions and he fears for his health afterwards.

Erick has requested this loan so that he can maintain his crops.  In the future, he hopes to continue saving his profits so that he can buy more land.

This is Erick's first loan from MFP.  He knows that the loan will be very helpful to him in making progress in his work.  He feels happy to belong to his community bank.  He will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to hire day laborers to support him in looking after his crops: pruning, weeding and spraying.

loans.use: to hire day laborers

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: Maria del Socorro A. T. es una mujer de 50 años, que vive en el sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde posee un hogar conformado por su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 16 a 22 años. Este es el ambiente donde Maria A. se desempeña en la  venta de productos de misceláneas al detalle; actualmente aprovechando que esta es una gran época para vender   detalles dirigidos a la mujer, a propósito del día de las madres que se avecina, ella ha solicitado su credikiva, con el cual comprará muñecos en peluche, ropa, electrodomésticos menores, que exhibirá en su miscelánea decorada,   con estos detalles bien empacados, con el propósito de despertar  la atención el interés, deseo  y la acción de compra de sus clientes, e incrementar sus ventas. Maria inició su negocio hace menos de un año con útiles escolares aplicando a esta compra el capital suministrado por su hijo, quien tuvo como objetivo el  incremento de  los ingresos del hogar;  inicialmente funcionó en un local arrendado y Maria lo ha hecho crecer con su gran vocación de servicio,  que traslada a sus clientes a quienes con ello gana día a día. Su sueño más adelante es ampliar su negocio y ubicar nuevos puntos de ventas, por lo cual debe esperar porque aún no cuenta con el suficiente capital de trabajo, ni la infraestructura para hacerlo, pero si con todo el empeño,  para que a mediano plazo su sueño se convierta en una realidad.
texts.en:
Maria del Socorro A. T. is 50 years old and lives in the south of the city of Barranquilla together with her husband and her three children who are aged between 16 and 22.  Here Maria A. sells a variety of products retail.  She is currently taking advantage of the fact that this is a great time of year for selling gifts for women as Mothers' Day is approaching.  She has requested a Kiva loan to buy stuffed dolls, clothes and small electrical appliances which she will display in her store.  With these nicely packaged gifts, she intends to attract her customers' attention and awaken their interest in buying and their desire to buy.  This will mean they will buy her products and she will increase her sales.

Maria started her business less than one year ago, selling school supplies.  She made this purchase with capital provided by her son whose goal was to increase their household income.  Initially, Maria worked in rented premises.  She has grown her business through the great service which she provides to her customers which means she earns every day.  Maria's dream for the future is to expand her business and set up new sales locations.  She will have to wait to do this as she has neither enough working capital nor the infrastructure to do it right now.  However, she will strive to make her dream become a reality in the not-so-distant future.

loans.use: to buy stuffed dolls, clothes and small electrical appliances to display in her store

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel forma parte del banco comunal “Los jardines del bosque” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco. 
Ella se dedica al rubro de la artesanía en cueros y tejidos desde hace 10 años. Arte que realiza para las aplicaciones de ropas, accesorios y artículos para casa. Sus modelos son exclusivos, ya que además ella diseña. Su taller lo tiene ubicado en su misma casa. Todos sus trabajos son a pedido. Isabel cuenta con una página Web para promocionar y publicitar su artesanía. El perfil de su clientela principalmente son profesionales que no cuentan con mucha disponibilidad para ir a tiendas y comprar.  Por lo tanto éste sistema para publicitar sus productos está destinado para ellos, además utiliza un notebook por el cual muestra su mercadería y envía catálogos en línea.  Isabel trabaja sola en éste negocio.
Su mercadería la compra en una tienda de cueros y los demás insumos en una distribuidora.
Con éste préstamo comprará materiales para confecciones sus productos de artesanía, además enviará a reparar sus dos máquinas de coser. 
Sus metas son comprarse máquinas de coser industriales y un I Pad, para ofrecer mejor sus productos. 
Isabel vive junto a su esposo quien le ayuda con el traslado de maquinarias dentro del taller. Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio son por gusto y terapia, ya que Isabel sufrió una depresión años atrás, actualmente sigue controlándose, pero su estado anímico es favorable. 
Isabel está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo Esperanza, ya que podrá invertir en su negocio. Las reuniones a las que asiste son muy gratas, además está participando de unos talleres de venta, por los cuales se siente muy contenta.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the “Los jardines del bosque” community bank which is located in the city of Temuco.  She makes leather and woven handicrafts and has been in this business for 10 years.  She makes clothes, accessories and soft furnishings.  Her models are exclusives as she also designs them.

Isabel's workshop is located in her home and all her products are made to order.  She has a web page where she promotes and publicizes her handicrafts.  Her customers are mainly professionals who don't have a lot of time available to go to the stores and buy products.  For this reason, her system for promoting her products is aimed at them.  Isabel uses a Notebook to exhibit her merchandise and send catalogs on line.  She works alone in her business.

Isabel buys some of her merchandise in a leather store and other supplies from a wholesaler.  She will use this loan to buy materials for making her handicrafts.  She will also send her two sewing machines to be repaired.  Her goal is to buy industrial sewing machines and an iPad so that she can better sell her products.

Isabel lives together with her husband who helps her to move the machinery in her workshop.  Her motivation for continuing in her business is that she enjoys it and finds it therapeutic since she used to suffer from depression some years ago.  She is continuing to look after herself but her mood is favorable.

Isabel is very happy and grateful for the loan that she has obtained from Fondo Esperanza since it means she will be able to invest in her business.  The meetings that she attends are very pleasant and she is also participating in some sales workshops which is making her very happy.

Temuco is the capital of Araucania region.  The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  In the outlying areas there are a series of lakeside spas (Pucón, Villarica) and very colorful native flora and fauna in nearby nature reserves.  This region is home to 50% of the Mapuches (the indigenous people of our country).

loans.use: to buy materials to make her handicrafts and to send her two sewing machines to be repaired

loans.name: Progression Plus Group

texts.en:
“Progression Plus” is a community bank made up of 14 micro-entrepreneurs whose chairwoman is Micheline M.. These members are united for the same goal – to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through HOPE DRC.
Micheline sells drinks in her local area located in the south-western area of Kinshasa. She began her business in 1998. After hard work and good management, she succeeded in making it thrive thanks to the accumulated profits. She is a loyal client of MFI HOPE DRC and has already received five different loans, all of which she has repaid properly. She intends to reinforce her capital with her next loan by purchasing more crates of drinks. Her business gives her a profit of USD $60 every week. Micheline is 43 years old, married and the mother of five children whose ages range between 3 and 20. Four of them attend school. Her ambition is to open a crate drinks facility.

loans.use: to purchase crates of drinks

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria tiene 49 años, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Inicio este negocio ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar desde muy joven, la mayoría de sus clientes son jóvenes que le solicitan una gran variedad de productos. Ella se levanta temprano desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, pues también sale de manera ambulante  para ofrecerlos. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de lápiz labial, cremas, perfumes, lociones, calzado, ropa en general. Ella sueña con aumentar su inventario y además agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is 49 years old and has one child in her care.  Her business is selling general merchandise.  She started her business because she has always enjoyed working since she was very young.  Most of her customers are young peolple who request a large variety of products from her.  Ana Maria gets up early and works from 7.00am to 9.00pm.  She goes out and sells her products as an itinerant street vendor.

Ana Maria will use her loan to buy lipsticks, creams, perfume, lotions, footwear and clothes.  She dreams of increasing her stock and enlarging her business.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, creams, perfume, lotions, footwear and clothes

loans.name: Duo Camino De Dios Group

texts.es:
Duo Camino de Dios: este grupo esta formado por olivia C. B.,de 29 años ella tiene 3 hijos casada,se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica y venta de cosmeticos en su comunidad desde hace 7 años,ella nos cuenta que la venta de ropa tipica le a ayudado a aumentar su ganacia porque se vende muy rapido,ella solicita este credito para la compra de ropa tipica por mayor.
Doña Maria josefina S. C.: de 33 años de edad tiene 4 hijos y se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas,en su casa desde hace 10 años,ella solicita el credito para la compra de verduras y frutas ya que nececita agrandar mas su negocio y asi generar mas ganacias.
texts.en:
The "Duo Camino de Dios" group is made up of:

Olivia C. B., age 29, who is married and has three children.  She has been selling typical clothing and cosmetics for seven years.  Selling clothing helps increase her earnings because it sells very quickly.  She is requesting a loan to buy wholesale typical clothing, 

and

Doña Maria Josefina S. C., age 33, has four children and has been selling vegetables and fruit out of her home for 10 years.  She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables and fruit since she needs to expand her business and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy wholesale typical clothing and to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Marlim

texts.es: Marlim de 35 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Jorge de 32 años y su querida hija Jenifer de 10 años, a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Marlim y su pareja son el sustento de su familia, desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, posee su propia parcela donde viene cultivando plantas de café, cacao y achiote. Viene trabajando 17 años en sus propias tierras, y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es recolectar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicado en la ciudad de san francisco, lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos, sin embargo no cuenta con suficiente ingreso económico para solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo en el deshierbo de maleza que afectan sus plantaciones; es por ello que acude a los préstamos que facilita la institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantas de café por que es una de las plantas que mayor demanda que tiene en el mercado. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, esta dispuesta en pagar todas sus cuotas, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito. Esta agradecida a los socios por considerarle como socia en su banco comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en  el desmonte de maleza.
texts.en:
35-year old Marlim is a simple, hardworking woman who lives in her own house with her 32-year old husband Jorge and their beloved daughter 10-year old Jenifer whose quality of life she wishes to improve. Marlim and her husband support the family. When she was a young girl, her parents taught her about farming, and now she has her own land where she has spent seventeen years growing coffee, cocoa, and achiote. 

Marlim most enjoys harvesting her crops--her months of hard work have finally paid off. The most difficult part is transporting the products from the fields to the warehouses located in the town of San Francisco where she can get the best prices. As she can’t afford to pay in advance for workers to help get rid of the weeds in the fields, she is seeking a loan from Kiva partner MFP to do this. However, her first priority is planting more coffee, one of the crops most in demand. 

This is Marlim’s first loan with MFP. She is keen to pay back the money as she wishes to have access to other loans in the future. She is grateful to the other members of her community bank for accepting her as a member. With the 1,000 sole loan she will hire workers to weed her fields.

loans.use: to hire workers to help weed her fields

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Paulina, es casada y tiene 48 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 5 de ellos son completamente independientes y solo tiene a 1 de 17 años en su casa apoyándolo en sus estudios y otras necesidades; la socia tiene como principal actividad la agricultura, ella tiene terrenos en los cuales producen papas, maíz, cebollas, habas. La socia también en otra época del año se dedica a la venta de maíz grano secos, la socia compra maíz al por mayor y los vende en granos secos al por menor. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de granos secos de maíz para realizar harina de maíz, cremas de maíz, y otros platos típicos en la región. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de granos secos de maíz.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sra. Paulina is a member of the San Martin de Zurite Community Bank which is located in Zurite, in the province of Anta, in Cusco Department. She is 48-years old, married, and has six children; five of them are independent, so she only has her 17-year old son to support while he finishes school.

Paulina’s main work is farming. She grows potatoes, corn, onions, and beans. At certain times of the year she sells dried corn--she buys the corn wholesale and then sells it at retail prices. She is seeking a loan to to buy more dried corn to make maize flour and soups as well as other local dishes. 

Paulina is grateful for this valuable loan and promises to make the repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy dried corn

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia lives in Faisalabad which is Pakistan’s third largest city and known for its textile industry. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area of Maryam Abad. She moved here many years ago. She is 46 years old and married to A. M. who operates a loading/unloading business with his donkey cart. 

Safia herself is a housewife, staying at home and doing her household chores. She has two children: a son and a daughter. Both of them were not able to get an education due to financial constraints.  

Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to assist her husband financially. Using the loan, he will buy a new donkey cart because his current cart is not in a position to let him load heavy items on it. With the new cart, he will be able to transport heavy loads which will help him do his job better and earn increased profits. 

Safia hopes that the loan investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has proved herself a responsible client by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Safia.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading/unloading business.

loans.name: Miryan

texts.es: Miryan de 23 años de edad, es una mujer soltera activa y trabajadora, vive en su propia vivienda y da de si misma por sobresalir en la vida. La actividad a la que se dedica Miryan, es el cultivo de las plantas de café y cacao; tierras que heredó de sus padres, ella labra sus tierras con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo en su ardua labor de desmonte de malezas, cosechas y traslado de los productos cosechados hasta las carreteras para luego expenderlos en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene en el desempeño de su labor, ya que ella decide que es lo mejor para sus cultivos, lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es combatir con las plagas que se apoderan de los brotes de sus cultivos. Ana con el crédito solicitado comprará semillas de cacao y café, pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en sus pagos, si desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. Se siente muy contenta por ser socia de su banco comunal y aportará de si misma por el desarrollo de su grupo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará semillas de cacao y café.
texts.en:
23-year old Miryan is single, energetic, and hardworking. She lives in her own house and makes an effort to get ahead in life. She earns her living growing coffee and cocoa on land that she inherited from her parents. 

Miryan works in her fields with labourers who help with the weeding, harvesting, and transportation of the produce to the highway from where it is taken to market. She likes the freedom of this job as it is she who decides what is best for her crops. It’s a job she’s been doing for five years. The most difficult part is dealing with the insects which infect the new shoots.

With the loan money Miryan plans to buy cocoa and coffee seeds, but her first priority is to buy more land so she can grow more crops. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she knows that she must be punctual with the repayments if she wishes to get another loan in the future. She is very happy to be a member of her community bank and will contribute to its development. With the 1,000 soles Miryan will buy cocoa and coffee seeds.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and coffee seeds

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.

El Sr. Anastacio, es casado y tiene 62 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos los cuales son todos independientes; El socio tiene como principal actividad la agricultura, ganadería y toda actividad agropecuaria, el socio compra y vende leche, también verduras, maíz, papa; el socio se encarga de manera estricta en dar la mejor alimentación a sus vacas, el socio compra pasto al por mayor, concentrados, minerales, vitaminas entre otros para dar una adecuada alimentación. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra alimentos concentrados y vitaminas a sus animales.

El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Anastacio belongs to the “San Martin de Zurite” communal bank, located in the Zurite settlement, in Anta province, Cusco department.

Anastacio is married, 62 years old, and has 4 children, all independent now. His principal activity is agriculture, livestock raising, and all sorts of agricultural activity. He buys and sells milk and, also, vegetables especially corn and potatoes. He is strict about providing only the best feed for his cows. At wholesale, Anastacio buys forage, concentrated feed, minerals, and vitamins, among other things, in order to provide an adequate diet. 

Anastacio requests a loan to purchase concentrated feed and vitamins for his animals. He values and appreciates the offer of a loan and is committed to complying with payment of the debt in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: TO BUY CONCENTRATED FEED AND VITAMINS FOR HIS LIVESTOCK

loans.name: Sedjlo Group

texts.fr:
SEDJLO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vendent ensemble dans la même localité. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité et de faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe s'est rapproché de ALIDé, en vue de l'obtention d'un crédit.
La présidente du groupe, Eugenie Akouavi (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née le 12 Juin 1974 dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Eugenie Akouavi est mariée à Epiphane et est mère d'un enfant qui  n'est pas encore scolarisé. Eugenie Akouavi s'est installée depuis sept ans à Sèkandji dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, où elle vit avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Eugenie Akouavi n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Eugenie Akouavi a une buvette où elle vend diverses boissons depuis environs trois ans. C'est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin que Eugenie Akouavi s'approvisionne. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de plus en plus forte de la clientèle, Eugenie Akouavi sollicite pour une première fois de prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
SEDJLO is a group of three people who run their respective businesses in the same locality. In order to bolster their activities and meet customer demand, they decided to seek credit from ALIDé. 

The group's president is Eugenie Akouavi (seen in the photo with her hand raised). She was born June 12, 1974 in the town of Abomey Calavi. She is married to Epiphane and has a child who does not yet attend school. She has been living in Sèkandji, in the town of SèmeèPodji, for the past seven years with her husband and child. The couple share the various household responsibilities. 

Eugenie Akouavi did not attend school. She runs a bar where she has been selling drinks for three years or so. She gets her stock in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. In order to build up her business and better satisfy a steadily increasing clientele, Eugenie Akouavi is seeking her first loan from ALIDÉ.

loans.use: to buy cases of beverages

loans.name: Famer De Jesús

texts.es:
Durante 14 años Famer V. ha vendido frutas en un semáforo ubicado en una de las autopistas de la ciudad de Medellín; allí tiene clientes fijos quienes se han encargado de posicionar sus ventas y generarle buenos ingresos. Este microempresario luchador ha trabajado toda su vida para sacar a adelante a sus 6 hijos. Inicialmente trabajaba en  la ciudad de Barranquilla en una empresa a la que renunció cuando decidió montar un bar en Jericó, Departamento de Antioquia; sin embargo el negocio quebró y Famer debió buscar otra forma de conseguir ingresos para sostener a su familia.
 
Actualmente Famer trabaja todos lo días de 6:00a.m. a 7:00 p.m. y aunque frecuentemente debe enfrentarse a las dificultades del invierno, se siente orgulloso por haber sacado a adelante su negocio el cual surte constantemente. Es por esto que Famer está buscando el capital con el que comprará la mercancía necesaria para ofrecer más y mejores frutas y así permitir que sus ventas aumenten. Espera en el futuro tener un kiosco fijo para establecer su negocio y así protegerlo de las lluvias.
texts.en:
Famer V. has been selling fruit for fourteen years at a stoplight on one of the highways in the city of Medellín.  He has fixed customers there who have placed orders, and this generates good earnings for him.

This tenacious small businessman has worked all of his life to get his six children ahead.  He started working for a company in Barranquilla.  He resigned when he decided to set up a bar in Jericó in the Antioquia department.  Nevertheless, the business failed, and Famer had to look for another way to get income to support his family.

Famer now works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  Even though he frequently needs to confront the difficulties of the winter, he is proud.  This is because he has gotten his business, which he constantly stocks, ahead.  

That is why Famer is looking for capital to buy the merchandise needed to sell more and better fruits.  This will allow his sales to increase.  In the future he hopes to have a fixed kiosk in order to establish his business and protect it from the rains.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy babies' clothes such as diapers, etc. in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s laundry business. He will utilize the loan money to buy an iron and clothes-washing material such as Surf, bleach powder, washing soaps, etc., for the improvement of his laundry business. 

Yasmeen comes from Faisalabad which is an industrial city of Pakistan and famous for its textile industry. She lives there in a 2-room brick house in the area of Mariam Abad where she moved 10 years ago with her family. She has two sons. Both of them are illiterate and couldn’t get education due to financial constraints. 

Yasmeen is a very good mother and housewife. She takes care of her family very well by fulfilling their needs on time.  Her husband has three years of experience in his business and Yasmeen is hopeful that an investment will prove beneficial for the future growth of his business. 

She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah.  

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Yasmeen”.

loans.use: To buy an iron and clothes-washing material for laundry business.

loans.name: Nadya

texts.es: Nadya tiene 22 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia vivienda junto a su pareja Richard  de 24 años y su querida hija Cledy de 07 años de edad, a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo Nadya y su pareja Richard han logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy fructíferas, ella cultiva, cacao, café y hojas de coca, una vez cosechados las lleva a vender hasta los centros de acopio situados en las ciudades de Santa Rosa y San Francisco donde los vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, donde lleva 06 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y por lo cual contrata animales de carga como el burro para que se encarguen con el carguio respectivo de los frutos hasta los tendales. Con el crédito solicitado comprará par de carretillas para facilitarse con el traslado de sus productos. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para así ampliar su producción. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, el préstamo solicitado le será de mucha utilidad y esta contenta con la creación de un banco comunal en su pueblo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará par de carretillas para facilitarse con el traslado respectivo de sus productos.
texts.en: Nadya is 22 years old and she is a very happy and hardworking woman. She lives in a house that she owns, together with her partner, Richard, who is 24 years old, and her beloved 7-year old daughter, Cledy. She wants to give them both a better quality of life. With a great deal of effort Nadya and her partner, Richard, have worked their land and they have made them very productive. She cultivates cocoa, coffee, and coca leaves. Once the harvest is done she takes the products to the collection centers in the cities of Santa Rosa and San Francisco for wholesale.  Her cultivations have provided her with enough funds to support themselves, which is why she wants to put her best into this business. The thing she most enjoys about her work is caring for her cultivations. She has 6 years in the business. The most difficult part of her work is having to transport her products, especially because the sacks are very heavy and she needs to hire help. She uses donkeys to carry the loads of products to the centers. With the funds that she requests she will purchase wheelbarrows to help transport her products. In the future she wants to buy ore land to increase production. This is her first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). The loan that she requests will be of great help and she is happy with the introduction of the communal bank in her village. With the 1000 nuevos soles she will purchase wheelbarrows to help transport her products.

loans.use: to purchase wheelbarrows to transport her products

loans.name: William Jair

texts.es: William Jair V. de 23 años y padre de un niño de 3,  es un negociante dedicado a la venta de alimentos como pasabocas, arepas, pasteles, hayacas y bebidas como gaseosas y cervezas, en un puesto de ventas nuy elegante que tiene en Barranquillita: un sector de mucho movimiento donde abundan los negocios formales e informales y diversos mercados públicos, especializados para  carnes,   pescados,  flores y centros comerciales de ropa calzado y accesorios en general. Este es el ambiente donde está ubicado el negocio de William desde hace dos años,  el cual surgió por la necesidad de generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hijo  cuando nació y William debió   trabajar desde las 4: 00 am a 6:00 p.m. como hasta ahora lo hace. Su meta es capacitarse con la Fundación para lograr hacer un buen manejo administrativo de su negocio, así mismo lograr reunir un mayor capital de trabajo para ampliarlo y hacerlo crecer aplicándole todos sus esfuerzos. A William últimamente, su negocio le ha quedado pequeño, por eso requiere comprar una vitrina calentadora de mayor tamaño que la actual y también  materias primas e insumos para la preparación de sus frituras,  porque cada día ingresan más clientes y sus productos se terminan rápidamente; esto es justamente en lo que invertirá con su  credikiva,  que es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.
texts.en:
William Jair V. is 23 years old and has a 3 year-old son.  His business is selling food such as snacks, corn cakes, pies, 'hallacas' (meat and vegetables in cornmeal dough, wrapped in plantain leaves), and drinks such as soda and beer, from a very smart sales location in Barranquillita.  This is a very busy sector where there are a lot of formal and informal businesses and a number of public markets specialized in selling meat, fish and flowers, and shopping centers which sell clothes, footwear and general accessories.  This is the area where William's business is located.  He has owned his business for two years and it came about because he needed to make income to support his son when he was born.  William had to work from 4.00am to 6.00pm as he still does today.

William's goal is to receive training from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo so that he can manage his business well and also gather together more working capital so that he can expand his business and grow it by putting in all his effort.

William's business has recently grown substantially.  For this reason, he needs to buy a larger heated display case than the one he currently owns and he also needs to buy raw materials and supplies for making his fried food because he has more and more customers every day and his products are selling out quickly.  This is what he will use his Kiva loan to buy.  This is his first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

loans.use: to buy a heated display case and also raw materials and supplies for making his fried food

loans.name: Aereopaquita Nidia

texts.es: Aereopaquita Nidia se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Tiene más de 32 años en este negocio, ella es una persona muy trabajadora a pesar de la edad que tiene. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ofrecerles a sus clientes un buen servicio y al mismo tiempo se preocupa por brindarles a sus clientes lo que ellos le solicitan. Es por eso que actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, camisetas entre una gran variedad de ropa en general. Sueña con mejorar las condiciones de vida  de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Aereopaquita Nidia's business is selling used clothing.  She has been in this business for more than 32 years.  She is a very hard-working person in spite of her age and has always been noted for offering good customer service and taking care to provide her customers with what they request.  She is requesting this loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, t-shirts and a wide variety of clothes in general.  Aereopaquita dreams of improving her own living conditions as well as those of her family.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, t-shirts and other clothes

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia tiene 37 años, es una mujer muy sociable y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Raúl de 38 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Frank de 12 años y Fiorella de 09 años de edad, quienes son  el impulso  de todos sus esfuerzos. Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación han logrado cultivar Virginia  y su pareja Raúl, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de cacao, café achiote y hojas de coca, dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga, en tiempos de cosecha necesita el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes le ayudan en las extracciones y traslado de los productos cosechados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuando los ve grandes y abundantes, lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es llevar lo cosechado hasta los centros de acopio ubicado en la ciudad de San Francisco, que es el lugar donde los vende, ya que los sacos en donde lleva los productos son muy pesados razón por la cual contratará movilidad. Para el futuro desea comprar nuevas tierras. Este es su primer  préstamo  con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar  todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Se siente muy contenta por ser socia de su banco comunal. Con el crédito solicitado adquirirá semillas de cacao y achiote para aumentar sus sembríos con lo cual espera aumentar sus futuras cosechas.
texts.en:
Virginia is 37 years of age and is very sociable and hardworking. She lives in her own home with her partner Raúl, 38, and their two beloved children, Frank who is 12 and Fiorella who is 9, who are the reason for all their efforts. The products that Virginia and her partner Raúl have been able to cultivate, with so much effort and dedication, have helped them greatly in their progress in life. Every morning she begins working the fields, since she knows the quality of the harvest will depend on the care she gives to her cocoa, coffee, annatto and coca leaf plantings. During harvest season she needs the support of day laborers who help her extract and transport the harvested products. What she most enjoys about her work is caring for the crops and she feels quite happy to see them grow large and abundant. She has worked in this line of business for five years and believes the most difficult aspect is carrying the harvested crops to collection centers located in the city of San Francisco [Peru] which is where she sells them. The sacks used to carry the crops are quite heavy and therefore she will be hiring transport. 

In the future she would like to buy new land. This is her first loan with MFP. She knows she must make all her payments punctually and she is willing to do it. She is very happy to be a member of her communal bank. With the requested loan she will purchase cocoa and annatto seeds to increase her plantings by which she hopes to increase her future harvests.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa and annatto seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase skin lotions, perfumes, undergarments, pants, and shirts

loans.name: Aubaine Plus Group

texts.en:
Jean is the president of a Community bank named “Aubaine Plus,” which is composed of 25 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Jean started his business in 2006 with an initial capital of US $80, selling spices. Today, he operates a general store in the northeastern area of Kinshasa.

He is 32 years old, married and has four children between the ages of 10 and 12 years old. The four of them go to school.  

Jean is happy to be part of one of HOPE’s groups. He joined in February 2010, and his business has been reinforced through the three loans he received. He has repaid them all correctly. His dream is to open a soft drink store. He will use the loan to increase the inventory of his business in order to reinforce the working capital

loans.use: to increase the inventory of his business in order to reinforce the working capital

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bags of rice to resell

loans.name: Zosima

texts.es: Zosima, tiene 49 años, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, , es una mujer trabajadora vive en su propia casa al lado de sus 05 queridos hijos en la comunidad de “Unión” anexo del distrito de Santa Rosa. Los arduos trabajos que realiza Zosima junto a sus hijos en su chacra, han hecho que sus cultivos estén muy bien cuidados y que los días de venta sus productos sean rápidamente comprados. Su principal fuente de ingreso, es la venta de productos de cacao, café, plátano y hojas de coca teniendo en total 07 hectáreas de terreno, una vez cosechados sus productos los vende a las empresas acopiadoras situados en la ciudad de San Francisco y Kimbiri. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que siente que su trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 26  años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas. El crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de abonos y fertilizantes para mejorar sus sembrios. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, esta dispuesta en pagar todas sus cuotas, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito. Esta agradecida a los socios por considerarle como socia en su banco comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará abonos y fertilizantes para sus tierras.
texts.en:
Zosima is 49 years old and is a native of the city of Santa Rosa. She is a hardworking woman who lives in her own house along with her five beloved children in the "Unión" community in the Santa Rosa district. 

The hard work put in by Zosima and her children on their small farm, means that her crops are very well maintained and her produce sells very quickly. Her main source of income is the sale of cocoa, coffee, bananas and coca leaves - produce from her seven hectares of land.  Once harvested, she sells her produce to co-operatives located in the cities of San Francisco and Kimbiri. What she likes about her job is harvesting her land, because that's when she feels that her work is paying off. 

She's been doing this work for 26 years and her main difficulty is protecting her crops from potential pests. The requested loan is for the purchase of fertilizers to improve her crops. 

This is her first loan with MFP. She is prepared to make all her repayments, as she wants to have access to other loans in the future. She is grateful to the other members of her community bank for accepting her as a member. With the 1,000 nuevos soles she will buy fertilizers for her land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Jesukpego Lokokoukoumè Group

texts.fr:
JESUKPEGO LOKOKOUKOUME est un groupe constitué de six personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Vidéhou. Les membres du groupe mènent leur activité dans la même zone. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
Née en 1959 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, Vidéhou vit depuis une dizaine d’année à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji.  Vidéhou est mariée à un boucher du nom de Antoine et a sept enfants dont cinq sont à sa charge. Vidéhou assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a environs treize ans que Vidéhou est dans la restauration. En effet, Vidéhou  prépare la pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce aux poissons qu’elle vend à Cotonou. Cette activité lui génère des revenus qui l’aident à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Vidéhou  s’approvisionne également à Cotonou. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Vidéhou et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
Jesukpego Lokokoukoumè is a group of six people. The group’s president (the woman raising her hand in the photo) is named Vidéhou. The members all carry out their businesses in the same area. To meet their goal of increasing working capital, the group is asking for its first loan from Alidé.

Through she was born in Benin’s economic capital, Cotonou, in 1959, Vidéhou has been living in Lokokoukoumè, in the Sèmè-Podji area, for the last decade. Vidéhou is married to a butcher by the name of Antoine, and is a mother of seven, five of which she is still supporting. Vidéhou works together with her husband to meet their household’s various financial needs. She has been in the restaurant business for about 13 years. More specifically, Vidéhou prepares corn mash with fish sauce, which she then sells in Cotonou. Through this business, she makes income to help meet her childrens’ needs. She buys her supplies in Cotonou. This first loan will likely enable Vidéhou and her group to increase their business, as well as their clientele and profits.

loans.use: to purchase corn, fresh fish and sauce condiments

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Milagros; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también trabaja como guía de turismo, ella en su tienda de abarrotes atiende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Milagros is a member of the "SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Milagros is 36 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business.  She also works as a tourist guide.  Milagros serves in her grocery store from 6.00am to 10.00pm and, through her business, she gets her child ahead in life.  Milagros would like to expand her grocery store business.  She is requesting a loan to buy essentials.

Milagros is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy essentials

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina C. de 43 años es la propietaria de una tienda ubicada en el barrio Santo Domingo de Guzman  en la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde vende de contado y a crédito  productos de la canasta familiar al detalle, entre sus principales clientes que son las amas de casa y padres de familias del sector; con sus ventas de ranchos víveres,abarrotes,carnes, lácteos, refrescos, Marina satisface las necesidades de la comunidad, agregándole como valor el servicio especial que presta ella a cada cliente,  de acuerdo a sus características comunicacionales y adaptado a sus posibilidades financieras de compra;  Su negocio permanece surtido, pero como compra a crédito,  muchas veces no se gana los descuentos por hacerlo de contado,  ni las ofertas especiales a buen precio, que ofrecen sus proveedores  por compras en mayores volúmenes; esta es la razón por la cual se acercó Marina a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para  aplicar a su primer financiamiento,  con el cual comprará ranchos, víveres, carnes, enlatados, para ofrecerlos a sus clientes,  en estas épocas de parciales vacaciones, a consecuencia de la semana Mayor, o semana santa,  que se avecina  con todos sus rituales e incremento en las compras que hacen  las familias cuando reciben visitas y comparten sus alimentos mientras oran y disfrutan de los monumentos que exhiben las iglesias en sus ritos.
texts.en:
Marina C. is 43 years old.  She owns a store which is located in Santo Domingo de Guzman neighborhood, in the city of Barranquilla, where she sells basic family shopping basket goods retail, for cash and also on credit.  Her main customers are housewives and parents in the area.  With her sales of food products, groceries, meat, dairy products and soft drinks, Marina fulfils the needs of her community.  She provides a special service to each and every customer in accordance with their communicativeness and their financial ability to shop.

Marina's business is well stocked but because she buys on credit, she often doesn't earn the discounts that she would if she paid cash.  Nor does she get to take advantage of the special, low-price offers that her suppliers provide to those who buy in larger volumes.  For this reason, Marina has approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to apply for her first loan which she will use to buy food products, meat and canned goods to sell to her customers during this vacation period of Semana Santa (Holy Week) which is approaching with all its rituals and the increase in shopping that it entails when families receive visitors and share their food while they pray and enjoy the special altars that churches display during their services.

loans.use: to buy food products, meat and canned goods in bulk to sell to her customers

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 65 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha (bebida a base de maíz) y también se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas, ella vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de chicha y venta de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los animales y para comprar maíz para preparar la chicha.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Victoria is 65 years old, lives with her partner, and has four children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling chicha (a corn-based drink).  She also raises animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor.  Victoria would like to improve both her chicha business and her animal sales business.  She is requesting a loan to buy feed for her animals and corn for making chicha.

Victoria is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals and corn to make 'chicha'

loans.name: David Salomon

texts.es:
David se desempeña en dos trabajos, para lograr cubrir los gastos de su familia,  aun con un bebe de dos años, el cual gasta en leche, de precio en altos costos.
Trabaja como guarda de seguridad, 24 horas, teniendo día por medio libre, lo que trabaja en soldadura ya que es el oficio que aprendió desde joven, y que sigue ejerciendo, aunque no en tiempo completo , ya que había días, que no tenía trabajo, por eso busco un trabajo fijo, y dejo como otras entradas el trabajo de soldadura.
Con este nuevo préstamo será para la compra de soldadura, y realizar los trabajos en pegar verja, puertas, y otros. Todo esto lo ha logrado mediante los financiamientos que Afodenic ha dado durante trece ciclos, lo que ha sido de muchos beneficios para su inversión.
texts.en:
David works two jobs in order to cover his family expenses.  He has a baby who is two years old and drinks a lot of milk which costs a lot of money right now.

David works as a 24-hour security guard.  He has every other day free and uses this time to carry out welding work since this is the trade he learned when he was young and which he has continued to carry out even though it hasn't been on a full-time basis.  There were some days when he didn't have any work and so he looked for a fixed job and kept his welding work for making extra income.

David will use this new loan to buy welding material and carry out work on grilles, doors, etc.  He has achieved everything through Afodenic loans which he has received over thirteen loan cycles.  These loans have been very helpful to him.

loans.use: to buy welding material to carry out his work

loans.name: Mahukpego-Kpakpakanmey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe MAHUKPEGO-KPAKPAKANMEY  est composé de quatre personnes qui vivent tous dans le même quartier à Kpakpakanmey à Cotonou. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. 
La représentante du groupe, du nom de Clarisse est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Clarisse est née en 1980 à Porto-Novo, capitale politique du Bénin. Clarisse est mariée à Etienne et a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à sa charge. Clarisse et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Depuis près de onze ans, Clarisse vit à Kpakpakanmey avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin de se prendre en charge et d'améliorer son niveau de vie, Clarisse exerce depuis cinq ans environs, comme activité la vente de charbon de bois, qu'elle achète à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Clarisse vend des savons. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Clarisse sollicite, ensemble avec son groupe, un autre crédit.
texts.en:
The Mahukpego-Kpakpakanmey group is a group of four people all living in the same neighborhood of Kpakpakanmey in Cotonou. This is the third time that the group has requested financial support from Alidé, in order to increase its business.

The group’s representative, Clarisse, is pictured in the photo raising her hand.  Clarisse was born in Benin’s political capital of Porto-Novo in 1980.  She is married to Etienne and is a mother of three, all of whom are in school, and two of whom she supports financially.  Clarisse and her husband work together to meet their family’s various needs.  She has been living with her husband and children in Kpakpakanmey for nearly 11 years.  For the last five years, Clarisse has been selling wood coal in order to cover her finances and improve her standard of living. She purchases her supplies in Cotonou, Benin’s economic capital. She also sells soaps on the side.  Driven by her goal of meeting her customers’ needs and increasing income, Clarisse and her group are requesting another loan.

loans.use: to purchase bags of wood coal and boxes of soap

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia vende chalinas, guantes y maletines, ella vende en el distrito de Yanahuara en un hotel llamado Casa Andina, ella trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía y comprar materiales para hacer la artesanía.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gregoria belongs to the San Isidro de Yanahuara Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Gregoria, age 45, has a life partner and three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling handmade goods.  She sells scarves, gloves, and backpacks.  She sells in the Yanahuara district in the Casa Andina hotel.  She works from 5:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m.

She wants to expand her business of selling handmade goods.  She is requesting the loan to buy handicrafts and materials to make handicrafts.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts and materials to make handicrafts

loans.name: Duo Mujeres Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Duo Mujeres con esperanza:Lidia Veronica G.: inicio su negocio con ventas de cosmeticos luego se dedico a la venta de productos por catalogo y ahora tambien se dedica a la venta de oro puro,a lado de sus hijos es una persona que que ha salido adelante para sequir luchando por su familia su deseo mas grande es ver a sus hijos profecionales ella nos cuenta que solicita este credito para la compra de cosmeticos ya que por la epoca es cuando mas tiene demanda de sus cliente.
Doña Ricarda lucia:de 42 años tiene 2 hijos, ella tiene una tienda de productos comestibles de primera nececidad ella dese seguir invirtiendo en su tienda y asi tener una mas grande ya que a tenido un aumento en su ganacia,ella solicita este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de primera nececidad y asi generar mas ganacias para poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
"Duo Mujeres con Esperanza" Group:

Lidia Veronica G. began her cosmetic sales business and then began selling products by catalogue.  She also sells pure gold.  Along with her children, she has been able to get ahead by struggling daily in the hope that they will have professional careers.  She plans to use the loan to buy cosmetics because now is the time of year when there is most customer demand.

Doña Ricarda Lucia, age 42, has two children.  She has a grocery store and sells basic needs items.  She wants to continue investing in her store so she can expand and increase her income.  She plans to use the loan to buy basic needs items and generate more earnings to support her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and basic needs groceries

loans.name: Xequemeya 1 Group

texts.es:
Doña Feliza G. M., tiene 42 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 6 hijos los cuales no estan estudiando, se dedica a oficios domésticos y al comercio, lleva 5 años D. experiencia en la comercialzación D. ropa nueva, inició con un puesto en la calle y actualmente tiene su negocio D. reventa D. ropa en la calle, y mas adelante quiere tener con un local propio.

DeciD. orgnizar un grupo para solictar un préstamos que le servirá D. capital D. trabajo para compra D. ropa para su reventa tales como: Calcetines, bufandas, sueteres, sudadero, ropa interior, y entre otros. Las otras integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza D. animales y la coordinadora al comercio. Esperan con el préstamos mejoren su negocio y sus ganacias.
texts.en:
Feliza G. M. is 42 years old.  She didn't have the opportunity to go to school.  She has six children who do not attend school.  Feliza is a cleaner and also a saleswoman.  She has five years experience selling new clothes.  She started out with a street stall and currently has a business selling clothes on the street.  In the future, she would like to own her own premises.

Feliza decided to get together a group in order to request loans which would serve as working capital to buy clothes to resell such as socks, scarves, sweaters, sweatshirts, underwear, etc.  The other members of the group raise animals and the group's coordinator is a saleswoman.  They hope that their loans will enable them to improve their businesses and their profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is married to M. M. and resides in Pakpattan, Pakistan which is famous for its agriculture industry. Her house is located in Bari Rakho which is a residential area of the city. She moved here 9 years ago. 

Her husband has an animal-sales business. His business grows busier during the Muslim festival of Eid-ul-Azha because people purchase animals to slaughter. At other times he sells animals to butchers. 

Shamim is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful in her work and receives good number of orders every month. She also gives religious education to the children of her community. She has given birth to a son who is only one year old. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He wants to buy some goats and sheep to improve his business further. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Shamim hopes that an investment will be a productive one for him and earn him better profits.

loans.use: To buy goats & sheep for resale.

loans.name: Santos Del Pilar

texts.es: Santos del Pilar es una mujer emprendedora, que disfruta de su medio de vida que es la venta de mercadería en general. A pesar que no ha sido fácil mantener su negocio, los deseos de salir y la experiencia en su trabajo ha realizado es lo que motiva a Santos continuar adelante. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de  prendas, calzado, perfumes, camisas, trajes de baño para la temporada de verano. Las metas que tiene son de seguir mejorar cada día más su actividad y al mismo tiempo incrementar su inventario.
texts.en: Santos del Pilar is an enterprising woman who enjoys her work selling general merchandise.  Although it has not been easy to maintain her business, her desire to get ahead and her work experience have motivated her to continue forward.  This loan is for the purchase of clothing, shoes, perfumes, shirts, and bathing suits for summer.  Her goals are to continue improving her business each day while increasing her inventory.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, shirts, and bathing suits for summer.

loans.name: Mauricio Josue

texts.es: Mauricio José tiene 37 años, desde hace más de 7 años. Mauricio tiene una pulpería donde ofrece arroz, frijoles, azúcar, golosinas, pan, jugos, refrescos naturales, detergentes jabón entre otros productos, son productos para el consumo del hogar. Además de esto su esposa y sus 3 hijos están a su cargo, pues él tiene  la obligación de proporcionar el alimento diario para su hogar. El crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos y jugos. Su deseo es obtener la estabilidad económica necesaria para su familia.
texts.en: Mauricio Josue is 37 years old and he has had a small store for the past seven years where he sells rice, beans, sugar, sweets, bread, juice, natural juice, detergent, soap, and other items for household consumption.  In addition, he is responsible for his wife and three children.  The loan is for the purchase of basic grains, sweets, refreshments and juices.  He wants to achieve the necessary financial stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, refreshments and juices.

loans.name: Duo Los Hermanos Group

texts.es:
DUO LOS HERMANOS
El grupo está integrado por  dos personas él es  Benjamín Basilio C.  quien tiene  23 años  es soltero   inicio con su negocio de especies  (Pepitoria, ajonjolí etc.)  Desde  hace 11 años a la venta ayudando a su papa, su padre falleció y él se hizo cargo del negocio y hermanos menores de edad, el ayuda  al sustento diario de cada uno de ellos enviándoles  dinero cada mes su  meta es poder traer a su familia donde él vive actualmente como también poder crecer más en sus ventas de especias en el Mercado Municipal.solicita el credito para la compra de especies. La señorita Catarina Beronica A. C. tiene 19 años es soltera  vive con su hermano  ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas (tomate, pepino, lechugas manzanas etc.)  desde hace 4 años  inicio con la ayuda de su hermano quien le dio el capital ella aun estudia   su primaria por las noches su deseo es poder  crecer en su venta de verduras para poder ayudar a su hermano para poder sustentar a su familia,ella solicita el credito para la compra de verduras y verduras.
texts.en:
"DUO LOS HERMANOS" Group

The group is comprised of two people: Mr. Benjamín Basilio C., age 23, who is single.  He began a spice business selling pumpkin and sesame seeds.  For the last 11 years he had been helping his father, who passed away, so he took over the business and cares for his younger siblings by sending money to them every month.  His goal is to bring his family to live nearer and to increase his spice sales in the town market.  He will use the loan to buy spices.

Miss Catarina Beronica A. C., age 19, is single and lives with her brother who gave her the capital to begin business.  She is still studying primary school level at night.  Her dream is to expand her vegetable business to help her brother support the family.  She plans to use the loan to buy vegetables and fruit.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, fruit and spices

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela forma parte del banco comunal “Los Jardines del bosque” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco. 
Ella se dedica al rubro de la venta de joyas, desde hace 3 años. Daniela compra joyas de plata al por mayor, lo que le es más conveniente. Ella vende durante todo el año, especialmente para el día de la madre y navidad. Sin embargo las temporadas más bajas de demandas, son durante las vacaciones de verano correspondiente a los meses de enero y febrero. Daniela vende joyas puerta a puerta, aunque igual tiene sus clientes frecuentes, quienes son amigas y conocidas.
Con éste préstamo comprará joyas.
Su sueño es tener un local establecido, en el cual pueda ofrecer y vender sus joyas. Por ende sus motivaciones de continuar en el negocio, ya que además quiere brindarle a su familia una vida más confortable. 
Daniela vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 6 años y 4 meses de edad.
Daniela está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo Esperanza, ya que con éste podrá invertir mucho más en su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias. Además comenta de las facilidades de pago que éste tiene con las socias, lo que resulta muy conveniente para emprendedoras como ella. Respecto a las reuniones a las cuales participa Daniela, se siente muy a gusto, ya que le ha permitido conocer a los demás integrantes del banco comunal y le ha servido para distraerse de sus labores domesticas. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Daniela is part of the communal bank "Los Jardines del Bosque" (the gardens of the forest), in the city of Temuco. She has been selling jewelry for three years. She buys silver jewelry wholesale, which is more convenient for her. She sells jewelry all year, especially for Mother's Day and Christmas. Nevertheless, the seasons with the lowest demand are during the summer vacations, in the months of January and February. Daniela sells jewelry door to door, although she also has her regular customers. who are friends and acquaintances. She will use this loan to buy jewelry.

Her dream is to set up a store, where she could offer and sell her jewelry. Therefore she is motivated to continue with her business, since she also wants to offer her family a more comfortable life. Daniela lives with her husband and their two children, ages 6 years and 4 months.

Daniela is very happy and thankful for the loan obtained through Fondo Esperanza, since she will be able to use it to invest more in her business and obtain better earnings. She also comments on the easy payment terms that it has for the members, which are very convenient for entrepreneurs like herself. As for the group meetings in which she participates, she feels very comfortable, since they have allowed her to meet the other members of the communal bank and also served to distract her from her domestic labors.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucania region. The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago, the capital of Chile. In this area are located a series of lake resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and very showy native flora and fauna, concentrated in nearby natural parks.
