In order to have her project finished she needs to buy materials and to pay for workforce wages.

loans.use: To finish building her kitchen.

loans.name: María Belen

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por los deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país. Su gente es muy cálida, amable y trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 24  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 6 y 5 años de edad que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es electromecánico, además tiene una volqueta en la que transporta material pétreo.
 
Tiene un local en su casa en el cual vende repuestos y refacciones eléctricas para carro, ella también le vende a la gente que llevan sus vehículos para que su esposo les haga algún arreglo. Trabaja de lunes  a sábado. Los productos compra a distribuidores que llegan hasta su local. Nos cuenta que lleva en su negocio seis años y le gusta porque le permite ganarse la vida sin tener que salir de su casa y estar al tanto de sus hijos que requieren de sus cuidados.

Este crédito es para comprar repuestos eléctricos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cuatro ciclos y le gusta porque  en el banco a conocido personas que ahora son sus grandes amigas.
 
Sus sueños son tener un gran local más grande y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Dulce Amistad” (Sweet Friendship) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for its delicious sweets that the villagers make, which are recognized throughout the entire country.  The people there are very warm, kind, and hard-working.

This is the place where we meet María, age 24.  She has two children, ages six and five, and they go to school.  Her husband is an electromechanical technician.  Also, they have a dump truck that they use for transporting rocks.

She has a place in her house where she sells replacement parts and spare parts for cars.  She also sells to people who bring their vehicles to her husband to be fixed.  She works from Mondays through Saturdays.  She buys her products from distributors who come to her place.  She tells us that she has been in her business for six years.  She likes it because it allows her to earn a living without having to leave her house.  This way she can keep up with her children; they need her care.

This loan is to buy electrical replacement parts.  She has been in her communal bank during four cycles.  She likes it because she has gotten to know people in her bank that are now her best friends.

Her dreams are to have a larger place and to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy electrical replacement parts

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: La Sra. Leonor vive en la zona sur entre 5to. Anillo desde hace 10 años, ella se dedica a la venta de libros nuevos, enciclopedias, atlas, diccionarios, libros infantiles, escolares, al contado y a crédito. La Sra. Leonor se dedica a esta actividad junto a su esposo desde hace 5 años. Tienen 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar. El crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar más libros que están llegando y así poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. La Sra. Leonor  es trabajadora, responsable con los compromisos que asume, su meta al igual que la de su esposo es la superación de su familia para para darles una buena educación y que sean profesionales sus hijos, la Sra. esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Leonor has been living in the southern area of the 5th Ring for 10 years. She engages in selling new books, encyclopedias, atlases, dictionaries, children’s books and school books, and she accepts cash and credit. Leonor has been running this activity together with her husband for 5 years. They have 2 children who go to school. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more books in order to carry out all of her customers’ requests. Leonor is a hardworking woman, and she responsibly undertakes her commitments. Her goal, as well as her husband’s, is the growth of her family, by giving a good education to their children so that they will be able to become skilled professionals. Leonor is thankful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy more books.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El señor Felix A. desde hace varios años se separo de su esposa, por lo que el tuvo que llevar la responsabilidad de cuidar a sus 3 pequeños hijos que están entre 10 y 5 años de edad. Para Félix ha sido un reto ser padre y madre para estos pequeños ya que no cualquiera acepta tener este tipo de responsabilidad. El trabaja en maquiladora como ayudante de soldador desde hace 13 años por lo que hay ocasiones que se queda tiempo extra para obtener mayores ingresos para llevar a sus hijos el pan de cada día. La casa de esta persona necesita mejoras como lo es enjarrar y darle una pinatada para que se vea bien.
texts.en: Mr. Felix A. split up from his wife many years ago, and since then he has been responsible for taking care of his 3 young children, aged between 10 and 5. To Felix, being a father and a mother at the same time to these young ones has been a challenge, and not everyone would have accepted such responsibility. He has been working as assistant welder in a "maquiladora" [a bonded assembly plant set up by a foreign firm near the US border] for 13 years, and sometimes he works overtime to earn more money to provide his children with their daily meals. This borrower’s house needs improvements such as plastering and painting it to give it a better look.

loans.use: To have his house plastered and painted.

loans.name: Filerma Narciza

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por los deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país. Su gente es muy cálida, amable y trabajadora.

La señora Filerma es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene 54 años de edad, está divorciada pero de esa relación tiene cuatro hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero uno de ellos aun viven con ella. Ella aprendió hace varios años corte y confección en una Academia.

Ella es modista y tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser, confecciona todo tipo de ropa pero nos comenta que lo que más le gusta hacer en ropa de niñas y ropa casual. Trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que le encargan lo que necesitan. Labora todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, nos cuenta que lleva 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, botones, agujas, hilos, cierres y otros materiales para la costura.
 
Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y mejores máquinas.
texts.en:
The “Dulce Amistad” (Sweet Friendship) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for its delicious sweets that the villagers make, which are recognized throughout the entire country.  The people there are very warm, kind, and hard-working.

This is the place where we meet Filerma.  She is a founding member of her communal bank.  She likes it because the interest is lower than in other institutions that make loans.  She is 54, divorced, and has four children.  They are all adults, but one of them still lives with her.

Several years ago she studied dress-making in an academy.  She is a seamstress, and she has a small sewing shop where she has devoted herself to sewing for many years.  She makes all types of clothes.  However, she tells us that she likes to make clothes for girls and casual clothes the best.

She works from orders that private individuals make for what they need.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m.  Sometimes she works later when she has orders to deliver.  She tells us that she has been devoting herself to this business activity for 20 years.

She will use this new loan to buy fabric, buttons, needles, thread, zippers, and other sewing materials.

Her dreams are to have a larger shop and better machines.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, needles, thread, and zippers, etc.

loans.name: Martiniano

texts.es: El Sr. Martiniano Vive en el municipio de la Guardia, localidad de Basilio, tiene un punto internet, donde brinda servicio, también arregla radios, hace un año que a puesto su punto, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio, el destino del crédito es para comprar equipo de  computadoras para ampliar su negocio, es nacido en el departamento de Cochabamba, hace unos 30 años que llego a la ciudad, donde formo su familia, por crisis económica  su primera esposa se fue a trabajar a España, donde formo otra vida, el quedo con sus hijos pequeño lo cual el los crio, ahora ya son independientes y por lo tanto el convive recién con su nueva esposa; se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo económico brindado.
texts.en: Martiniano lives in the La Guardia neighborhood of the town of Basilio. He offers Internet services and he also repairs radios. He has been running his Internet café for one year, and his wife helps him in the shop. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more computers to expand his activity. He was born in the Cochabamba department and some 30 years ago he came to La Guardia, where he started his family. Due to the economic crisis, his first wife went working in Spain, where she started a new life. He was left with his young children and he raised them: they are now economically independent, and so he has recently stated living with his new wife. He is thankful to the institution for the economic support provided.

loans.use: To buy more computers.

loans.name: Grey Del Rocío

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por los deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país. Su gente es muy cálida, amable y trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Grey, tiene 39 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 21, 18, 16 y 11 años de edad, estudian dos de ellos en Universidad, uno en colegio y otro en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Es un ama de casa que se dedica a la venta sandalias, agua en bidón y  productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella tiene un pequeño local en su casa donde vende todos sus productos aunque a veces también sale a hacer sus recorridos, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00 y lleva 6 años dedicada a esta actividad.
 
Este crédito es para comprar sandalias, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener una farmacia.
texts.en:
The “Dulce Amistad” (Sweet Friendship) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for its delicious sweets that the villagers make, which are recognized throughout the entire country.  The people there are very warm, kind, and hard-working.

This is the place where we meet Grey, age 39.  She is married and has four children; ages 21, 18, 16, and 11.  Two of them attend the university, one is in high school, and the other attends primary school.  Her husband is a driver.

She is a housewife who sells sandals, toilet water, and Avon products (beauty products like cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  She has a small place in her house where she sells all of her products.  Sometimes she also leaves to make her deliveries.  She works every day from 8:30 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  She has been engaged in this business activity for six years.

This loan is to buy sandals, perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and creams.  She has been in the communal bank for four cycles.  She likes it for the help she receives with the loans.

Her dream is to have a pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy sandals, perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and creams

loans.name: Letty Cecibel

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por los deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país. Su gente es muy cálida, amable y trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Letty, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen  una hija de tres años y bebé de 8 meses de edad. Su esposo es Ing. Civil. Ella es maestra en una institución privada en Rocafuerte.

Se dedica también al comercio, vende artículos para el hogar como planchas, licuadoras, tostadoras, ventiladores, etc. por catalogo. Nos cuenta que trabaja dos horas al día y también aprovecha su tiempo en la escuela para venderles a  otras maestras y a madres de familia que llegan hasta la institución. Lleva año y medio que se dedica  a esta actividad y empezó su negocio con el primer crédito que recibió del banco.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar artículos para el hogar como: planchas, tostadoras, licuadoras, ventiladores, etc. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 ciclos y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella pudo financiar  su negocio.

Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
In the Rocafuerte canton the members of the Dulce Amistad [Sweet Friendship] community bank meet every two weeks. The area is known for its delicious candies prepared by the locals, and they are very well known throughout the country. Its people are warm, friendly and hardworking. 

Here we met Letty. She is 30 years old, married and has one three year old daughter and an eight month old baby. Her husband is a civil engineer and she is a teacher at a private institution in Rocafuerte.

She is also a merchant. She sells items for the home, such as irons, toasters, fans, etc. via catalogue. She tells us that she works two hours a day and she also uses her time at the school to sell to other teachers and to the mothers who come to the institution. She has been doing this for a year and a half and she started the business with the first loan she received from the bank. 

She will use this loan to buy itmes for the home such as: irons, toasters, blenders, fans, etc. She has been in the community bank for 4 cycles and she likes it because thanks to the loans, she was able to finance her business. 

Her dream is to open a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy irons, toasters, blenders, fans, etc.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por los deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país. Su gente es muy cálida, amable y trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 35 años, es  casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 14 y 11 años  de edad, todos estudian en colegio. Su esposo es chofer y trabaja en el Municipio de Rocafuerte.

Es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares se dedica al comercio, vende productos por catalogo de la marca Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días de dos a tres horas al dia de preferencia en las mañanas, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Nos cuenta que este tipo de negocio recién empezó en este año y que gracias al crédito pudo financiarlo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 8 ciclos y le gusta por las posibilidades que le brinda para seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y que sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Dulce Amistad (Sweet Friendship) community bank meet in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweet treats which the locals make and which are well known throughout the country.  The people are very warm, kind and hard working.

Here we meet 35 year-old María who is married and has three children aged 17, 14 and 11.  They are all in school.  María's husband is a driver and works for the City of Rocafuerte.

María is a very good mother and housewife who, in order to help her husband with their household expenses, sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories) through a catalog.  She works every day of the week, for two or three hours each day.  She prefers to work mornings.  María leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every week or every two weeks, according to her customers' preference.  She tells us that she started this business this year and, thanks to a loan, she was able to finance it.

María will use this loan to buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams.  She has been a member of her community bank for 8 loan cycles and she likes being a member because it provides her with possibilities to continue growing in her business.

María's dream is to see her children finish school and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry

loans.name: Nora Helen

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo en el Km # 5 vía Manta se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Loma De Los Vientos, aquí la mayoría de su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nora. Tiene 35 años, es casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es profesor.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos Esika y Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería, y accesorios de damas), trabaja de tres a cuatro días  a la semana, sus productos los vende a crédito y realiza los cobros los fines de semana. También se dedica a la venta de joyas de plata al mismo tiempo que ofrece sus otros productos, nos cuenta que este negocio lo empezó con el crédito anterior y que le está yendo muy bien.

Este crédito es para  comprar joyas de plata, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos.  Es socia fundadora del Banco Comuna y le gustan los créditos ya que la ayudan mucho para salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para realizar sus ventas en otros lugares.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the Loma de Los Vientos community bank meets on the outskirts of Portoviejo, 5km from the city, on the road to Manta.  Most people here farm and raise livestock.

Here we meet 35 year-old Nora who is married and has three children.  Two of her children are in high school and her youngest is in elementary school.  Nora's husband is a teacher.

Nora sells Esika and Yanbal products (beauty products, perfume and ladies' accessories).  She works three or four days a week.  She sells her products on credit and collects payment on weekends.  Nora also sells silver jewelry at the same time as she sells her other products.  She tells us that she started her business with her previous loan and that it is going very well.

Nora will use this loan to buy silver jewelry, perfume, creams and cosmetics.  She is a founding member of her community bank and she likes the loans because they help her a lot in getting ahead in life.

Nora's dream is to buy a car so that she can sell her products in other places.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry, perfume, creams and cosmetics

loans.name: Mayra Katherine

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo en el Km # 5 vía Manta se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Loma De Los Vientos, aquí la mayoría de su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Mayra, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una niña de seis  años de edad la  misma que estudia en escuela. El marido realiza trabajos de carga en una comercial.
 
Ella es una gran ama de casa que se dedica al comercio en sociedad con su cuñado, venden todo tipo de artículos o mercadería de temporada, en la actualidad están dedicados  a la venta de útiles escolares, tienen un puesto en Manta aunque hay días que también venden en Portoviejo. Trabajan todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 16h00, pero ella solo trabaja hasta las 12h00 ya que tiene que ir  a hacerse cargo de su hija que a esa hora sale de la escuela. La mercadería la compran en Guayaquil.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar útiles escolares  para aprovechar la temporada de entrada a clases. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta ya que los créditos le ayudan mucho en su negocio.

Su sueño es tener casa propia y bien construida.
texts.en:
In the suburbs of Portoviejo, at Km 5 in the direction of Manta, the members of the Loma De Los Vientos (Windy Hill) Community Bank meet every two weeks. It’s an area where people are mainly engaged in agriculture and in raising animals.

23-year old Sra. Mayra is a member of the Bank. She lives with her partner and their 6-year old daughter who attends school. Mayra’s partner works loading freight for a company.

She is an excellent housewife who also runs a business with her brother-in-law selling all kinds of seasonal items. At the moment they are selling school supplies. They have a stall in Manta although sometimes they go to Portoviejo to sell their products. They work every day from 8am to 4pm, although Mayra has to leave at noon to look after her daughter who leaves school at that time. They buy their merchandise in Guayaquil.

Mayra will use the loan to buy school supples and make the most of the upcoming start to the school year. She has been a member of the Bank since the beginning and enjoys it. The loans have helped her greatly with her business. Her dream is to have a well-built house of her own.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita B. is from the village of Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 29 years old. Esterlita is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Esterlita sells wild-caught fish in the local community. Esterlita is just starting this business.

In 2010, Esterlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. 

Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Esterlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 47 years old and married to Efren B.. They have five adult children.

Elizabeth owns and operates a “sari-sari” (variety) store. She has been engaged in her business for 30 years since she married her husband. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In December 2005, Elizabeth joined Paglaum MPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC.

Elizabeth is now requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products to sell and to buy housing materials for her house improvement. This will be her 10th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: used to buy more products to sell and to buy materials to improve her house

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia C. is from the village of Molicay, Ozamiz City. She is 51 years old. Virginia is married and has four adult children. 

To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a General Store. She has been engaged in this business for three years and makes approximately  7,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Virginia is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which to purchase variety of products like can goods, shampoo, soap, toothpaste for her general store business. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to improve her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase variety of products like can goods, shampoo, soap, toothpaste for her general store business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia F. is from the village of Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 60 years old. Virginia is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette P. is 40 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and her three small children. Bernadette works as a cultivator of her own farm. She planted different crops to sell in their market. She has been engaged in this activity for more than 10 years.

In 2009, Bernadette joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadette has successfully repaid her previous loan of Php14,500. She is now requesting a new loan of Php35,000 as her fifth loan, which will be used to invest in a cocoland (a piece of land planted with coconut trees).   

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in a cocoland (a piece of land planted with coconut trees)

loans.name: Mulya Sari Group

texts.en:
Mulya Sari Group is a group of women who are located in rural areas and consists of 12 members. Ni Ketut I. W., trusted by the members, became chairman of the group.

Ni Ketut I. W. has been raising pigs since she married 15 years ago because the business can help the family income. Ni Ketut I. W. had four children who are still enrolled in  school. Her husband worked as a brick maker, but because his business went bankrupt, her husband finally migrated to Sulawesi, to look for a new source of revenue.
 
Ni Ketut I. W. proposes to venture into capital loans to buy piglets and feed. This loan will be used to purchase two piglets at Rp. 350,000 per pig and the rest will be used to buy feed. The profits will be used to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets at  Rp. 350,000 each and pig feed.

loans.name: Ildefonso

texts.en:
Mr. Ildefonso R. is from the village of Malaubang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 46 years old, married and blessed with two school-age children. To make a living, he has a hog-raising business. He also is engaged in seaweed production (commonly known Guso seaweed). He has been engaged in these businesses for more than five years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Just this year, Ildefonso joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is now requesting his first loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used for building an additional pigpen. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family, especially for their basic needs, savings, insurance and possible business expansion.

 About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

The coop teaches its members to have a "livelihood project," or business, in order to become productive and self-reliant. At this time, her husband drives a tricycle they bought with a loan that they have since paid off. 

Now, she is applying for PHP 45,000 to buy additional goods for sale and a franchise for their tricycle.

In 2006, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php 14,900. She is requesting a new loan of Php 17,000 as her 7th loan which will be used for house repair.

Gemma has sustained her business through her past eleven loans from NWTF. She is borrowing 11,000 PHP more through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell in her stall.

Gemma hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Florita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Florita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florita has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Vilma Curambao's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vilma C. is 39 years old and married with four school-aged children. She is from Cogon, Ozamis City. Vilma is the leader of a two-member loan group with PMPC called Vilma C.’s Group. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Vilma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling a variety of products to local community members. This is a new business for Vilma and she earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. Vilma joined PMPC in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC and is now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory for her business. This will be her third loan with PMPC. Vilma plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta K. is 50 years old and married with one adult child. She is from the village of Tabuk-Tulay, Dicayas. To make a living, Modesta owns and operates a tailoring business providing general alterations and tailoring services to local community members. Modesta has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. She also runs a sari-sari (variety store) and food vending business.

Modesta is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP to acquire a rice field. This will be Modesta’s thirteenth loan with PMPC. loans.name: Merlinda

Merlinda operates a mini-boutique with goods from Zamboanga City as her main products. Together with her husband, she opened up a stall in one of the malls of the city. She has been in this kind of business for the past four years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. 

Merlinda joined PMPC in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from PMPC. Merlinda is now requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to be buy more clothes for her mini-boutique business. 

Merlinda plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family and better meet their basic needs. She also would like to save for the future and pay for her child’s education as well as repay loans, purchase insurance and, possibly, expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her mini-boutique

loans.name: Gil

texts.en:
Meeting life’s challenges head on is a habit that can developed only by the brave. Gil B., 40, does just that. Gil finished his college education and manages his own sari sari (variety) store in an extension of his house. He is single and lives with his mother, Regina, who is also helping him in running the store. Together, they live in the barangay of Munting Ilog within the municipality of Silang, a part of Cavite province on the Luzon islands.

Every day Gil observes the buying patterns of his customers and notes their preferences in terms of the types of items they buy, the price, and the brand. He sees to it that his customers get what they desire. He also incorporates school supplies and retails cell phone load credits to all mobile network users. Serving his local community, Gil earns an estimated net income of around 12,000 PHP a month .

To help him continue operation of his business, Gill would like to apply for a 14,000 PHP loan. As needed, he will buy more stocks of rice, soft drinks, and other grocery items.

Gil acknowledges that no challenges are too hard to deal with. He knows that the Lord will enable him to overcome and uphold the future of both his family and his business. He dreams of growing his sari sari store.

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans. As a CCT community partner, Gil faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship meetings where he can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he receives.

loans.use: To pay for additional grocery items for his store

loans.name: Serina

texts.en:
Serina C. is 54 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Tabo-o in Jimenez municipality, a part of Misamis Occidental province in the Mindanao islands. Serina is a farmer who primarily grows and harvests rice. Serina has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Serina joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. She has successfully repaid a previous loan, her sixth from GDMPC of 30,000 PHP which was used for additional capital for her business. Serina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en:
Ariunaa D., 46, is married and lives with her husband and two sons in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband is a welder who specializes in making household products such as ovens, cups, spoons, forks, etc. Ariunaa manages a grocery business in her town. She started her business in 1996 as a mobile grocery business, meaning that she used to pick up orders from her customers and bring their orders to their home.

As her business became stable and profitable, she managed to open a grocery store in her town. Her two sons help with both of the family businesses. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase grocery items and metals for their businesses.

Ariunaa and her family are very hardworking people who have become well-known for their honest and excellent services. She says, "I am very thankful to Xacbank for providing me a loan necessary to opening my grocery store."

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and metals

loans.name: Benia

texts.en:
Benia is 53 years old and has nine children.  She is married and still has two children who are in school.

Benia is in the agricultural business raising livestock (chickens, a cow, a water buffalo, goats, and pigs) in the Philippines. Benia requested a PHP 14,000.00 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and an additional pig to raise and sell.

Benia has been raising livestock for eight years now and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Benia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed, vitamins, and an additional pig to raise.

loans.name: Chuluuntsetseg

texts.en:
Chuluuntsetseg Z. is a 36-year-old widow who lives with her mother and only son in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her son, age ten, goes to the local secondary school.

Chuluuntsetseg operates a women's wear trading business at a rented stall at Narantuul, one of the biggest and most crowded markets in Ulaanbaatar. She started her business in 2005. It has become stable and much more profitable compared with the early years of her business. She is planning to expand and continue her business in the future. Her monthly sales presently reach 300,000 MNT.

Chuluuntsetseg is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory in order to increase her collection of clothes to sell. She is a diligent woman who says, "I want to have my own booth in the future."

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Meeting life's challenges head on is a habit that could be developed only by the brave. Gertrudes T., 61, does just like that. Gertrudes is only a high school graduate but right now she manages her own micro-business as she learns entrepreneurship as a community partner in CCT. She is married to a carpenter, Albino, and mothers her only child, who is now working. Together, they live in Biluso, Silang, Cavite, Philippines. 

Gertrudes runs her own sari-sari (variety) store located in an extension of their house. Every day she observes the buying patterns of her customers and notes down their preferences in terms of the type of item they buy, the price, and the brand. She sees to it that her customers get what they prefer. Monthly, Gertrudes earns an estimated net income of around 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). 

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She intends to meet the demands of her customers. As needed, she will buy more stocks of rice, soft drinks, and other grocery items. 

Gertrudes acknowledges that no challenges are too hard to deal with. She knows that the Lord will enable her to overcome and uphold the future of both her children and her business. She dreams of making her sari-sari store grow. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received. 

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items for her store

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 31 years old and married with three children. 

Candelaria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell. 

Candelaria has borrowed and repaid loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling of palm toddy. 

Candelaria aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Enelita

texts.en: Enelita is married and runs a general store in the Philippines. She works hard to support her six children. Enelita is requesting an 1,800 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cook stove. She wants to save money by using the dried wood from nearby trees and limit the amount of money her family spends on charcoal. Enelita is aware that by using an Envirofit cook stove she is not only saving money but also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit cook stove

In the future, Kristi Colleen would like to develop and expand her business and save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.name: Munhtsetseg

Munhtsetseg is 37 years old and lives with her son and other relatives in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Govi-Altai province, Mongolia. Since then, she has been able to expand her business and she recently began renting an additional stall. Now, Munhtsetseg’s working capital exceeds 2,500,000 MNT. 

Munhtsetseg is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes from China. She is planning to have her own container where she can conduct her business independently. Munhtsetseg is an open-minded and polite woman who says, “I am planning to expand my business in the future.”

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a fishing business in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy fishing gear and equipment. She has been in this line of work for 25 years and supplements her income by selling some of the fish she catches to people who live in her community. Her goals are to repair and renovate her home and earn enough money to send her children to college.
